loans.use: Buy 1000 kilos of dried corn from farmers to export.
loans.name: Yenny Maria

texts.en:
Yenny is a member of the Virgen Asunta Village Bank in the town of Urco, just outside the larger town of Calca and about an hour from the city of Cusco. Yenny is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two young children. Yenny buys dried corn from local farmers, which she then sells to intermediaries for export. She has been in this business for the past five years, and has been a client of Asociacion Arariwa for about the same time. She started out with a loan of just 300 soles (US $95) and has been able to expand her business significantly since then.

Yenny is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy 1000 kilos of dried corn. She has a vision to start a new business in the future. She wants to open a small pharmacy and Internet cafe in Calca. The town currently lacks these services. Yenny has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop
loans.name: Ramzana M.waryam Group

texts.en:
Ramzana baji is the wife of M. W. who lives in Vehari, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the last 14 years. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community where people come to buy groceries for their houses. He has four years of experience in this business. Ramzana baji also runs an animal food selling business. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount. Ramzana baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Hajran baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji wants a loan to buy another sewing machine for her tailoring center. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and beauty products
loans.name: Loisi

texts.es:
LOISI R. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “CARMEN CABREJOS” con domicilio en el Jr. Adolfo morey N° 667 del distrito de Callería, tiene 36 años, 04 hijos, y su esposo tiene trabajo como chofer de obras en la municipalidad.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y productos de belleza y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 5 años, con él compro algunas prendas para venderlos en los pueblos rurales por el río.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir y también productos de belleza que posteriormente irá a vender a las afueras de la ciudad

En el tiempo que trabaja con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y sobre todo en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
LOISI R. V. belongs to the Banco Comunal "Carmen Carbrejos." Her domicile is at 667 Adolfo Morey Street, Callería district. She is thirty-six years old and has four children. Her husband works as a driver for construction projects in the city. She has a business selling clothes and beauty products. The first time she obtained a loan of $100 was five years ago, and she used the money to purchase garments, which she sold in rural towns along the river. She will invest this loan of $675 in a variety of garments and beauty products, which she will sell in areas outside of the city. In the time that she has worked with Manuela Ramos, she is happy about the aid given to women to raise their standard of living and, above all, to help with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise
loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es una mujer de 28 años muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa, la cual trae desde las ciudades de Tacna (sur del Perú) y Desaguadero (frontera con Bolivia). Marina es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse algo a casa y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre qué prenda les queda mejor. Lleva 5 años en esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder ir a ningún lado, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo, espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y pueda tener una tienda de ropa más grande. Este el primer préstamo de Marina con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa y así podrá incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Marina is a 28 year old woman, who is very simple and hard-working. She lives in a rented room and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Her stand is located in the market of San Jose (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She sells clothes, which she brings to the cities of Tacna (south of Peru) and Desaguadero (on the border with Bolivia). Marina is a very persuasive seller and always convinces her clients to buy something. What she likes most about her work is talking with her clients and advising them about what clothing is best for them. She has spent 5 years in this activity and what she likes least is having to spend all day at her stand without being able to go anywhere, even though she knows that this is her work and she has to do it. She hopes that in the future her business grows and that she can have a bigger clothing store. This is her first loan with MFP and she is ready to pay all of the installments on time, since she wants to take out other loans later. In her community bank, she is a very responsible and is an active member. With the 1000 new soles she has requested, she will buy more clothing and, in this way, she will be able to increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of vegetables.
loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de 09 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Emprendió su negocio de Venta de verduras, se inicio con un capital de           S/. 150.00. Nos cuenta que no le fue fácil implementar su negocio, esta ubicada en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad, un puesto que ocupó con mucho esfuerzo, ya que no le fue fácil obtenerlo, hoy en día esta muy contenta por lo logrado.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, donde sus principales clientes son moradores de la comunidad y amigos que ya conocen el trabajo que realiza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará racimos de plátano, sacos de yucas  y camote.

Santos, aprendido a tomar sus propias decisiones,  tanto en lo personal como en su negocio. Nos manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos belongs to "Banco Comunal "Mujeres Emprendedoras", District of Moyobamba, Province Moyobamba, Departmetn of San Martín. She is married, 56 years old, a mother of 9 who are all independent.

She started a business selling vegetables with a capital of S/.150.00. She tells us that it was not easy to get her business started, it is located on the central market, "Mercado Central" of the town, she got the stall with much effort as it is not easy to obtain one, and today she is very happy because of her success. Presently she has the same business and most of her clients are inhabitants of the community and friends who are all aware of her work.

With this loan of S/.2,500.00 she will buy bunches of banana, sacks of yucca and sweet potato. Mrs. Santos has learned to make her own decisions, personally as well as businesswise. She expresses her gratefulness to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy electrical appliances to sell
loans.name: Tidjani Shaibu

texts.en: Tidjani Shaibu A. sells electrical appliances at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. Tidjani Shaibu has received technical institutional training.  He is married and has 10 dependents. His wife is a trader. Tidjani Shaibu has been selling electrical appliances since 1993. He is responsible for paying school fees. His loan will be used to buy electrical appliances to sell. He hopes to reinvest his new profits in his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and/or products
loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Primavera” trabaja junto a  Pro-Mujer hace cinco años,  a la fecha  cuenta con doce socias activas, cada dos semanas se reúnen en el centro focal Villa Exaltación, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta plásticos, víveres, abarrotes, shampoo,  también se dedican a la elaboración de almuerzos, los cuales los venden en pensiones. Necesitan capital para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería  o productos, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer bienestar a sus familias
texts.en:
The group called "Primavera" (Spring) has worked with Pro Mujer for five years. To date they have twelve active members who meet every two weeks at the Villa Exaltación center, which is located in the city of El Alto. They have different businesses such as selling plastic, supplies, groceries, and shampoo. Some of them also make food, which they sell at boarding houses. They need capital to be able to buy a larger quantity of merchandise or products. In this way they will generate more income that will let them offer their families well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of plastic bags
loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Amivi est une vendeuse ambulante de sachets en plastique. Ce commerce lui permet de se prendre en charge. Elle n’est pas mariée et elle n’a pas non plus d’enfant à sa charge. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2004 dans le quartier Avénou à Lomé. Elle vend le plus souvent ses sachets à des vendeuses de tapioca, de farine, de maïs et bien d’autres produits alimentaires. Actuellement il ne lui reste que très peu de sachets ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 60 pièces de pros sachets noirs, 65 pièces de petits sachets noirs, 65 pièces de petits sachets blancs transparents, 60 pièces de sachets « bafana » pour les objets pesants.
texts.en:
Amivi sells plastic bags as she walks around town. Her business permits her to take of herself. She is not married and does not have any children to care for. She started her business in 2004 in the neighborhood of Avénou in Lomé. She mostly sells her bags to tapioca, flour, corn and other food salespeople.

Right now she does not have many bags left; this is why she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance group WAGES, in order to purchase 60 large black bags, 65 small black bags, 65 small transparent-white bags and 60 "bafana" bags for heavy objects.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his auto
loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny es un joven trabajador de 28 años, vive con su esposa, Doris, y sus hijos; Alexander de 13 y Válerie de 12, en su casa propia. Desde muy joven aprendió a conducir auto, desde entonces, esta actividad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de sustento económico, con la cual solventa los gastos de toda su familia. Generalmente sale muy temprano por la mañana a “taxear”, como él lo llama, y termina a las 6 o 7 de la noche, llegando muy cansado a su hogar. Jhonny trabaja con muchas ganas y energía, y esa alegría les transmite a sus pasajeros, de los que ya tiene varios clientes fieles. 
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se compromete pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita será utilizado en la reparación de algunas fallas mecánicas de su auto para que pueda brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Jhonny is a hard working, 28 year old young man. He lives with his wife, Doris, and their children. Alexander is 13 and Válerie is 12. They live in their own house. He learned to drive a car when he was very young. Since then he converted this activity into his primary source of income, which he uses to pay all of the family’s expenses. He generally leaves very early in the morning to “taxear” (taxi around), as he calls it. He finishes at six or seven at night; he arrives home very tired. Jhonny works with great passion and energy. This happiness is transmitted to his passengers. He already has many loyal customers. This is his second loan with MFP. He promises to make his payments punctually. He will use the money he is now asking for to repair some mechanical problems with his car. He will do this to be able to offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business
loans.name: Fiona

texts.en:
Fiona M. is 24 years old and is married with two children. The first is two years old and the second is eight months of age.  Fiona lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Fiona owns a small shop which has sold different kinds of products since 2008. She employs one person in her business which she operates every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. Before starting this business she was a housewife and was not able to provide all her family’s needs.

With this loan, Fiona plans to expand her business which, through the increased profits, will help her to change the life of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell
loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is 58 years old and married with 7 children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to pull her business and family above poverty. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell
loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor M. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Eleonor is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonor operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling shrimp and other varieties of fish in the local community. Eleonor has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eleonor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleonor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Eleonor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Eleonor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.use: To purchase small sheep
loans.name: Zinhora

texts.en:
K. Zinhora is 37 years old, married and has three children. The difficult circumstances and hardships of her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. 

For about 11 years, Zinhora has been purchasing young sheep in the local market, fattening them, and then selling them at local markets. Zinhora is a very hardworking woman and her diligence is incredible. She works with strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income for her family. Thanks to her business she is able to support her children's education. Zinhora wants to continue educating them because she hopes that they will reach the goals she laid out for herself. 

For this purpose, she is requesting a loan of $1100 USD to buy small sheep in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change lives.   

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase apparel
loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de  01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Teresa, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, que se dedica a la venta de mercería y lleva 01 año en el negocio, poco a poco, siguió adelante la cual esto le dieron muy buenos resultados. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará mercadería de ropas, para su stock como: pantalones, shores, blusas, chompas.

Teresa, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa L. is a member of the El Triunfo Communal Bank in the San Hilarion district of the San Martin province and department. She is a 30-year-old woman with a live-in partner and a dependent child who is currently in school.

Teresa is a hardworking woman who has been selling notions for a year. She has been able to get ahead little by little, getting great results. With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, she will purchase apparel, such as pants, shorts, shirts and sweaters.

Teresa is an example for many female small business owners; with perseverance, they shall realize their dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her launch her own business and for helping other women grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his retail and taxi business
loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 37 years old and operates a "boda boda" (motorcycle taxi) business. Through his previous KES 40,000 loan, he was able to buy a motorbike and expand stock for his retail shop, which is his other source of income. With this KES 80,000 loan, he plans to expand his business and open another shop. Joseph is widowed and has a 9-year-old daughter named Mary, who attends school. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy fabric, needles, buttons and zippers
loans.name: Luz Del Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz del Esfuerzo lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras que desde su niñez tuvieron que aprender a ganarse el pan de cada día. Una de ellas es Silvia Alejandra C. O. quien se dedica a la costura oficio que aprendió de su madre. Esta joven de 27 años desde hace tres años tiene su propio taller el cual construyo gracias a que con los prestamos que obtuvo en  adim sus ganancias aumentaron.

En este nuevo año O. desea seguir progresando y gracias a Dios tiene muchos trabajos por lo cual requiere del préstamo para comprar materia prima como telas, hilos, zipper, botones
 
 La señora Vilma R. N. de 55 años  asegura que desde que tiene uso de razón hace y vende nacatamales, tortillas y cosa de horno. Esto lo aprendió en su hogar por madre y abuela quienes le instruyeron el arte culinario. Mientras María Catalina O. de 55 años vende guineo en un tramo del mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
The group Luz de Esfuerzo is made of three hard-working women who had to learn to make a living since childhood. One of them, Silvia Alejandra C. O. is a seamstress, a skill she learned from her mother. She is 27 years old and forthe last year has had her own shop which was built thanks to the loans she has taken out and her increased earnings. In the new year O. would like to continue making progress. Thanks to God she has a lot of work which means she needs a loan to buy basic materials such as fabric, needles, zippers and buttons. La señora Vilma R. N. is 55 years old and since she was first able to, she has sold nacatamales (corn mash and filling wrapped in banana leaves and steamed), tortillas and other baked goods. She learned how to do this at home from her mother and grandmother who taught her all about the culinary arts. Also, Maria Catalina O. is 55 years old and she sells bananas from a small stretch of the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell
loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian H. is 25 years old and married to a charcoal burner. They have three school-aged children. Lilian is currently in the business of selling bread, charcoal and groundnut paste, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: For advancing her small-scale commerce
loans.name: Marème

texts.fr: Marème F. est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a 4 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de bijoux et ses bénéfices lui servent à renforcer ses épargnes et à participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Marème F., aged 43, is a married woman who is a mother with one child to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for two years and has had four loan experiences. She has a small business involving jewelry, and she uses her profits for bolstering her savings and for helping to meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a camera
loans.name: New Day Business Group

texts.en: New Day Business is a group of five borrowers led by George B. M.. He is 38 years old, is married, and has three children aged 7 to 18 years old with educational levels of kindergarten through 6th grade. George was not able to finish college because of a lack of financial support. George runs a photography business, offering services such as taking passport photos and taking pictures for special occasions. He has been running this business for more than ten years and hopes to own a photo studio in the near future. George says he does high-quality work in order to persuade customers to continue patronizing his business. George will use this loan to purchase another camera to improve his business. George dreams of giving his family a better life. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business
loans.name: Susanita's Group

texts.en: Susanita C. is from the village of Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Susanita is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Susanita is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Susanita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Susanita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Susanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susanita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susanita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more textile materials for her tailoring work.
loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence C. is a 45-year-old industrious lady married to Mr. Benard, who runs a laundry business. They have three children. Christabel and Francis are in secondary school and Festus is in primary school. They stay in Shinyalu estate in Kakamega town.

Florence has been in the tailoring business for the last seven years. She runs her business from Shibuye market in Kakamega town. She learned about KADET Ltd through a friend who is an existing client. This is her third loan from KADET Ltd and she hopes to use the money to increase her stock of materials for tailoring work. 

She aspires to open a wholesale shop selling textile materials and to diversify to sugarcane farming to increase the scale of her business.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his microbus
loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleimen is 47 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife, Janar gets disability payments from the government. His three oldest children attend secondary school and his youngest daughter is in kindergarten. Suleimen operates a transportation business with his minibus. He transports local residents from Bayan-Ulgii province to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia as well as between other provinces. He has successfully operated his business since 2006 and has a loyal customer base. This year he has been transporting his customers between Bayan-Ulgii and Hovd provinces. His minibus has 10 seats and the cost per person is 15,000 tugrugs (~ 10 USD) for a one-way trip. Suleimen's monthly profit is between 240,000 and 300,000 tugrugs (~175  - 220 USD). Suleimen is an experienced driver and a good husband and father to his family. He says, “My family is my treasure. I would like to provide a better life for my family.” He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~ 220 USD) loan to purchase two tires for his microbus.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding
loans.name: Mr. Chab Pauk Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan has six people who live in Anlong Tasek Kraum village in Kandal province. Mr. Chab P. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. Ra S., are farmers who own a plot of land to grow rice for supporting their family. In order to improve his family's living standards, he wants to start a new business, but he does not have enough money. Thus, Mr. Chab P. decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding. He is a father of four children of whom all are studying in local public school.

loans.use: Purchase of products (sugar, rice, flour and other items)
loans.name: Adriano Simao

texts.pt:
Adriano Simão N. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 34 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 10, 07, 04 e 01 anos, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Fez 9a classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta uma cunhada que vive com ele. 
Nunca saiu de Boane, cresceu e casou se neste Distrito. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 4 anos, vende mais arroz que compra por 500.00mt o saco e vende por 750.00mt. Não possui nenhum empregado trabalha com ajuda da esposa e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.200.00mt a 1.500.00mt por dia que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária e através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de Poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da chapa que esta patente em frente do escritório na sucursal de Boane e decidiu solicitar o seu 1° credito. Este é seu 1° empréstimo no valor de 10.200.00mt com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, farinha e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar a sua residência e adquirir um meio de transporte para ajudar a transportar a sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Adriano Simão N. was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. He is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 10, 7, 4 and 1 years old. The two oldest children attend school. Adriano studied through 9th grade, and didn't continue because a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and helps to support his sister-in-law who lives with them. Adriano never left Boane, he grew up there and was married there. He has owned his own business for more than 4 years, selling rice that he buys for 500 Meticales a bag and can sell for 750 Meticales a bag. He doesn't have any employees but with the help of his wife he earns between 1200 and 1500 Meticales a day. He uses this money to pay for household expenses, and also saves some money each month through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Adriano has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] when he saw the sign outside of the Hluvuku office in Boane and he decided to apply for a loan. This is his first loan, for the amount of 10,200 Meticales. He plans to use this money to buy products (rice, sugar, flour and others) in order to increase his stock of merchandise. Adriano promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to expand his house and to purchase a vehicle to help transport his merchandise.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, juice, sodas, beans, sugar, rice, and plantains.
loans.name: Progreso De Esperanza 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Esperanza is the coordinator of her group Progreso D. Esperanza (Progress of Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsuL.,where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her child.

Esperanza is excited to be taK. her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to uS. this loan to invest in her business running a small "colmado" or general store by purchasing bread, juice, sodas, beans, sugar, rice, and plantains to stock her store. She will uS. the profits to invest in school supplies for her children as well as construction materials for her home. Finally, she would also like to save enough to rent a location for her business so that she can move it out of her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Buy pigs to sell
loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 23 años se dedica a la compra y venta de animales en la feria ganadera de su zona. En un inicio vendía animales de ganado vacuno, pero en la actualidad también vende ovejas y cerdos, en menor proporción, que  compra y luego revende a un mayor precio. Los animales que le sobran de sus ventas los tiene en su casa para engordarlos y venderlos, después  a un mejor precio, durante los fines de semana. Para desarrollar esta labor y transporte de sus animales cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. La comercialización de animales es muy rentable, y ha decidido incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es la 11ava vez  que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible  el préstamo porque  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Vilma tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de cantidad de cerdos, pues quiere aumentar la comercialización de éstos animales.
texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. For 23 years, she has been buying and selling animals at the local livestock fair. She started selling cattle, but at the moment she also sells sheep and pigs to a lesser extent. Vilma purchases the animals and then sells them at a higher price. She takes home any animals that remain unsold and fattens them to sell later for a better price, usually on the weekends. Vilma relies on the help of her children to carry out her business and transport the animals. Selling animals is a profitable business, so she has decided to increase her operating capital.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP. Vilma promises to be responsible with all of her payments and thanks everyone who made this loan possible because it will be useful in advancing her business. With the money she requested, Vilma plans to buy a large quantity of pigs because she wants to increase her sales of this type of animal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes, sports clothing, men's shirts and perfumes ordered by customers
loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es:
Dina Luz Pérez vive en el barrio Ciudadela Metropolitana, Municipio de Soledad muy cerca a Barranquilla; como Dina Luz  tiene a su cargo sus dos hijos de 4 y 10 años, trabaja muy duro para sostenerlos con su negocio de vender mercancías variadas,  como colonias, calzado clásico y deportivo, suéteres y relojes. Ella vende su mercancía a crédito y se la pagan de acuerdo al plan de pago acordado con sus clientes, entre los que se encuentran vecinos, familiares, amigos,  pero ella elige como sus clientes, principalmente a gente que tenga un ingreso y pueda responderle pagándole la mercancía que ella le acredita.

Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo invertirá en la compra de calzado, ropa deportiva, camisas para hombres y perfumes que tiene encargados por parte de clientes referidos. Está muy  satisfecha de que el negocio sirva para sostener su núcleo familiar y por eso ella se esfuerza para hacerlo crecer y brindarle a sus dos pequeños las mejores oportunidades que ella pueda; esa fue justamente  la razón por la cual,  lo inició y le ha dado un buen resultado, porque sus ingresos gradualmente han aumentado y   mas adelante tiene como meta   adquirir su propia vivienda y para eso Dina Luz se prepara día a día.
texts.en:
Dina Luz Pérez lives in the Ciudadela Metropolitana neighborhood of the Municipality of Soledad, very close to Barranquilla. Because Dina Luz has two young children in her care, aged 4 and 10, she works very hard to support them with her business of selling assorted merchandise such as cologne, traditional and athletic shoes, sweaters and watches. She sells her merchandise on credit, and her customers follow an agreed-upon payment plan. Her customers include neighbors, family members and friends, but she principally seeks out clients who have a steady income and are able to make the payments for the merchandise she sells them on credit. This is her third loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and she will invest it in buying shoes, sports clothing, men's shirts and perfumes, which have been ordered by customers referred to her. She is very satisfied with the way her business allows her to support her nuclear family, and for this reason she is working hard to make it grow, in order to provide her two little ones with the best opportunities she can. This is precisely the reason why she started the business, and it has given her good results, because her income has gradually been increasing. Her goal for the future is to acquire her own home, and Dina Luz is preparing for this day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies, seeds and small equipment
loans.name: Wolale I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WOLALE I  est un regroupement des femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la préfecture de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 46  ans et au moins 8  enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide du fonio et du sésame. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe WOLALE I ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents qui étaient des prêts solidaires, elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne.
MARTIN D. compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de fonio, d’arachide,  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN, DAH et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe WOLALE I comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 29000 à 30000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Wolale I Group are married women living in Cinzara, a village in the prefecture of San in the region of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. On average, they are 46 years old and have at least eight children. They grow groundnuts, fonio and sesame. In order to ensure that their agricultural investments are profitable, the members of Wolale I Group decided two years ago to participate in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After having properly repaid their previous loans, which were solidarity loans, they apply now for their first farming loan. Martin D. wants to use her loan to buy adequate quantities of fonio and groundnut seeds, small equipment and farming supplies at the great market in San. After the rainy season, the harvest will be warehoused long enough for its value to increase, before it is sold at the great market in San, in Dah and at the nearby markets, retail (or often wholesale) for cash to customers who mostly come from big towns. After their produce is sold, the members of Wolale I Group expect to make a profit of 29,000 to 30,000 CFA francs each, which they will use to pay the interest on the loan and ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables and seafood
loans.name: Endem Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité ENDEM est créé au 18è cycle du Banc Villageois de GADAPARA, 3ans plus tard après son inauguration. Il est composé de 07 femmes du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par proximité et par affinité. 

Madame KADIDIATOU ALIOU D. à l’extrême droite de la photo, de grand boubou jaune vêtue avec un sac main, est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle vend au marché de son quartier des produits alimentaires, tels des légumes, des crustacés etc. 
Avec son nouveau prêt elle va augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises afin d’accroitre ses bénéfices

Elle a comme objectif de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille. Elle compte également renforcer son niveau d’épargne
texts.en:
The solidarity group has been created at the 18th cycle of the Banc Villageois of Gadapara, 3 years after the Banc’s inauguration. The group is composed of seven women all living in the same neighborhood. They are neighbors and friends who decided to form a group together. Mrs. Kadidiatou Aliou D., to the far right in the photo, wearing a yellow outfit and holding a handbag, is 41 years of age. She is married and the mother of five children. She sells foodstuffs at the local market, for example, vegetables, seafood etc. With this new loan, she would like to expand her stock and increase her revenue. Her goal is to help her husband provide for the family. She also plans to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy medicines and surgical instruments to expand her pharmacy
loans.name: Jannina Ysabel

texts.es:
Jannina tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en Batangrande, un centro poblado situado en el distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, es una comunidad de agricultores, se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de medicinas y diversos productos farmaceuticos y quirurgicos en una botica ubicada en la vivienda donde reside, tiene mas de diez meses en el negocio y durante este tiempo ha sabido hacerse conocida y tener un grupo estable de clientes, el negocio ha ido creciendo también, ya que es uno de los pocos que existen en la zona y siempre tiene demanda.

Jannina desea adquirir mas productos para que su negocio pueda crecer y para quepueda satisfacer la demanda que posee, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Jannina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. En la zona se ha vuelto una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus clientes y vecinos.
texts.en:
Jannina, 30, is single and lives with her family in Batangrande, a small town located in the Pitipo district in the Ferreñafe province. It is a farming community that is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She sells medicines and a variety of pharmaceutical and surgical products in a drugstore located in the house where she lives. She has had this business for more than 10 months, and during this time she has become well known and has developed a group of regular customers. The business has also grown, since it is one of few that exist in the area, so she always has demand. Jannina wants to acquire more products so that her business can grow and so that she can satisfy the demand that she has. To do this, she is requesting for the first time a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles. Jannina is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Her main wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman so that she can improve her quality of life and her family's standard of living. In the area she has become well-known and respected by her customers and neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, stone and gravel
loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es: La  Sra. Claudia María H. R. ella es Trabajadora de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Asistente de Finanzas municipales tiene  un  año de trabajar para esta empresa es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel  le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia María H. R. works for the municipality of San Rafael del Sur as a municipal finance assistant. She has been working in this job for a year, and is married. She has taken 2 loans with CEPRODEL, and they have been used to buy construction materials to make improvements to her house. These loans have benefited her a lot, since in this way she has been able to improve the living conditions of herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.
loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Magdalena N., 60, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Pacifico N. and mother to three young hard working adults. By the grace of God, Magdalena has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Magdalena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and sells at retail rates.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php29,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Magdalena dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance items needed for to provide service
loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan S. is from the village of Cantaan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 23 years old. Ryan is single. To make a living, Ryan owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. Ryan has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ryan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ryan is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance to provide service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ryan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Hair extensions, treatments, and cosmetics
loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline W. is thirty years old. She is single and has one child aged seven years old whom she hopes to give a good education to the university level. Her business is located in the Central Business District of Nairobi. She has a salon which provides hair and beauty services to the local women. She has been in this business for four years now and has one employee. 

Seline says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers hence customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more hair extensions, treatments and other cosmetics to expand her business and meet her customer demand. In future, she hopes to open more salons in different towns in Kenya. She says that she wants to be very rich through her business. She describes herself as a hardworking and determined lady.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients
loans.name: Arely Sugey

texts.es:
La Joven Arely Sugey C. P. es comerciante se dedica a la venta de sopas de Res y de Mondongo, es madre soltera de un niño de 02 años de edad, habita en el barrio San Agustin, vive con sus padres, lleva 22 creditos con CEPRODEL y tiene desde el 2006.
Arely C. P. ha demostrado ser una persona muy cumplida con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Young Arely Sugey C. P. is a merchant who sells 'sopas de res' (a traditional meat stew) and 'sopas de Mondongo' (tripe stew).  She is a single mother and has one 2 year-old son.  She lives in the San Agustin neighborhood with her parents.  She has had 22 loans from CEPRODEL since 2006.

Arely C. P. has shown herself to be very responsible with her payments.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and hair extensions.
loans.name: Lenah Nyambura

texts.en:
Lenah Nyambura is a 38-year-old single mother of three children. She runs a beauty shop, as well as a grocery store as a secondary business. She has had these businesses for two years with an income of 39,000 KES.

She is taking her first loan with KADET which she will use to buy beauty products and hair extensions. She has never borrowed from another MFI--this will be her first loan from such an institution. 

She hopes to expand her business and educate her children so that they can realize their dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store
loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta lives in Khanewal, which is a small city in the Punjab Province of Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living in a two-room brick house with her family. She is married to M. H., who is a school teacher and also runs a grocery store after his school job. He sells daily-use items such as cooking oil, biscuits, soaps, spices and rice in his store.
 
Shagufta is very caring lady. She fulfills her responsibilities as a housewife and also helps her husband in his grocery store by serving his customers in his absence. She has given birth to 4 sons. All of them are enrolled in a school and getting their education. 

She has applied to Asasah, a Kiva field partner, for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to minimize his costs and to increase his sales. 

He has been in business for over 5 years. Shagufta hopes that the loan will make her husband’s business more profitable and, as a result, she will be able to provide better financial resources to her children. 

She is a regular Asasah borrower and this is her 2nd loan application. In her previous loan year, she never missed any meetings and she paid her installments on time. 

In the photo, Shagufta is the woman who is holding the Asasah Passbook.

loans.use: To enlarge his business
loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 27 years old, married and with two children aged 4 and 2.  He runs Stanley Crafts where he sells curios.  In his business, he has employed one person.  He has been running the business for three years and has seen a tremendous growth since he joined Faulu Kenya. He hopes to succeed in his business in the future.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To buy materials such as wool, stories, and other things for the making of educational materials.
loans.name: Martha Maximiliana

texts.es:
Martha  es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años, de estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, realizó estudios hasta 4º de educación secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años, su  préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para comprar granos, actualmente trabaja en cuidado de niños en el wawawasi (centro de cuidado para niños).

Su nuevo crédito fue de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en materiales educativos, lanas para sus títeres, cuentos en bordados, etc, y también comprará materiales para construir su casa, su esposo trabaja en construcción.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes y terminar con la construcción de su casa.

Le gusta del Banco Comunal las reuniones nos sentimos como una familia y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the communal bank "August 12" in the Puno region. She is 35 years old and is married. She has 2 children that depend economically on her. She completed 4 years of secondary education.

She has been working with the "Manuela Ramos Movement" for six years. Her first loan was for 300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to buy grains. Now she works taking care of children in "wawawasi" (a child care center).

Her new loan was for 1000.00 nuevos soles, which she will used to buy educational materials, wool for her puppets, embroidered story books, etc. She will also buy materials to build her house. Her husband works in construction.

Her dream is to have a grocery store and finish the construction of her home.

She likes the meetings of the communal bank and the ease of the loan. She says, "We feel like a family."

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings
loans.name: Fredrick Karanja

texts.en:
Fredrick is 50 years old, married to Naomi Wanjiku who contributes to the family income. They have five children aged 18, 14, 12, 10, and nine years old. Fredrick has been growing french beens for a period of four years with an income of about KES 5,500 per month.

He has very good credit history with KADET, and this is his third loan after repaying the previous ones successfuly. He intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

He hopes to expand his farming activity and support his family. He dreams to be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy materials to make fast food.
loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Pastora R. G. tiene 31 años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler vivienda que esta ubicada en la ciudad de Tarija. Pastora es madre soltera de 2 hijos, por circunstancias de la vida se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Pastora se dedica desde hace mas de 7 años a trabajar en una empresa muy reconocida en esta ciudad la cual se dedica a la venta de comida rápida que es pollo a  la broster  la empresa se llama Crocan pollo, por otro lado, Pastora tiene una tienda de barrio en la cual vende abarrotes. Pastora quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con sus hijos, pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprar un cierto monto de mercadería porque le dijeron que los mismos subirán de precio, como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro, el crédito será destinado para la compra de dicha mercadería, para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Pastora  nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo credito que solicite sera para la compra de mas mercadería porque le esta yendo muy bien en ese negocio.
texts.en: Mrs Pastora R. G. is 31 years old and rents an apartment located in the town of Tarija. Pastora is a single mother of 2. Since she is alone she now must work to help her children succeed. Pastora has been working in a well known company in the city for more than 7 years where she sells fast food such as chicken brost at a place called Crocan Chicken. On the side, Pastora has a small grocery store. Pastora wants to make more profits to improve her life along with her children. She tells us she wants to buy a certain amount of merchandise because their prices will rise soon. Since she has experience in the business, the loan will be used to buy such merchandise to increase profits. Patora tells us she wants to improve her standard of living which is why the loan will be used to buy more merchandise especially since her business is doing very well.

loans.use: To buy lists of school supplies to sell to her customers
loans.name: Grace Patricia

texts.es: Grace Patricia M. es una mujer de 28 años que vive con su conyuge y su hijo de 9 años en el barrio Por Fin, de la ciudad de Barranquilla al sur occidente de esta capital. Alli tiene una miscelanea donde vende fantasia, calzado, productos plàsticos, negocio que mantiene con la exhibiciòn de articulos diferentes en cada temporada. Esta actividad la inicò en el año 2007   inicialmente vendiendo productos, mediante guias especializadas de cosmèsticos, una vez aumentaron sus utiliddes fuè diversificandolo hasta adicionar vitrinas, donde exhibe su merancia. Grace   sueña ver su negocio convertido en un gran almacen ubicado en su propia vivienda, pues en la actualidad habita en condiciones de arreandamiento. Su negocio es de gran apoyo a las necesidades de su hogar, por eso acude a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, para aumentar su capital de trabjo mediante financiamiento y formaciòn empresarial, aplicando, en este su primer credito, mediante la lìnea credikiva, pues planea  comprar listados de ùtiles educativos, que requieren los colegios a sus estudiantes para su desempeño y que ella puede acreditar a los padres de familia, para que sus hijos lleven todos sus libros, cuando la familia no tengan la posibilidad de hacer un gasto inmediato. El negocio de Grace Patricia maneja una utilidad del 33% mientras sostiene una rotaciòn de inventarios de 35 dias y un capital de trabajo actual de $1,450.000 COP. , indicadors desde los cuales se planea su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Grace Patricia M. is a 28 year-old woman who lives with her husband and 9 year-old son in Por Fin neighborhood, in the south-west of the city of Barranquilla.  She has a general store where she sells decorative items, shoes and plastic products. She displays different products in her business according to the season.  Grace Patricia started her business in 2007.  Originally she sold products through specialized cosmetics guides.  Once her profits increased, she diversified her business, even adding display cases where she displays her merchandise.

Grace Patricia dreams of seeing her business become a large store located in her own home as she currently lives in a rental house.  Her business is a great support for her household.  For this reason, she is approaching Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to increase her working capital through a loan and to receive business training.  This will be her first loan through Kiva.  She plans to buy lists of school supplies that schools require students to have.  She will sell these supplies to the children's parents on credit so that their children have all the supplies they need even though the family may be unable to afford an immediate expense.

Grace Patricia's business has profits of 33%, an inventory turnover period of 35 days and a current working capital of 1,450,000 Colombian pesos.  These are the financial indicators on which she plans her business growth.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, milk, rice, and oil
loans.name: Benetha Group

texts.en:
Benetha  B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of three borrowers called “Benetha Group.” She is 41 years old and single with six children between four and 24. Benetha also cares for three siblings. She completed 9th grade. 

For ten years, Benetha has been selling sugar, flour, milk, rice, and oil in Logan Town, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 30,000 LRD portion of this 80,000 LRD group business loan to buy more sugar, flour, milk, rice, and oil to sell. Benetha describes herself as a friendly woman whose goals are to grow her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Beatrice J. is inset because she was not present during the disbursal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops and to increase his capital
loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace mas cuatro años, el suele sembrar maracuyá y luego comercializarlo a una fabrica industrial de la zona cerca al distrito de donde vive, cuenta con experiencia gracias a las ensenñnazas de su padre y es conocido en el mercado.

Walter  desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maracuyá, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Además le permitira incrementar su capital de trabajo. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Walter es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Walter is 47 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in Olmos district.  This is an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Walter has been farming for more than four years.  He grows passion fruit which he then sells to a factory in his area, near the district where he lives.  He has experience thanks to being taught by his father and he is well known in the market.

Walter would like to acquire fertilizers so that he can care for his passion fruit crop.  In this way, he hopes to obtain a good harvest.  This will also allow him to increase his working capital.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Walter is a calm and responsible person.  His greatest wish is to grow as a businessman and to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies
loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 35 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 16 years old while the youngest is only 5.

Chona is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice and corn for more than 10 years. Chona sells her harvest to her community. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. Chona works hard to provide for her family.

loans.use: to stock more greens to sell
loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona F. is currently in a business of selling greens. She is 24 years old and married. She has two children and one goes to school. 

Lona borrowed a loan to stock more greens to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.
loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 48 years old and married with seven children.

Ermelinda works hard to provide for her family. She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ermelinda has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been buying and selling charcoal for ten years and also earns income from a sari sari (specialized local retail) store.

Ermelinda aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.
loans.name: Rosa Carmelina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Al Desarrollo. Ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos pero uno de ellos falleció  y esto embarga de una gran tristeza a nuestra amiga que nos dice que es muy doloroso perder a un hijo, su otro hijo  aun vive con ella.

Tiene una tienda de comestibles en la cual vende de todo un poco, nos cuenta que su tienda es su refugio y en ella olvida un poco su gran tristeza por la pérdida de su querida hija, ya que allí día a día está en contacto con muchas personas de su comunidad  que le dan fuerzas y motivan para salir adelante. Dice que se levanta muy temprano junto con su esposo ya que sus clientes son muy madrugadores y ella tiene que brindarles el mejor servicio para que no se le vayan a otro lugar, tiene su tienda 13 años y le ha ido muy bien gracias a Dios.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en comprar arroz, azúcar, embutidos, aceites y  otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el banco casi desde el inicio y le gusta por el apoyo que siempre le han brindado.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante con su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the “Amor y Fe al Desarrollo” (Love and Faith in Development) communal bank meet every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its cultural riches and its great crafts like straw hats that are renown both inside and outside the country.

We met Rosa, 45, here.  He’s married and had two children but one died which overcomes out friend with a great sadness.  She tells us that losing a child is very painful.  Her other son still lives with her.

She has a grocery store where she stocks a bit of everything.  She tells us that the store is her refuge and she can forget the sadness of losing her beloved daughter a bit while having contact there with many members of her community who give her the strength and motivation to continue forward.  She says that she rises very early with her husband because her customers tend to be real early birds and she has to be ready to provide them with the best service so that they won’t go somewhere else.  She’s had the store for 13 years and has done very well, thanks be to God.

She will use this new loan to buy rice, sugar, cured meats, oil and other basic need items.  She’s been in the communal bank since its start and likes if for the support it’s always given her.  Her goal is to continue with her life and business.

loans.use: to purchase construction material to set up a corral.
loans.name: Dibaldo Delin

texts.es: El señor Dibaldo es un  joven soltero cuya actividad es la compra criado y venta de animales (cerdos) es muy importante saber que para nuestra satisfacción el cliente lucha y se levanta de cada tropiezo que tiene en la vida todo para tener ingresos de consideración para poder apoyar a sus padres,  como segundo ingreso el señor Divaldo  como chofer de taxi por la tardes y así poder cubrir sus necesidades, gracias al crédito otorgado por la institución el cliente podrá comprar material de construcción para levantar una cerca para el corral para sus animales. Es una persona muy trabajadora y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Dibaldo is a young, single man who buys, raises, and sells livestock (pigs). It is very important to know that to our satisfaction he works to achieve his goals and he gets up whenever life sends an obstacle, all with the goal of acquiring enough of an income to help his parents. As a second source of income and to cover his personal expenses, Dibaldo works as a taxi driver in the afternoons. It is thanks to this loan granted by the institution that he will be able to purchase construction materials to put up a corral fence for his livestock. He is a very hardworking person and he is thankful to the institution for the support they provide.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks
loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Grace has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & fruit salad. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: purchase potato seeds
loans.name: Orlom

texts.en:
Orlom is 35 years old.  She lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province in Mongolia. All her three children, age 7, 12 and 14, attend secondary school. 

Orlom manages a vegetable planting and trading business in her town with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2007 with 0.8 hectare of land in her possession. Now she plants and harvests all kinds of daily consumption vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, onions, cabbages, etc.   All three of her children help in the family business during their summer vacations. They harvest 3-4 tons of vegetables a year. 

Orlom contributes her earnings toward her family consumption. With her business profit, she has built a fence on her land.  She is planning to buy more land in order to increase her business sales.  

Orlom is a hardworking lady who says, "One must work hard in order to earn money for his living." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase potato seeds for her business.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.
loans.name: Tiessiri Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Tièssiri III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Baba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,  DJOKOURA qui est debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of group Tièssiri III are married women who are on average 33 years old with three children. They live in polygamous families in Baba, one of the villages of Massigui Township in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).
They are partnering with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. They cultivate rice and groundnuts among other crops. They are on their fifth collaboration with the organization.
With this new loan, Djokoura - who is standing in the middle - plans on buying agricultural inputs and small equipment, and to pay for weeding costs to maintain about 2.5 acres of rice and groundnuts.
After the harvest, the crops are sold in the town of Massigui to a clientele comprising men and women. She expects an average benefit of 75,000 CFA per agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale
loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saum is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Saum has operated a clothes selling business for the past one year, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of clothes for sale in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two tires, a chain box and rim to repair his motorcycle.
loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. For the past year, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business, operating from the market. He faces a major challenge of competition from other boda boda businesses. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 Francis wants to purchase two tires, a chain box and rim to repair his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy fish, cassava, sodas, beer, fruits, and legumes.
loans.name: Ana Segia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son mayores de edad  y dos de 15 y 12 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y son los que aun  viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que para ganarse algo propio y con esto contribuir a los gastos que genera el hogar hace mas de 5 años emprendió un negocio, vende  ceviches, encebollados y pescado apanado con arroz ensalada y patacones, platos que son muy degustados por turistas y personas de la localidad que visitan su local. Además de esto su esposo tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres que atiende en un local de su casa. Ella trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de una persona a quien  le paga un sueldo mensual y su esposo le ayuda cuando hay mucho trabajo y el está desocupado.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, yuca, sodas, cervazas y víveres en general para preparar estos deliciosos platos así como también frutas y legumbres para el negocio del esposo. Para ella este es el sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por el orden, la puntualidad y por los beneficios que brinda el banco.

 Sus sueños son salir adelante y arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Empresarias Con Futuro” (Businesswomen with a Future) meets every 15 days in El Palmar in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. This city has unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Ana. She is 49 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has six children. Four of them are grown and the other two (ages 15 and 12) are high school students who still live with her. Her husband is a merchant.

Ana is a hardworking woman. Five years ago, she started a business in order to earn her own income and contribute toward the household expenses. She sells “ceviche” (marinated seafood), fried onions, battered fish with rice, salads, and fried plantains. Tourists and locals visit her establishment because her dishes are quite tasty. Her husband has a business selling fruits and legumes from a vending stall in their home. Ana works every day with the help of an employee who is paid a monthly salary. Her husband helps out whenever there is plenty of work and he is not busy.

This loan will be used to buy fish, cassava, sodas, beer, and general ingredients for her delicious dishes. She will also buy fruits and legumes for her husband’s business. This is her sixth loan with the Communal Bank. Ana likes the orderliness, promptness, and benefits offered by her Communal Bank. Her dreams are to move forward and repair her house.
