loans.use: To fix an irrigation system and increase cattle feed storage
loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 64-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been working with cattle for the last 40 years. 

Abbass is a hard worker, he has spent most of his life raising his cattle in a very good area, to ensure they have the best quality that could be requested. 

Abbass works hard on improving his family's way of living and eating. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to fix all his irrigation equipment and to buy cattle food to store for the winter, because the price is very affordable right now. 

Abbass has been Al Majmoua borrower for two loan cycles, the previous loan had a very good impact on his business and life. He hopes this loan will help more in improving everything he needs.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.
loans.name: Ma. Nanie

texts.en:
Ma. Nanie is 39 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Ma. Nanie works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nanie runs a sari sari (general)  store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari sari store.

Ma. Nanie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, toothpaste and other groceries. 

In the future, Ma. Nanie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy paint for maintenance and also pay for repairs to her motorcycle
loans.name: Marianeth

texts.en: Marianeth is 32 years old. She is the operator of a motorcycle and has been in this occupation for three years, working hard just to provide financial services for her family. She is blessed with three children; two of them are students. She needs to work every day to meet their needs, especially for school. Even though she works every day, she still experiences shortages due to low income. Sometimes she can't work because of problems with the motorcycle. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy paint for motorcycle maintenance and also to pay for repairs. She wants to earn a higher income to improve their unprivileged lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cashews wholesale.
loans.name: Rain

texts.en:
Rain, 42 years old, is planting yams and cashews with her husband.,  She earns $6 per day.  They have five children, two are studying and other three are working.  Each earns $3.50 per day.  

Every month, she has to spend $99 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees and $10 on other expenses.  

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy cashews wholesale with the intent to resell at a profit.  

Before, she used to rent a plantation to grow her crop but she lost money.  Now Rain only buys wholeshale and can make a good income to her family. 

She wants to support her children's university education, so that they can have good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.
loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 53 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with six children. 

Narcisa has a sari-sari (variety) store business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Narcisa has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Narcisa hopes to  have a grocery store. She is a MIGS member of PMPC. She has a  happy family, is a good mother, and she takes good care of her family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for milk preservation.
loans.name: Moses Ooko

texts.en: Moses is a married man. He has 2 children ages 2 and 6. He describes himself to be jovial, respectful, and God fearing. He operates a milk sales business where he sells milk to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of a refrigerator to keep milk fresh. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a refrigerator to keep milk fresh all day. His business goal is to grow it and open a milk depot from which he will be selling milk to retailers within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will construct a premises from which he will be running his business.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies
loans.name: Sren

texts.en: Sren, aged 31, is a hairdresser in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district. He is married and has 3 children. Sren started his business 25 years ago. This is his first loan with VisionFund. He wants to buy hairdressing supplies and build a shop for his business. As a result of this loan, he hopes to have more customers and earn more income for his family's expenses and business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his rice field
loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en: Silvestre is 44 years old and has been energetically farming in the village where he lives for over 21 years. His farm produces almost 100 cavans of rice per cropping and his net income is PHP 45,000. He expects major changes in his family’s living standards. Therefore, Silvester is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 from ASKI to buy seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his rice field. Silvestre hopes to grow his business and harvest more rice to sell. He appreciates ASKI and KIVA lenders' services and is looking forward to a long term relationship with them.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her business.
loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 30,000 KES loan to purchase rice, beans, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her business. In the future, Bendera aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Bendera has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs.
loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 54 years old and is married to Mariano. They are blessed with four children. Her husband is a farmer, planting rice and corn in the Philippines.

Angelita is engaged in a hog raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. Sometimes, she has difficulties in feeding her pigs, that’s why she has decided to request a loan of PHP20,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs. 

She hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family. She will manage her business well and gain higher income. She would like to save some of the income for their future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy rice and other ingredients to meet the demand of eaters during the Tet holiday.
loans.name: Senh

texts.en: Ms. Senh is 63 years old with five children who are grown up. Being a cake maker, she has run this kind of business for ten years. Every day, she sells cakes in wholesale and retail. Joining our credit program in 2007, she uses loans to buy more tools that serve her cake making process and also material. For the new loan cycle, she wants to buy rice and other ingredients to meet the demand of eaters during the Tet holiday.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.
loans.name: Anonymous

loans.use: to buy building materials.
loans.name: Javier Aldo

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y su hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Javier no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones su esposa cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para engreírlo, ya que este es su plato favorito.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace varios años Javier trabaja en el rubro de la construcción como maestro de obras, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos acabados que les da a sus trabajos.
Javier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como arena, cemento, fierros y otros; de esta manera Javier podrá terminar la construcción de su vivienda, así él podrá brindar mayor seguridad, bienestar y un ambiente más adecuado para el buen desarrollo de su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Javier is a 47 year old man and lives with his wife and son in Ica.  He loves them and they are his main reason for living.  He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic man who dedicates all of his effort to getting his family ahead.  Unfortunately Javier was not able to study for a professional career because he had to go to work when he was very young, but he would have liked to do it.  He likes to play soccer in his spare time and sometimes cooks a delicious chicken with rice dish to enjoy.  It’s his favorite dish.

He has been working as a construction laborer for several years and works daily beginning early morning and can work up to 12 hours a day.  He feels comfortable doing his work and believes that things are going well for him because of the good work he does.

He is very grateful for the Kiva loans which have allowed him to buy building materials such as sand, cement, iron bars, and other things.  This will allow him to finish building his house and be able to provide better security and a better environment for his family.  He will continue to work toward his goal of watching his son establish himself in a professional career.

loans.use: buy carrots, onions, potatoes, and peppers.
loans.name: Saly's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 21 juin 2011  après fusion de deux bancs villageois. Il est composé qui ont un même objectif à savoir améliorer les conditions de vie de leur famille respective, par le développement d’activité génératrice de revenu via le petit commerce. Elles vivent dans la même localité et s’entre aide mutuellement.
Saly (Assise  à l’extrême  droite avec une main levée), est la représentante du groupe, elle est âgée de 34 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 filles et 02 garçons. C’est une femme qui joue un rôle exemplaire dans la vie du  banc villageois. Elle est vendeuse de légumes et produits halieutiques qu’elle achète auprès de commerçants intermédiaires au marché international de la sous région pour la revente au détail dans sa localité.
Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des cartons de carotte, des sacs d’oignon, de pomme de terre, du piment 
Elle utilise les bénéfices pour constituer son épargne, une partie est réutilisée comme fonds de roulement et le reste comme soutien à son mari dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The banc villageois was founded on June 21, 2011 after the merger of two bancs villageois. The bancs villageois share the same goal of improving the lives of their respective families with their small business’ revenue generating activities. The members live in the same area and help one another.

Madame Saly, seated at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the star borrower of the group. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of four children (2 boys and 2 girls). This woman plays an exemplary role in the life of the banc villageois. She sells vegetables and fishing products. She buys her goods from intermediary merchants at the sub-region’s international market. She then resells her goods at retail prices near her home. 

The new loan will allow her to buy boxes of carrots, bags of onions, potatoes, and peppers for 29,000; 33,000; 24,000; and 16,000 FCFA respectively.  She would also like to buy dried fish for 60,000 FCFA.

She uses her profits to establish her savings, and uses a part as working capital. The rest is used to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: Acheter des boissons.
loans.name: Tachegnon Noël

texts.fr: Âgée de 46 ans, Tachegnon Noël a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Tachegnon Noël est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Salomé. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Tachegnon Noël vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Tachegnon Noël assure ensemble avec sa femme les différentes charges du ménage. Tachegnon Noël vend des boissons à son domicile depuis dix ans ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Tachegnon Noël s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Tachegnon Noël devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Tachegnon Noël sollicite une premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: To purchase energy saving stoves and solar lights at wholesale price
loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 43 year old man married with four children. He has studied Accounting  and attained CPA 2.He runs a Microfinance organization.

Upon receiving the loan, Moses intends to buy and stock EcoZoom energy saving stoves and solar lights. This is to aid him to reach out to more of his clients who need the products and cannot afford to pay on time.

“This business is not so easy. My clients are people with little or even at times no income. Given my background in accounts, I worked out a system where I’m paid in installments. 

He has been in business for the last 6 years and has fostered a good relationship with EcoZoom for four months now. He enjoys working with EcoZoom because it has helped transform lives of many people. People enjoy cooking on the stoves because they are energy saving and fast and constant lighting through the solar lights. Many children can easily read from home at night using the solar lights.

His main challenge is inadequate funds to keep his business afloat. Some of his clients take longer to repay back their installments and as a result further strains his finances. He runs out of stock and cannot replenish if he is still in debt 

His future goal is to be a big distributor in his home area.

loans.use: Achat  des habits
loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Né en Avril 1986 à San   cercle de San,  LAMINE  est un tailleur qui en plus de cela embrasse des activités génératrices de revenus telles la vente de vêtements et des habits. Il est marié à une épouse et  père d’un enfant. Il vit chez son père dans le quartier Santoro II de la préfecture de San.  Il effectue la vente des habits  en détail à San  qu’ il a appris  auprès de son patron  il y a plus de 2 ans , et l’exerce actuellement pour lui même depuis 1 an.  Il est très sollicité par ses clients.  
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle, il décida de faire recours à  l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 1er  prêt  individuel. Mr LAMINE compte acheter un stock important d’habits. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako chez les grossistes et souvent au Burkina Faso. Il a une clientèle composée de femmes et hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit. En plus de son fonds propre, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000 FCFA qu’il envisage d’utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt, utiliser  le reste pour payer les frais de scolarité, frais médicaux de ses enfants , acheter la nourriture et réinvestir le reste dans son activité de revenus .

loans.use: to buy a new hair dresser, locks and beauty products
loans.name: Pauline Amélé

texts.en:
Miss Pauline Amélé K. was born in Abidjan this 10th May, 1980. She arrived in Lomé, (Togo) in 1996 after her primary studies. She has opted for the hairdressing apprenticeship after having failed to obtain her O’level diploma of secondary education. Hair dresser mistress for already 06 years, Miss Pauline is single without children but has her mother in dependency. Daughter of a deprived family, she called for a loan of $250 to open her hairdressing salon and equipped. Then she has benefited from 03 loans which have been all well repaid, what allowed her to improve the adjustment of her hairdressing salon and to increase her incomes to provide for her needs and those of her niece. To strengthen he activities at this end -year where almost all the women seek to make herself attractive, Pauline requests this loan of $950 to buy a new hair dresser, locks and beauty products to satisfy the needs of her customary on the one hand, and to draw a profit sensitive to improve her economic and social situation on the other hand.

Mlle K. Amélé Pauline est née à Abidjan le 10 Mai 1980. Elle est arrivée à Lomé au Togo en 1996 après ses études primaires. Elle a opté pour l’apprentissage de la coiffure après son échec au BEPC. Maîtresse de coiffure depuis déjà 6 ans, Mlle Pauline est célibataire sans enfant mais a sa nièce en charge. Fille d’une famille démunie, elle a eu recours à un prêt de $250 pour ouvrir son salon de coiffure mal équipé. Elle a ensuite bénéficié de 2 prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés, ce qui lui a permis d’améliorer l’aménagement de son salon de coiffure et d’augmenter ses revenus pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa nièce. Pour renforcer ses activités en cette fin d’année où presque toutes femmes cherchent à s’embellir, Pauline sollicite ce prêt de $950 pour acheter un nouveau séchoir, des mèches et des produits de beauté pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle d’une part, et de tirer un profit susceptible d’améliorer sa situation économique et sociale.

loans.use: Franscicah would like to set up a hotel.
loans.name: Anonymous

loans.use: Julia would like to buy crates of milk for her family's milk business.
loans.name: Anonymous

loans.use: Expand the inventory in his small grocery store
loans.name: Sajoh

texts.en: Sajoh J. is thirty-three years old and married with one child. He opened a small store in the open-air market in Kabala town of Sierra Leone soon after the end of the civil war.  In spite of the small scale of his business, J. managed to save some of his profit to increase his inventory.  He used a previous loan from SMT to construct a wooden shelter in a residential area in Kabala where he sells his goods.  J. completed his first loan repayment successfully and is requesting a second loan of $200 to further expand his inventory.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of glassware
loans.name: Mir Zamen

texts.en: Mir Zamen lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has a small store where he sells different kinds of glassware that he imports all from other countries. He needs money so he wants to take an individual loan to buy different kinds of glassware and some extra things for his shop. He wants to expand his business and support his family better. He is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale
loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: Mrs. Nkechi E. is 30 years old and lives in Asaba, Delta State. She sells frozen meat to people, and is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more meat (beef) for sale. She is married with 2 children, and learned her business from her husband. She has 3 years of experience in this business and is a LAPO client .

loans.use: To purchase additional pipes
loans.name: Anonymous

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to purchase silk materials and pay fees for preparing a loom
loans.name: Oy

texts.en:
Mrs. Oy C., age 40, was married in 1971 and has one son and four daughters. She has been in the business of growing vegetables on her farmland in the village since 1979. In addition, she also weaves silk at home, along with her two daughters. The youngest daughter is studying at school in Khsach Kandal district and she assists her mother in weaving silk when she is off from school. Her husband, Mr. Kroeun Rean, is a farmer, and their son helps his father in the farming activities.

Oy has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now she is requesting another loan, in the amount of $1,200. She will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, and some of the money will be used to buy silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use: Buying used clothes.
loans.name: Mevlida

texts.en: Mevlida lives in Stupari, a small place near Kladanj. She is 43 years old and she is married. Her husband works in the state service as a jurist. His monthly income is 750 KM and they don't have any other additional sources of income. Mevlida resells used clothes. As she wanted to improve her business activity she took a loan at MCO WWI in the amount of 1000 KM. She intends to buy some more used clothes and in that way to provide better living conditions for her 3 children. She wants to secure their continued education.

loans.use: She will invest the loan in buying materials for her business/El prestamo lo invertira en la compra de materiales para su negocio
loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virgina L. D. D. is a member of the Comunal Bank "Flor D. mani". She is originally from the County of San Martin, in the district of Soritor, in the province of Moyobamba. She makes and sells bricks, and she has her own brick shop at the border of the Soritor district, where she attends to her clients who wait for her bricks. She is happy as, thanks to this business, she can support her family. She is a widow, and as such has had to manage the business, somthing new for her as her husband did all of this before.

With the loan of $2000 which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will invest in large quantities of firewood, as well as fuel for the motor that is used to make the bricks, and some calamine in order to expand the sheds where the bricks dry, so that she can meet the demand she receives.

She is 45 years old and has two daughters who are studying. They help out in the house and give her the strength to keep working. Virginia is happy with what she has achieved to date; this business allows her to mix with many people such as the authorities from the energy and mineral sectors. She is also a part of the Soritor Brick-Makers Association, all of which gives her more self-esteem.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Virginia López D. D., es socia del Banco Comunal “ Flor del Maní” ella es natural D. la provincia D. Moyobamba, distrito D. Soritor, departamento D. San Martín, se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. ladrillos, cuenta con su propia ladrillera a la entrada del distrito D. Soritor a donD. asisten sus espera sus clientes para la compra D. los ladrillos, esta contenta por que gracias a su actividad pueD. sacar a su familia adelante, al quedar viuda ella tuvo que dirigir el negocio, actividad que era nuevo para ella, ya que su esposo era quien administraba el negocio. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2 000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertira en la compra D. leña en grandes cantidades, además combustible para su motor con el cual fabrican los ladrillos y calaminas para aumentar sus galpones en donD. secan los ladrillos, para así poder abastecer los pedidos que tiene, Tiene 45 años y tiene 2 hijas que aun están estudiando ellas la apoyan en las actividades D. la casa y le dan fuerzas para seguir trabajando, Virginia esta contenta con los logros obtenidos hasta la fecha, , este negocio le permite relacionarse con muchas personas como autoridades del sector energía y minas, también forma parte D. la Asociación D. Ladrilleras D. Soritor, todo ello mejoro su autoestima.

loans.use: To refinance their business for recovery and expansion after the post election violence in Western Kenya
loans.name: Riwruok Eteko Youth Group

texts.en:
Kennedy’s business entails buying molasses in bulk and retailing the same for profit. He came up with this idea after realizing that molasses was readily available due to availability of a sugar industry in his area and he could make use of this opportunity to create a molasses business for a living to support his family. He is the sole provider for his family and this business is the one that has supported his family for over 5 years now. He is married with 4 children.

His business location is in a suburb town within Kisumu city called Muhoroni. There is a sugar factory called Muhoroni Sugar Factory from which he gets his molasses. His business is unique in that there are few people in the area who thought of establishing a business like his. The interruptions that occurred to his business due to the post-election violence slightly affected his supply and necessitated a refinancing. This is the basis for the current loan that he is seeking.

In his group he has a leadership role as the group Chairman. His leadership style is unique in that in addition to being a strong leader, he has devoted part of his time to counseling the group members affected by the post-election violence as a way of ensuring that the group business activities pick up faster. This has endeared him to his group members who view him as a servant leader who is both concerned about their businesses and their social needs. His group leadership qualities have thus ensured that his group is among the most united in the region. Another unique feature of the group that has led to their current cohesion is his highly participative type of leadership which has encouraged members to voice their opinions openly without fear of victimization.


Disclaimer: Kiva is working with OI-WEDCO to refinance businesses disrupted by Kenya's post-election violence.  The group above has received loans from OI-WEDCO in the past and is now working to rebuild their businesses and to get back on their feet.Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.
loans.name: Gwantwa

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Gwantwa M.. She is married and has 2 children aged 4 and 6. In 2006, Gwantwa established her rice-selling business. She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Commerce in foods
loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou D., age 42, is married and has five children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Simbandi Brassou for six and a half years. At the weekly markets, she wants to buy brooms , made from oil palms, and some peanuts to make peanut butter and to sell her goods in Dakar. The income derived from her commerce will enable her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Aissatou D., 42ans, mariée, 05enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Simbandi Brassou depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires des balaies de l’huile de palme et des arachides pour faire de la pâte d'arachide et vendre ses produits à Dakar. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Investment capital to make clothing.
loans.name: Diana Jacquelina

texts.es:
Diana is a diligent and enterprising mother and a native of the capital city of Lima. Since she married her hard-working husband Andres, they found the need to leave her native city to find better opportunities for work. This enterprising couple currently resides in the section of Puno. Andres works as a laborer in an established mine and together, with their persistence, they live trying to improve their quality of life and above all to provide tranquility for thier two young children who motivate them to get ahead. Diana previously dedicated herself to making beautiful and stylish clothing. Now that she lives in Puno she does not have sufficient prime material to continue with this work, for this she needs your help.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Diana es una diligente y emprendedora madre, natural de la ciudad capital Lima, desde que contrajo matrimonio con su laborioso esposo, Andrés, se vieron en la necesidad de abandonar su ciudad natal y buscar mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Esta emprendedora pareja actualmente radica en el departamento de Puno. Andrés trabaja como obrero en una reconocida mina de dicha ciudad y juntos, con empeño, vienen logrando mejorar su calidad de vida y sobre todo, la tranquilidad de sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son las personas que les motivan a seguir adelante. Diana anteriormente estaba dedicada a la confección de hermosas y novedosas prendas de vestir, ahora que radica en este departamento no posee suficiente materia prima para continuar con su labor, para ello, necesita de su apoyo.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.
loans.name: Mariamu's Tujuane Group

texts.en:
Mariamu is 32 years old, married, and has 5 children between the ages of 2 and 16. She became a charcoal seller in 2000. She works from 8am to 7pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Mariamu now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with food and clothing sales.

loans.use: To purchase various articles for small business
loans.name: Alima

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mairées vivant dans des foyers monogames avec en moyenne 02 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier Medine de Sikasso et se sont connues en raison du voisinage, des liens de parenté et d’amitié. Le groupe Benkadi travaille avec Soro Yiriwaso dépuis onze (11) ans et tous les prêts précédents ont été corrctement remboursés. 
Elles exercent des activités commerciales comme la vente des habits d’enfants, des savons, de l’encens. Les femmes du groupe Benkadi ont une grande expérience dans cette activité. Disposant d’un fonds de commerce personnel, elles comptent utiliser le prêt actuel comme appoint pour acquérir d’autres articles. Elles s’approvisionnent en général à Bamako (la capitale du Mali), en république de Cote d’ivoire ou au Togo.
Les produits sont vendus au marché de sikasso en gros ,en détails et au comptant . Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA. Avec leur bénéfice, elle compte utiliser une partie dans les petites dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre partie dans leur activité de commerce. Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkadi espèrent garder leur cohésion et devenir toutes des grossistes disposant de magasins de vente dans la ville de Sikasso.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women and housewives in monogamous families with an average of two (2) children. They live in the Medine district of Sikasso and are related by reasons of family ties, neighbors and friendship. The Benkadi group has worked with the Soro Yiriwaso (microbank) for eleven (11) years and all their previous loans have been successfully repaid.

Their carry out business activities such as the selling of childrens clothing, soaps, and incense. The women of the Benkadi group have substantial experience in these business activities. Though they already have existing personal business funds, they plan to use this loan to contribute to the purchase of additional products. They usually purchase their products in Bamako ( the capital of Mali), in the Republic of Ivory Coast, or in Togo.

The products are sold at the market in Sikasso, in wholesale or retail and for cash. They hope to each earn an average monthly income of 20,000 francs CFA. With their profits they plan to use a part for everyday family expenses and the other part for their business activities. The five women of the Benkadi group hope to maintain their cohesive association and eventually become wholesalers and proprietors of stores to sell in the city of Sikasso.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise of her small store as well as to expand her space.
loans.name: Ruseli

texts.es: Ruseli se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad en su bodega, tiene 37 años y tres hijos, para ella no existe nada imposible, ya que es una mujer muy activa y sobre todo jovial con sus hijos y clientes, muy aparte D. su bodega brinda servicios D. cabinas D. Internet y venD. helados, por lo que su esposo Alfredo (maderero) la apoya en todas sus decisiones y brinda le su ayuda cuando está en casa, dándole la mano en su negocio. Ruseli es una mujer con ganas D. superación y deseos D. éxito, se esmera mucho por sus hijos, quienes, desea, sean hombres y mujeres D. bien en un futuro, aunque no pueda darles estudios universitarios, comenta. Quiere ver crecer su negocio, para ello requiere D. una cantidad D. dinero que la ayuD. a incrementar y ampliar su mercaD.ía, y así, poco a poco cumplir su propósito.
texts.en:
Ruseli works selling everyday products in her small store. She is 37 years old and has three children. For her nothing is impossible as she is a very active woman and above all cheerful with her children and clients. In addition to her small store she offers Internet cabin services and sells ice cream. Her husband Alfredo (woodworker) supports her in all of her decisions and provides her with help with he is at home, giving her a hand in her business. Ruseli is a woman with the will to get ahead. She does her best for her children who she wants to be successful men and women in the future, although she cannot pay for their university studies, she comments. She wants to see her business grow, and for this she requires a quantity of money that will help her to improve and expand her merchandise through which she will achieve her purpose little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for their food-serving business
loans.name: Sabaly (Patience) Group

texts.fr:
Sabaly est un regroupement de quatre femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec des coépouses et autres parents dans le village de Kimparana préfecture de San(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Liées par des relations socio économique, elles font en plus de leur activité principale qui est la restauration, la vente des condiments alimentaires et des fruits.
Dans le souci de satisfaire la clientèle de plus en plus importante, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis une année. Après un premier prêt solidaire correctement remboursé, le groupe est à son deuxième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, cent(100 kg) kilogrammes de riz et une importante quantité de divers condiments alimentaires pour des fins de  restauration.
Elles s’approvisionnent en matières premières au grand marché de Koutiala auprès des grossistes et sur place les jours de foire à Kimparana. Les plats composés généralement de riz avec différentes sauces (quelques fois du haricot, du spaghetti etc) sont vendus devant la concession conjugale ou dans des gargotes sises au marché du dit village Kimparana. La clientèle est constituée de toutes les catégories sociales de la cité. Elles vendent chaque jour et cela durant toute l’année généralement au comptant et quelques fois à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA par mois qu’elles comptent utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Dans l’avenir, elles ambitionnent ouvrir un restaurant.
texts.en:
Sabaly is a group of four married women who, on average, are 32 years old and have two children. They live in extended traditional families with co-spouses and other relatives in the Kimparana village (Prefecture of San, 4th administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Linked by socio-economical bonds, their main business is food-serving, but they also sell condiments and fruits. Anxious to satisfy and ever-increasing clientele, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso a year ago. After a first solidarity loan repaid without problems, the group is now seeking a second loan to be used to buy 100 kg of rice and a large amount of various condiments. They purchase raw materials in the grand market of Koutiala, from wholesale resellers, and in Kimparana during fair days. The dishes they serve are usually composed of rice with various sauces (beans, spaghetti, etc) and sold in front of the family house or in small luncheonettes located in the Kimparana market. The dishes are sold every day all year long, usually for cash and sometimes on credit. They foresee they will each turn a monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 100), to be used to repay the loan and to pay for daily family expenses. In the future, their ambition is to open a restaurant.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her restaurant and shoes and purses for resale
loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr: Oumy N., 37 ans, veuve avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de CESIRI depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer ses activités de restauration et de commerce  d’effets vestimentaires, chaussures et pochettes  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Oumy N., aged 37 and a widow with four children in her care, has been a member of the CESIRI Village Bank for 18 months. She wants a loan to strengthen her restaurant business as well as her business involving the sale of clothing, shoes and purses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell
loans.name: Neti

texts.en:
Neti is 35 years old and married with a child. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells groceriers, such as noodles, milk, sugar, and tomato paste.  

Neti is a LAPO client. She is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more grocers to sell. She says thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, rice and cooking oil
loans.name: Beth K.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Beth M. from Tukuyu. She is married with four children, between the ages of 16 and 28. Beth has operated a restaurant since 1991. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

She works at the business for 13-16 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by her children. Beth currently earns about $13 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 in order to purchase more maize flour, rice and cooking oil. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business . Beth thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To boost his business.
loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul M. is a Tanzanian businessman. He runs a business of transporting passengers from one point to another point in Dar es Salaam. He has a minibus, and has been in business for four years. He also runs a stationery shop at Kariakoo in Dar es Salaam. He managed to build a house from the business income. He needs a loan to top up the businesses.

loans.use: To expand her charcoal, beans and cooking oil business
loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda A. is in the business of selling charcoal, beans and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Elda is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits earned from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy recharge phone cards
loans.name: Anakpa

texts.fr: Monsieur anakpa a pour activité le commerce de carte de recharge, il exerce ce commerce depuis 2004 et de façon ambulante, il est célibataire alors il travaille dur afin de pouvoir gagner sa vie. Il veut agrandir son commerce, il s’adresse alors à wages pour demander son premier crédit  qui lui  servira à acheter des cartes de recharges.
texts.en:
Mr. Anakpa's business involves selling recharge phone cards door-to-door. He has been in this business since 2004. He is unmarried, so he works hard to earn his living. He wants to expand his commerce. And so he's enquiring with WAGES to ask for his first loan, which will be used to buy phone cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of an extra room
loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier C. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente. El préstamo fue para pagar el enganche de su casa que actual mente está viviendo.
 Ahora nueva mente está solicitando otro crédito para construir un cuarto más al frente de la vivienda. Ya que el y su esposa la señora Mercedes Torres están iniciando un pequeño negocio de abarrotes, el cual ocupando una parte de su casa. 
Es por eso que están solicitando el préstamo para comprar el material y empezar la construcción del cuarto y así tener el negocio se parado de la casa.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier C. has previously obtained a loan from FVP, which he paid back promptly. The loan was to pay off the downpayment on his current home. Now he is requesting a loan to add another room to the front of the house, as he and his wife, Mercedes Torres, are setting up a small grocery business that will take up part of their home. He needs the loan to buy building materials and begin construction to keep business and home separate.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell peanuts, onions, and spices.
loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama D., 64 ans est veuve avec 08 enfants et 04 autres en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois de Pout Diack depuis 4 ans Son activité  est la vente d’arachide, d’oignons et d’épices. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce et prendre en charge ses enfants Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Adama D., age 64, is a widow who has eight children plus four others to support. She has been a member of the village lending group of Pout Diack for four years. Her work involves selling peanuts, onions, and spices. She wants to bolster her commerce and care for her children. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand goods assortment
loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru:
Скоро исполнится 20 лет, как  Зайнура Маъруфходжаева занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. За 20 лет работы она увеличила  ассортимент своего товара. Начинала она с продажи верхней женской одежды, сейчас в ее ассортименте женские и мужские костюмы, брюки, сорочки.
 Зайнура, так же хочет присоеденить к ассортименту своего товара женскую обувь, для этого ей нужны средства. Услышав о том, что "Микроинвест" выдает займ на предпринимательскую деятельность, она обратилась к нам за помощью. Зайнура запрашивает сумму в размере 1000 сомони.
 Зайнура живет с мужем и 2 детьми. Ее муж работает сварщиком, и в свободное время помогает жене на рынке.
texts.en:
It will soon be 20 years since Zaynura M. began her entrepreneurial activity. She increased her goods assortment over the last 20 years of work. She started her business with sales of women’s outerwear, and now her assortment includes women’s and men’s suits, pants and undershirts. Zaynura wants to also add women’s shoes to her goods variety, but she needs funding to do this. Having found out that MicroInvest provides financing options to entrepreneurs, Zaynura reached out to us for help. She is requesting a loan in the sum of 1000 somini. Zaynura lives with her husband and 2 children. Her husband works as a welder and helps Zaynura with the business during his free time.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, yeast and butter
loans.name: Pabla

texts.en: Mrs Pabla is 55 years old and has three children, one of whom has a mental disability. All of her children work in her bakery and put in a great effort to make it a success. In this way the family can afford an education for the children. Mrs Pabla is a single mother and has raised her children by herself. She thanks Kiva partner, Fundación Paraguaya, for its support and the opportunity it has given her to accomplish a dream. She says that it was the only institution that believed in her.

loans.use: shoes
loans.name: Myrcea Stefhany

texts.es:
Myrcea es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Myrcea es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, estudiante de contabilidad en un instituto, Myrcea tiene un puesto en le mercado 12 de abril en donde vende calzados variados, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama, Myrcea además vende ropa a pedido.
Myrcea necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados.
Los sueños de Myrcea son tener un local amplio y una empresa.
texts.en:
Myrcea is a member of “Las Gaviotas” community bank. She is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is an accounting student and also has a booth at the 12 de abril market, where she sells a variety of shoes, with her mother’s help. Myrcea also sells custom-order clothing. She needs a loan for 800 soles that she will invest in shoes. Myrcea dreams of having her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her coffee shop and partly to build house
loans.name: Phearom

texts.en:
Mrs. Phearom, 33, is a widow with one daughter. She lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has one sister who is a tailor. 

Phearom has been selling medicine in her village since ten years. She wants to create another coffee-selling business, therefore she is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase materials for her coffee shop and use part of the loan for building her house.

loans.use: Buy supplies.
loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Lucy es soltera, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Lucy es artesana y realiza bellos trabajos en telares como pasadizos, frazadas, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado F. Vivanco. Además Lucy vende quesos de casa en casa.
Lucy necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos y pintura.
Los sueños de Lucy son tener casa propia, ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the Nobleza community bank. She is 32 years old, single and the mother of 2 children. She is an artisan and makes beautiful woven products such as shawls and blankets that she then sells at the F. Vivanco market. She also sells cheeses from her house. Lucy needs a loan of 800 soles, money that she will use to buy thread and paint. Lucy's hopes for the future are to own her own house and to save for her children's schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital
loans.name: Haydee Apolonia

texts.es: Haydee Apolonia R. Hernández tiene 58 años,  vive con su esposo u sus 2 hijos. Desde hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. Desde muy joven trabaja en granjas ya que fue por medio de este trabajo que logro ofrecerles a sus hijos alimento y vestimenta. Ya que no tenía algo que le generara ingresos y decide dedicarse a esta actividad, por lo que no ha sido nada fácil. El desafío que Haydee enfrente es en las temporadas de lluvias ya que no puede salir a vender sus cerdos ya que hay un puente que está totalmente destruido y la vía de acceso para poder salir es mucho más difícil. El dinero que solicita es para capital de negocio para la compra de cerdos, vitaminas, desparasitantés y así ofrecer una mejor calidad de cerdos. El sueño de Haydee es construir un mejor lugar para colocar a los cerdos.
texts.en:
Haydee Apolonia R. Hernández is 58 and lives with her husband and 2 children. For more than 20 years she has earned her living buying and selling pigs. She has worked on farms since she was very young, allowing her to feed and cloth her children. She decided on this business because she had no other way to earn a living, so nothing has been easy. The challenge is the rainy season, because Haydee can't get out to sell her pigs. There's a bridge that gets washed away making the route out much more difficult. Haydee is seeking a loan for working capital to buy pigs, along with vitamins and antiparasitics so she can offer her pigs higher quality care. Her dream is to build a better place to keep her pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: additional capital for new business - clothing sales
loans.name: Presella

texts.en:
Presella S., 36, lives in the outskirts of the BASECO Compound in Tondo, Manila.  Her husband works at the pier.  Their only child is now in elementary school.

Presella has been a dealer of household liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) in cylinders.  Most households in her community relyon LPG for cooking so she makes good business.  She also sells electronic credits for mobile phones.  Combined, she earns P16, 000.00 a month.  

She has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2006.  She has finished repaying her previous loan with CCT.  She used the previous loan in her new venture – selling RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing.  Now on her 9th loan cycle, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of P17, 000.00 as additional capital for her clothing business. 


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Increase stock
loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo, Julio, que tiene 34 años y es albañil, ellos tienen una hija de 16 años. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una tienda que implementó en su casa. Este negocio le permite trabajar en su hogar y atender a su familia al mismo tiempo, aunque muchas veces no puede salir con libertad, ya que atiende de lunes a domingo y esto le resulta muy cansado, pero no se amilana, ya que sabe que todo es por un fin, pues gracias a su negocio su familia tiene seguridad económica. Patricia realiza su trabajo con gran alegría y está muy ilusionada de seguir mejorándolo, ya que quiere tener una tienda muy bien implementada para obtener mayor clientela.
Este es su quinto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella es muy puntual en sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras de banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará golosinas para surtir su tienda, ya que son muy demandadas y así espera incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Patricia is 35 years old and lives with her husband Julio who is 34 years old and a bricklayer. They have a 16-year old daughter. For 2 years, she has made a living selling groceries in a store that she started in her home. This business allows her to work at home and take care of her family at the same time. However, she sometimes can't go out freely since her business is open Monday to Sunday. This is very tiring for Patricia but she doesn't give up as she knows that she does it for a great purpose. Thanks to her business her family has economic stability. Patricia works with great joy and is very eager to improve her business since she wants to have a better store to get more customers. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is very punctual at making her payments as are her follow members of the communal bank. With the money she is asking for, Patricia will purchase sweets to stock her store in hopes to increase her sales as they are on high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and merchandise
loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
Diversos son las actividades económicas de las integrantes del grupo Progreso, que pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana y todas trabajan con la esperanza de dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Una de ellas es Susana M., casada y madre de 3 niños, ayuda en los ingresos de su familia tejiendo mantas, una habilidad que aprendió en el colegio, desea comprar lana de vicuña para luego tejer mantas de este material ya que es muy apreciado por sus clientas. Susana tiene su lugar de venta en la feria 16 de Julio y también ofrece sus productos en la Ceja Avenida Tihuanaku.
Al igual que Susana sus compañeras tienen sus negocios como la venta de zapatos, papa frita, alimentos secos, verduras y otros.
texts.en:
Many are the business activities that the members of the Progreso Group, a branch of the Panamericana headquarters, partake in. All of the members work with the hopes of giving their families a better quality of life. One of the members is Susana M., a married mother of three who helps to support the household by weaving blankets, a skill that she learned in school. She would like to purchase vicuna wool so that she can weave blankets out of this material because her customers prefer it. Susana has a stand at the 16 de Julio Market, but she also sells her products at Ceja Avenida Tihuanaku.

The rest of the group members sell footwear, fries, dried foods, vegetables, or other goods.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her small-scale business
loans.name: Moussaba Martine

texts.fr: Moussouba Martine D., 37 ans, mariée, 05 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de NIAFOR depuis 3 ans. Elle développe un petit commerce d'huile de palme et de balais artisanal. En moyenne, elle donne une participation mensuelle de 10 000 francs CFA pour les dépenses de la famille. Elle contribue à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Moussouba Martine D., aged 37, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de NIAFOR for three years. She is developing a small business selling palm oil and artisanal brooms. On average, she contributes 10,000 francs CFA each month towards covering family expenses. She's helping to improve her family's living conditions and to provide an education for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more grocery items to sell
loans.name: Norielyn

texts.en:
"Diligent and patience corresponds to success", says Norielyn R., 26 years of age. Norielyn manages a small retail store located in front of her house. Her a gross income is Php 5,000.00 monthly. The family's major source of income is farming, but they still need to work hard and earn enough money to sustain their daily needs. She is requesting a loan of Php 5,000.00, and will use it to purchase additional grocery commodities to sell in her mini stall.

Norielyn reside in the village of Sillawit, Cauayan City.  Isabela lives with her husband and their one year old son. Their house is located along the national highway going to Alicia, Isabela. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her desired loan request, because she believes that it will be a great help for her to reach her goals in life.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.
loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie L. Sr. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Ronnie owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling ice cream and chicken. Ronnie has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ronnie joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronnie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ronnie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ronnie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase Soda Packets
loans.name: Clarita

texts.es:
La señora Clarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Progresivas II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Clarita, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Clarita, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Clarita is part of the "Progressive Women II" Community Bank (Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department). She lives with her partner, is 48 years old, and has 4 children- two of whom are still her dependents. Clarita is hardworking and a fighter and decided to start her own business and sell sodas from her home. She administrates her own business, and does not have a schedule nor boss. When she began she had S/. 300.00 and could buy only 5 packets of soda but when she saw that sales were going well she began to purchase a bit more. She currently runs the same business and is now well known by her customers who are her neighbors, relatives, and friends. With the $350 she will buy more beverages like: sodas in different flavors, sizes, and brands as well as sparkling and still mineral water. Clarita has many goals ahead of her and feels motivated to make her dreams a reality. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her payments and intends to keep it that way.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool
loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 10 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella. Estudió primaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de lanas.
Feliciana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar lanas de diversos tipos.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Sra. Feliciana has been a member of the Communal Bank “Gran Poder” (Great Power) for the past 10 years. She lives in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. Feliciana is 49 years old, married, and has 7 children of whom 3 still live with her. She completed her elementary school education and engages in buying and selling wool.

Feliciana tells us that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles and used to increase her capital. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of 700 soles so that she can buy different types of wool.

Her dream for the future is to have her own house in Ilave. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the savings account.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products
loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO

Alcancía Comunal conformada por 02 hombres y 08 mujeres que demuestran que para progresar se necesita esfuerzo y dedicación, por ello se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios que le permiten mantener a sus familias aun con la situación difícil en estos últimos años.
Y es así como el  Sr Víctor empezó su negocio de la venta de aves en el mercado central de Lima hace varios años, negocio que en un momento fue ilegal y le trajo muchos problemas; como cabeza de familia esta situación era muy preocupante, entonces pensó en hacer jaulas para las aves y así pudo trasladar el negocio a su casa; al principio invirtió algo de dinero para la compra de materiales que necesitaba para este trabajo, gracias a Dios tuvo mucha demanda,  esto le permitió cancelar algunas deudas que tenia y lo más importante la mantención de su familia. Ahora está muy contento ya que tiene pedidos y empezara otro tipo de actividades.
La presidenta Vicki es una mujer muy emprendedora y gracias a su esfuerzo logro comprar una mototaxi  que le permite brindarle lo necesario y lo más preciado que tiene, son sus hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en algunos arreglos en la mototaxi y así poder obtener mejores ganancias.
Con los préstamos otorgados los socios han podido y podrán  invertir en productos para obtener mejores ganancias,  pero como en todo negocio las ganancias tienen sus altibajos.
texts.en:
"Caminando Hacia El Futuro" (Walking Toward the Future) is a community bank formed by 2 men and 8 women who have shown that dedication and effort are necessary to move ahead. They are involved in different kinds of businesses that allow them to support their families, even with the difficult situation these past few years.

That is why Mr. Victor started his business selling birds in the central market in Lima several years ago, which was illegal at the time and brought him many problems. As the head of his family, this worried him, so he thought of making cages for the birds, and he was able to move the business to his home. At the beginning, he invested some money to buy materials that he needed for this, and thanks to God there was a lot of demand. This allowed him to cancel some debts that he had, and most importantly, to support his family. Now he is very content since he has orders and will be able to start other types of businesses.

The President, Vicki, is an entrepreneurial woman, and thanks to her hard work, obtained a motorcycle taxi, which allows her to give her precious children what they need. She will invest this loan in repairs for her mototaxi so she can have a better income.

With these loans, the members have been able to and will continue to invest in products to earn a better income, but in all businesses there are ups and downs.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies
loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta B. is from the village of Owaon. She is 39 years old. Julieta is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta raises and sells pigs. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP average per month from these activities.

In 2008, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be Julieta's 4th loan from PMPC and her third time on Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and pay for her children's education. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Supplies such as paint, gasoline and thinner
loans.name: Ysmael

texts.es:
Ysmael tiene 50 años, es conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos, pertenece al banco comunal “Yanapakuy” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene un pequeño taller  mecánico. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va  bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. Ysmael requiere el préstamo de los 300 dólares, que invertirá en comprar materiales como  pintura, gasolina y tiner.
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

(Yanapakuy es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa “ayudemos”)
texts.en:
Ysmael is 50 years old, married with four children, and he belongs to the “Yanapakuy de la Asociación Arariwa” communal bank. He has a small auto repair shop and has been in this business for several years. Thanks to his persistence, he is doing well. Ysmael needs a $300 loan, which he will invest in supplies, such as paint, gasoline and thinner. He is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium and he promises to pay according to the repayment schedule. (The word “Yanapakuy” is a Quechua word, which translates to mean “We will help.”)

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance
loans.name: José Ramiro

texts.es: La familia de Jose Ramiro está constituida por 4 personas, los dos padres y dos hijos, ellos son casados y cuentan con vivienda propia. Jose Ramiro se dedica al transporte de pasajeros cuenta con tres vehículos propios un de ellos es manejado por él y dos por chóferes que le dan renta neta diariamente. La competencia en sus actividades es media ya que hay otras personas  que desarrollan las mismas actividades. El crédito será destinado para  el mantenimiento de uno de los vehículos. Este será su tercer crédito con Agrocapital, con un excelente cumplimiento de pago en todas sus otras operaciones.
texts.en:
José Ramiro's family is made up of 4 people, the two parents and two children. They are married and have a home of their own. José Ramiro works in passenger transportation . He has three vehicles of his own, one of them is driven by him and the other two by two drivers who pay him a net rent daily. There's an average level of competition in the field since there are other people who work in the same activities. The credit will be destined to do some maintenance repairs in one of the vehicles. This will be his third credit with Agrocapital and he fulfilled his payback obligations perfectly in his other operations.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee and fruit plants
loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
Darío es un hombre de 60 años, quien vive con su segunda pareja y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia construida de madera y hojas de “humiro” (árbol de hojas extensas y fuertes). Su vivienda está ubicada a 20 kilómetros de la ciudad.   

Él cuenta con tierras propias donde cultiva café y plátano, trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, quienes le ayudan principalmente en la cosecha, ya que a diario su pareja se encarga de los quehaceres de la casa y sus hijos estudian. 
Lo que más le gusta es mantener sus tierras limpias y colocar nuevas plantas, pero lo que le disgusta es cuando alguna plaga o las inclemencias del clima perjudican sus frutos; sin embargo, para Darío esto es un reto, pues en 20 años ninguna plaga o mal clima lo ha vencido.
El café es su producto más rentable debido a que anualmente, luego de comercializarlo, le deja buenos ingresos económicos con los que compra más chacras. Por otro lado, cada quince días, el plátano es el que le sirve para solventar sus gastos domésticos y la educación de sus hijos.
Más adelante, con el financiamiento de un programa gubernamental, piensa concretar un proyecto de reforestación con plantas maderables que viene cuidando en su vivero.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que en cada pago seguirá demostrando su responsabilidad y puntualidad, pues está bastante agradecido con la entidad y con las personas de su banco comunal porque siempre se muestran solidarios con cada uno de los integrantes. Con el dinero ahora solicitado comprará mil plantas de café, 400 plantas de frutas cítricas y contratará operarios para preparar sus terrenos adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Dario is a 60-year-old man who lives with his wife and their five children in their own house, made of wood and humiro leaves (a tree with long, sturdy leaves). Their home is located 20 kilometers from the city. He has his own land where he cultivates coffee and plantain. He works with the help of his wife and four of their children, who mainly help him during the harvest, since his wife tends to the domestic chores on a daily basis and their children study. The thing he likes most is keeping his lands clean and planting new crops, but he doesn't like when a plague or the harshness of the climate harms his fruits. However, Dario considers it a challenge. In 20 years, neither plague nor bad weather has defeated him. Coffee is his most profitable product, and each year after selling it, it leaves him with a good income with which he purchases more farmland. On the other hand, every 15 days the plantains allow him to cover his domestic expenses and the education of his children. In the future, with the financing of a governmental program, he plans to create a reforestation project with timber-yielding plants that he has been raising in his nursery. This is the the fourth loan that he has requested through MFP, and he assures that with each payment he will continue demonstrating his responsibility and punctuality. He is quite grateful to the organization and the people in his communal bank, because they always show solidarity with each one of the members. With the money that he is currently requesting, he will purchase 1,000 coffee plants, 400 citric fruit plants, and he will contract workers to adequately prepare his lands.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more used bags to sell
loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa sells slightly used bags. She has been in this business for ten years. With the proceeds of her business, she supports her children's education and also supports her husband with other house expenses. She is requesting a loan amount of 170,000 NGN to purchase more slightly used bags to sell. 

She is 42 years old and married with five children. She is a member of the Igbo tribe. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more feed to boost her business.
loans.name: Alabi

texts.en: Alabi is a business woman and has a poultry farm where she rears birds to sell. She also has a piggery where she rears pigs for commercial purposes. She loves this business because of the opportunities to interact with her customers. She has been in the poultry business for a long time. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. She is married and has four children. She is 39 years old. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more poultry feed to boost her business. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering
loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle O. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan Cotabato. She is 38 years old. Annabelle is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Annabelle decided to request same amount of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Annabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.
loans.name: Hormiguitas Unidas Group

texts.es:
Petrona S. D. 42 años es casada y vive  en L. zona Nuevo Amanecer, hace 6 años, elL.  tiene el negocio D.  tienda D. barrio en su domicilio que le permite atender las labores D. casa.
Las demás integrantes D. L. Asociación Comunal Hormiguitas Unidas tienen variados negocios como L. venta D. ropa deportiva, tejido D. mantas, venta D. pescado y costura D. edredones. Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o capital fijo. 
Ellas se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Alto Lima.
texts.en:
Petrona S., 42, is married and lives in the Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) zone. She has had a neighborhood grocery store in her home for the last six year; having it in her home allows her to tend to household chores. The other members of the "Hormiguitas Unidas" (United Little Ants) communal bank have various commercial activities such as: sportswear sales, blanket weaving, fish sales, comforter sewing. They all need funds to acquire merchandise, ingredients, or for fixed capital. They meet every two weeks at the Alto Lima Focal Center.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition
loans.name: Cecilia Veronica

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo esta ubicado en la ciudad de Azogues o conocida tambien como San Francisco de Peleusí de Azogues capital de la provincia del Azuay, urbe que por su ubicación geográfica  goza  de un clima asoleado, permitiendo una fisonomia de gran belleza durante las horas de mas luz solar ya que produce contrastes que acentua su distribución urbano-arquitectonica, ademas podemos apreciar las grandes inclinaciones hasta el cajón del río Burgay.
