Komşuları Maya'yı önermiş borç para al, yaşamının önünü açarsın demişler.  Bu durumda bana kim borç verir,vermezler demiş.  Ancak maya saha sorumlusuyla karşılaşınca hayatı değişmiş,başvurusu kabul edilmiş.  Grup kredisiyle 750 TL borç almış.  Küçük bir kısmıyla ev kiralamış,eski eşya satanlardan çocuğunun ve kendisinin yatabileceği ve oturabileceği iki kanepe alıp yaşayabilecekleri alanı sağladı,kalan parasıyla İstanbul'a gidip,biraz boncuk,birazda bohça malı aldı.  Bazen bohçasını sırtına alıp satış yaptı,bazende boncuklardan ürettiği tesbihleri cami ve yol kenarlarında sattı ve borcunu ödedi.  Bir kredi daha talep etti.  Kredisini alıp bohça malı alıp sattı.  Satışa çıkmadığı günlerde,evinin yanında boş olan bahçede denemek için sebze fidesi ekti.  Fideleri pazara çıkarıp sattı.Gördü ki bu iş daha fazla para kazandırıyor.Maya'ya borcu da bitti.  Bir kredi daha alarak,bahçe kiralayıp fide üreticiliğine başladı.  Fideleri pazara çıkarıp satar,kendince iyi para kazanır.Kendisine ev yapmaya karar verir.Evet şimdi kendi evinde oturmaktadır.Kredi borcu bitmiştir.Tekrar kredi alır ve yine fide eker,yanında mevsimlik işçi çalışmaktadır artık.  Fideleri pazara götürmek için arabaya ihtiyacı vardır ve 2.yıl fide geliriyle kendisini taşıyabilecek düzeyde bir araba alır.  Artık arabası da vardır.Fatma Hanım'ın hayatı çok ama çok değişti.  O artık özgür ve mutlu bir kadın.
Fatma Hanım aldığı bu kredi ile kiraladığı tarlanın bakımı,fide tohumları,gübreleme,sulama malzemesi,sera muşambası gibi üretim için gerekli malzeme almak istiyor.Bu kredi ile bir tarla daha kiralama fırsatı olacak,arabasını yeniliyecek.Belki kendi tarlası olacak,kiralama yerine kendi yerinde üretim yapacak.Bir hayalide umreye gitmek,gezmek.Oğlunu okutuyor ,başarılı olduğunu düşünüyor.İyi okullarda okumasını ve iyi iş sahibi olmasını istiyor. Yaşlılığına yatırım yapıyor.Yeniliğe açık,girişken,mücadeleci.

loans.use: to buy some goods to sell to her co-workers in the factory.
loans.name: Sreyly

texts.en: Sreyly, 29, is a garment factory worker who earns $4 per day. Her husband is also working in the factory and earns $4 per day. They have four children; all of them are studying. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $15 on electricity, $40 on school fees and $12 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy some goods to sell to her co-workers. She saw the others sell goods in the factory and make some income, so she follows and she can get some profit from it. She wants to support her children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her husband's shoe-making business.
loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s shoe-making business. He has been operating his business for the past 20 years and has a good number of business contacts. These days he has a big order to fulfill for which he wants to buy raw materials. With the loan, he will buy leather, nails, glue, and shoe polish. 

She herself is a seamstress who sews clothes for her community clients to supplement the income for her family. She is the mother of four children and all of them stay at home.
 
Sajida is very confident that after investing the loan in her husband's business, her husband will be able to finish the order on time and make great profits. 

Note: in the photo, the woman raising her hand is Sajida.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.
loans.name: Anonymous

loans.use: to purchase equipment used for air conditioning repair for her business
loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
Placida is married with 3 children. Placida is 53 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Placida has a shop for air conditioning repair. She has had this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase equipment used for air conditioning repair for her business. Placida has been a member of PMPC since the beginning of 2011. In the future, Placida hopes to expand her shop.

loans.use: to purchase walnuts for retail sale
loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат. Его супругу зовут Елена. У них есть четырехлетний сын. Александр имеет собственный бизнес.
Свой бизнес Александр начал в возрасте 18 лет. Он покупает овощи, фрукты, грецкие орехи  оптом и продает их в розницу.  Александр предприимчивый и трудолюбивый и поэтому его бизнес идет вверх.  Этот бизнес содержит семью.
Александр просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен для закупки грецкого ореха. На протяжении всей зимы он закупает грецкие орехи, перерабатывает  и тут же перепродает. Александр получит хорошую прибыль и улучшит благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Alexander is married.  His wife's name is Yelena, and they have a four-year-old son.  Alexander has his own business, which he started when he was just 18 years old.  He buys vegetables, fruits and walnuts wholesale and sells them retail.  Alexander is an entrepreneurial and hardworking person, and this is why his business is moving up.  This business supports his family.  Alexander is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia to buy walnuts.  He buys walnuts during winter, processes and resells them right away.  Alexander wants to make a good profit and improve his family's welfare.

loans.use: to purchase calves
loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from the village of Gomi in East Georgia. She is 43 years old, married and lives with her family: her husband Vladimer, her daughter in law and 1 year old grandson. Naira works as a milkmaid on a local farm. Along with her main job, Naira is actively involved in operating the family farm. The family has 2 milk cows and 1 calf. They produce cheese and sell it locally. Also the family owns 0.80 hectare land, where maize and beans are grown. Total average monthly income of the family is 950 Laris. 

Naira requested credit to purchase 6-7 calves. He will grow the calves during winter months and sell them in spring for much higher price. It will bring to the family significant additional income, which will be used for improving family living conditions. Also Naira will use 10% of the loaned amount for covering her old loan, taken from Credo.

loans.use: to buy chairs and for the repair of her videoke unit.
loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke rental business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy chairs and for the repair of her videoke unit.  Cheryl has been in this business for two years. Cheryl earns more income from a general store and pig fattening.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy 20 metres of school uniform material, 12 metres of seat covers and form rubber.
loans.name: Anonymous Group

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell
loans.name: Chati

texts.en:
Chati is 34-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in South Sudan for the past four years. 

Chati is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water
loans.name: Rebeca's Group

texts.en:
Rebeca lives in a home with mud walls, dirt floor, and an iron roof in Kopudo village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya with her family which includes 6 children. The community of Kopudo village collects their drinking water from the local spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Kopudo’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans and then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. In Kopudo, 27 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Rebeca has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water to keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Benter, Felix, Walter, and Joseph.

Kopudo village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Rebeca believes that the dispenser will help to reduce water-borne diseases in the community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce world carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Rebeca’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other necessary things for her farmland
loans.name: Moti

texts.en:
Moti, age 51 a widow resides in the Koraput district of Odisha. She is a housewife and lives with her children in a small village in a small house. In the daytime, she supports her children in the agricultural activities of the family. She also is the part of a group of her village. She decided to take up loans for financially supporting her families. She take up alternate income-generating activities that would help her in contributing to her household income. Moti wanted to support her children by growing additional cash crops like vegetables in addition to the paddy and other crops they rely on. These vegetables are in high demand in the market, and the area is known for its high quality of vegetables. 

She has requested this loan so she can take up such activities to support her families. She will use her loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other necessary things for her farmland.

loans.use: To buy the dishable products and to open a new ray of religious articles selling.
loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Dress maker by trade, Madam Afi H. was born on 19th April 1968 at Aného. Her husband retired for 2 years, can only benefit from a meagre pension, again irregular and insufficient for the needs of the household while they are five (05) children under their control. So Madam Afi H. was launched since 4 years in the basic essential products and with the profit made, she succeeds as best as possible to contribute to the family needs. She has already benefited from two credits well repaid and deserves to be backed again. Madam Afi H. requests a third credit of $650 to enlarge her shop by the dishable products and to open a new ray of religious articles selling.

Couturière de formation, Madame H. Afi est née le 19 Avril 1968 à Aného. Son mari, retraité depuis 2 ans, ne touche qu’une maigre pension, encore irrégulière et insuffisante pour les besoins du foyer alors qu’ils ont cinq (05) enfants à encore supporter. Alors, Madame H. Afi s’est-elle lancée depuis 4 ans dans le commerce des produits de première nécessité et avec les profits réalisés, elle arrive tant que mal à contribuer aux besoins de la famille. Elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits bien remboursés et mérite d’être encore soutenue Madame H. sollicite un troisième crédit de $650 pour agrandir sa boutique par des produits de vaisselle et ouvrir un nouveau rayon de vente d’articles religieux.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for the retail shop
loans.name: Tafale

texts.en: Tafale is a strong and a hard working woman.  Her business is a Retail shop.   Tafale was born on the 28th of July 1968.  She gave birth to seven children, four are in school and three are staying home.  Tafale comes from a family of eleven members.  Tafale has a strong heart for running her business and she has no doubt at all. She’s confident in running her business by herself.  Tafale's kids also help her if she’s not available.  Tafale provides the best service to her customers by ordering good quality products to sell at her shop.  Tafale's aim is to extend her shop into a wholesale business.  Tafale is capable of how to handle customer of what they want.  She uses her loan to buy more products to fill empty shelves and to buy iron roofing,paints to renovate her shop to attract  more customers.

loans.use: Construction on his home
loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo lives with his wife, Felipa Tambo, and their two children, in a small home that they own on the west side of La Paz. He has worked for a textile business in the city for the past 10 years, and his wife sells juices at a sales post in a local market. Their brick-and-adobe home has four rooms with a small terrace that has been difficult to construct. The loan Domingo is requesting would be used to finish the terrace as well as put on a roof and close off an area on the ground floor to be used as his son's bedroom. This is the first loan Domingo has requested, and his background shows he would be able to fulfill it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Domingo H. vive en compañía de su esposa, la señora Felipa Tambo y sus dos hijos aun dependientes, en una pequeña casa de su propiedad en la zona 8 de Diciembre, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, Trabaja como empleado en una empresa textil de La Paz desde hace diez años y su esposa se dedica a la venta de jugos en un puesto de venta en un mercado de su zona. La vivienda del señor Domingo H. cuenta con cuatro habitaciones de adobe y ladrillo y con una pequeña terraza cuya construcción se encuentra en obra gruesa. El destino del crédito es para concluir dicha terraza y realizar el techado y cerramiento en planta baja para contar así con un dormitorio para su hijo. El señor Domingo H. será beneficiado por primera vez con un crédito en nuestra institución, y la evaluación socioeconómica muestra que tienen capacidad para cubrir su obligación crediticia.

loans.use: Pay for trips in order to import a wider variety of merchandise. This will improve her income and help her establish a business buying and selling vehicles, which she will leave to her five children, as their means of supporting themselves.
loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria M., a single mother of 5, works selling automobile accessories in the "July 16" market in the city of El Alto. She has been a Pro Mujer partner for approximately a year and a half. The injection of capital was essential in the establishment of Victoria's source of work and sustenance because of the size of her family.

During her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, Victoria applied for a loan of $200, which allowed her to stock her sales stall and collaborate with her eldest son. With the collaboration her son was able to enter the automobile motor and spare parts business. The loan was repaid in a period of 6 months, the maximum period for repayment.

Currently Victoria needs a loan to cover the costs of business trips through which she will import a wider variety of merchandise. The additional merchandise will allow her to increase her income, with the aim to establish a business buying and selling vehicles. She hopes to leave the business to her children as their means of supporting themselves.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Victoria M., madre de 5 hijos, soltera, trabaja como vendedora de artículos para automóviles en la Feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Es socia de Pro Mujer aproximadamente un año y medio, la inyección de capital fue esencial para el establecimiento de su fuente de trabajo y sustento diario, tomando en cuenta lo numeroso de su descendencia.

En un primer ciclo, es decir, el primer desembolso aprobado, Victoria solicitó un crédito de 200 $us. que le permitió el abastecimiento de su puesto de venta y colaborar a su hijo mayor para que incursione en el comercio de motores y repuestos. Este monto fue repagado en un lapso de 6 meses que es el máximo para cada ciclo.

En la actualidad la señora victoria M. necesita un crédito que le permita realizar viajes para la importación de mayor variedad de mercadería y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos, con el objetivo de establecer un negocio de compra y venta de vehículos, que podrá heredar posteriormente para el sustento de sus 5 hijos.

loans.use: Increase stock
loans.name: Patrício Piloto

texts.pt:
Patrício Piloto M. is 30 years old. He is married and father of one daughter. He lives in the neighborhood of Magoanine, around the city of Maputo. He sells basic groceries in a smallstand in his home. Patrício joined the program in August 2006 ad requested a loan of 3.000MT. He is now in the 3rd cycle of the program. Patrício is requesting a loan of 7.000MT, to be repaid in 7 months. He plans on increasing his stock, and strengthening his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Patrício Piloto M. tem 30 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de uma filha. Vive no bairro de Magoanine, arredores da cidade de Maputo. Vende produtos de 1ª necessidade numa pequena barraca na sua residência. Entrou para o programa em Agosto de 2006 com um empréstimo de 3.000MT. Está no 3º ciclo de mepreéstimo e vai tomar 7.000 para pagar em 7 meses com vista a reforçar o seu negócio.

loans.use: Purchase of snacks to sell at a major festival and dishes for sale in her primary business.
loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina Q. Limachi is the mother of five school-age children. Three years ago she separated from her husband, and she now lives in a small house with her children. Today Josefina devotes herself to selling a wide variety of dishes, which she sells in two stands that she has in the 16 of July Market in the city of El Alto. It’s been more than fifteen years since she began in this business model: Josefina travels to Oruro to acquire her merchandise which she later sells in the markets mentioned above. At the same time, Josefina sells toasted peanuts and other snacks at parties and folk dances, where they eat a lot of this sort of thing. Josefina needs this money to invest in purchasing toasted peanut and other snacks which she will sell at the All Souls Festival, which is a traditionally an event where she can count on lots of consumption. She will also invest it in continuing her dish sales, as these are the only ways in which she can ensure the well being of her children and herself, since she cannot rely on support from her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Josefina Q. Limachi, es madre de 5 hijos, todos en edad escolar, hace 3 años se separó de su esposo, y ahora vive en una pequeña casita junto a sus hijos. Actualmente Josefina se dedica a la venta de gran variedad de vajilla, la que vende en 2 puestos que posee en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este rubro, Josefina viaja a Oruro para poder adquirir su mercadería, que posteriormente vende en los lugares mencionados. Paralelamente, Josefina se dedica a la venta de maní tostado, pasankallas, poroto tostado y otros en fiestas, entradas folklóricas, donde se consume mucho de este producto. Josefina precisa de capital, con el fin de invertir en la compra de maní tostado y otros, los que venderá en la fiesta de Todos Santos, que es una fecha tradicional y de alto consumo de este producto, así también invertirá en la continuidad de su negocio de venta de vajilla, solo de esta manera podrá asegurar el bienestar de sus hijos y de ella misma, tomando en cuenta que ya no cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

loans.use: Increase the amount of fresh fish he has for sale
loans.name: Unisa

texts.en: Unisa is 39 years old and married with two children.  He sells fresh fish in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.  With his savings and a previous loan, he rented a small cold room where fish can be kept fresh.   He sells the fish both retail and wholesale.  His plan is to be the sole distributor of fish to smaller retailers and therefore he is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200 to increase the amount of fish he can furnish.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi
loans.name: Thong

texts.en:
Mrs. H. Thong has been married since 1997 and has one son and one daughter. She learned to weave silk from her mother, and started her silk production in 1995. Her husband is running a motor taxi business. Their two children are studying in the local school. 

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time of the amount of $400. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike for her husband to help his motor taxi business, which could help him to provide better service because the current motorbike is too old.

loans.use: Buy more crabs at higher quantities
loans.name: Anonymous

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed (Membeli bibit babi dan pakan)
loans.name: Ni Komang Yudi Artin

texts.id:
Ni Komang Yudi Artini is a school teacher at a local kindergarten. LIving in a village is enabling her to have additional activities as a pig farmer. With initial capital of IDR 1.2 million (approx of USD 125), she has 4 piglets which are raised at her backyard. The expensive price of pig feed troubles her as she does not have enough capital. With the help from Dinari, she will be able to buy pig feed and another 3 piglets. She hopes that her farming activities can be a successful one.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Hidup di desa membuat Ni Komang Yudi Artini yang bekerja sebagai Guru TK juga mempunyai usaha yang produktif, yaitu beternak babi. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.200.000.- Ni KomangYudi membeli 4 ekor bibit babi yang dipelihara dibelakang rumahnya. Harga pakan yang mahal membuat Ni Komang Yudi kebingungan dalam mencari modal. Dengan bantuan dari Dinari, Ni Komang Yudi bisa membeli pakan dan juga tambahan 3 ekor bibit babi lagi. Ni Komang Yudi memberi makan babinya 2 kali sehari pada pagi dan sore hari Kandangnya dibersihkan setiap hari, sebelum Ni Komang Yudi memberi makan ternaknya. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diberikan usahanya akan semakin meningkat.

loans.use: Finish construction of grocery store and buy inventory
loans.name: Azarias Fernando

texts.en:
Azarias is 31 years old and is originally from Inhambane. His parents died when he was very young, so he moved with his 3 brothers to Maputo, where he went to school until 5th grade. He is married and has 4 children: the 2 oldest girls (11 and 8 years old) already go to school.

In 1998 Azarias started working at “Padaria do Papa”, a bakery shop in Maputo, where he learnt how to bake bread. In 2002 he decided to open his own bakery shop, but Maputo would be very competitive, so he moved to Ponta D’Ouro, where wood was very accessible. Ponta D’Ouro is a beach village on the border with South Africa, very famous for its tourism, especially among South Africans.

Azarias worked in construction to save money to build his own oven, and in 2003 he had already started to bake bread. He bakes between 300 to 560 loaves of bread per day, depending on the season. Each loaf is sold for MTn 3.5 (around US$0.15) and they sell out very fast, as Azarias is one of the best bakers in the region (he sells to the most famous hotels and restaurants in Ponta D’Ouro). A sack of 10 kilograms of wheat costs around MTn 200 (about US$ 8) and is enough to make 85 loaves of bread. His oven has the capacity to bake up to 100 loaves at once, so Azarias starts very early in the morning in order to finish baking by 6-7am. Azarias makes approximately MTn 7,500 (US$ 310) per month, and after paying expenses, including his 2 employees and the lady who helps with the house, his profit is around MTn 2,000 (US$ 83).

This is Azarias’s third loan with Hluvuku. The first two he used to buy raw materials (wheat, salt ,and yeast). This time Azarias plans to use his loan of US$ 350 to finish building a grocery store near the oven (which is inside his yard – near his house), where he plans to sell other food products. Azarias believes that he can even start buying some inventory with this loan. The lady who works at his house will work at the grocery store, and his wife will take care of the house.

In the future, Azarias would like to have a fourth loan to build another house on his land to increase his income through rent. In Ponta D’Ouro many people come to work during the season and rent rooms, and Azarias believes this would be a good business venture. What an entrepreneur!

loans.use: To bulk-buy vegetables and fruits to move a small business forward.
loans.name: María Cristina

texts.en:
María Cristina, a proud mother of four sons and two daughters, is fifty years old and a well experienced entrepreneur who lives in the Don Gregorio community of San Cristobal. Cris – affectionately called by the women of the community – has been selling vegetables for nine years. Every day, she sets her goods on her large table in the public market and passers-by stop along the sidewalk to purchase the vegetables and fruits that this entrepreneur offers.

With her loan, María Cristina will buy more goods in order to satisfy her customers’ needs and move her business forward. The entrepreneur wants to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.
loans.name: Adebinpe

texts.en:
Adebinpe O. is known as Mama Charcoal because she has been a charcoal distributor for a very long time in her community. Customers within and outside of her community patronize her. She is 45 years old and married with six children. She has been in this business since 1999. She lives at Sabo oniba in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Adebinpe has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past four years. She needs a loan of $700.00 to buy more charcoal so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase greater consumable good. Purchase cooking utensils.
loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Mrs Marisa is a partner in the Communal Bank "The Riojana Woman". She lives in the San Martin region, in the province and district of Rioja. She dedicates herself to the preparation and sale of food, in an equipped location at jr. Santo Toribo Nº 835, where her customers come on a daily basis. They are inhabitants of the area or transits from nearby locations.

Her experience in the preparation of diverse types of food, her maturity and the necessity of owning her own business propelled her to begin this business, in order to provide an education to her children.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 ($ 350.00), to be repaid in 6 months, she would stock her store by purchasing bulk quantities of rice, bags of sugar, packets of noodles, oil and eggs. She would also purchase stainless steel pots for the preparation of food.

Mrs Marisa is 38 years old, is a very enthusiastic and happy woman together with her children and is a humble person whose dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marisa es socia del Banco Comunal “LA MUJER RIOJANA”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Rioja y distrito de Rioja, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en un ambiente acondicionado ubicado en el jr. Santo Toribio Nº 835 donde diariamente acuden su comensales que son moradores de la propia localidad o transeúntes de lugares cercanos. Su experiencia en la preparación de diversos platos de comida, su buena sazón y la necesidad de tener un ingreso propio, la impulsaron a iniciarse en este negocio, para poder educar a sus hijos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 que serán pagados en 6 meses implementó su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar por sacos, fideos en paquetes, aceite a granel huevos en jabas, también implementó con la compra de ollas de acero inoxidable para la preparación de sus alimentos. La señora Marisa tiene 38 años, es una muy mujer entusiasta y alegre que junto a sus hijos y con la humildad que demuestra sueña con mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and coconuts to increase her inventory.
loans.name: Halima's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 4. She became a banana and coconut seller in 2006. She works from 8am to 11pm everyday at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $88 from her sales.

Halima hopes this loan can help her buy more coconuts and bananas for her business. She will also share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal and food sales.

loans.use: Purchase of pots, blenders, and a variety of bread to improve business and increase income.
loans.name: Hortensia Y Edith Group

texts.es:
Hortensia and Edith are members of “Banco Comunal Cusi Urpi”. “Cusi urpi” means “happy dove” in Quechua. Hortensia is married, 45 years old and has 5 children. She sells cosmetics from catalogues to friends and relatives as well as small devices such as blenders, irons and pots requested by her clients. Her sales are on credit.

Edith is a single mother, 33 years old and has 1 son. She sells “Unión” products which are industrialized bread and cakes, her sales are on credit and she sells to employees at institutions that pay at the end of the month.

Hortensia and Edith need 800 soles each to be invested in buying pots, blenders and a variety of bread. It is their dream to expand their businesses, that their children have their needs covered and a solid education, and to set up a stable shop.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Hortensia y Edith son socias del Banco Comunal Cusi Urpi que significa Palomita Feliz en Quechua. Hortensia es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Hortensia vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además Hortensia vende artefactos pequeños como licuadoras, planchas, ollas, que le piden sus clientes, sus ventas son al crédito.

< Mientras que Edith es madre soltera, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Edith vende productos Unión, que son panes industriales, también pasteles, sus ventas son al crédito y ofrece a trabajadores de instituciones que pagan cada fin de mes.

Hortensia y Edith necesitan un préstamo de 800 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, licuadora, panes variados. Los sueños de Hortensia y Edith son ampliar sus negocios, a sus hijos no les falte nada, tengan una buena educación y tener una tienda estable

loans.use: Money to be used by 13 members of the communal bank to invest in their businesses
loans.name: Tayta Soltero Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Tayta Soltero, pertenece a la Comunidad D. La MejoR., ubicada en el distrito D. Mariscal Cáceres en Huancavelica. Esta comunidad esta ubicada al margen derecho del río Mantaro entre 2600 y 3600 metros D. altitud, tiene un clima cálido, cuenta con acceso a las ciudades D. Huancavelica y Huancayo. Fue llamado Mariscal Cáceres porque por este lugar pasaban los virreyes, encomenderos, ejércitos D. las revoluciones pues cruzaban los caminos D. Ayacucho, Huancayo y Huancavelica.

Julia Chapca, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar, su negocio es la venta D. verduras y comida. Con los prestamos que recibe los invierte en mercadería, Julia antes solo vendía verduras, ahora venD. también anticuchos y papa rellena, sus hijos mayores le ayudan.

Zila V., tiene negocio D. cochinilla y venta D. Tara, empezó muy joven a trabajar junto a su esposo, ella ahora se dedica al negocio y su esposo al transporte, la falta D. dinero y capital fue un problema que tuvo que enfrentar. Con el prestamos que recibirá surtirá su negocio para tener mas ingresos.

Ana S., tiene una bodega desD. hace 13 años, cuando recién empezó los distribuidores n le daban crédito, ana aprendió a ahorrar y a invertir en su mercadería ahora su negocio a crecido. Ahora ella da crédito a sus vecinas que necesitan algunos productos D. su bodega. Ella invertirá su préstamo en mercadería y con las ganancias arreglará su casa. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Tayta Soltero Communal Bank belongs to the community of La MejoR., located in the Mariscal Cáceres in Huancavelica. This community is located on along the right siD. of the Mantaro River at an altituD. between 2,600 and 3,600 meters. It has a warm climate and offers access to the cities of Huancavelica and Huancayo. It was named Mariscal Cáceres because it is a place where viceroys, military leaders and revolutionary armies passed by on the roads from Ayacucho, Huncayo and Huancavelica. Julia Chapca is a single mother with four school-aged children. Her business is vegetable and food sales. With the loans she receives she invests in merchandise. Before, Julia only sold vegetables. Now she also sells kebabs and stuffed potatoes. Her older children help her. Zila V. has a business raising pigs and selling tara. She started very young working alongsiD. her husband. She now takes care of the business and her husband is in charge of the transportation. The lack of money and capital was a problem that she had to face. With the loans that she will receive she will increase her business to have more income. Ana S. has had a general store for the last 13 years. When she started the distributors wouldn’t give her credit. Ana learned to save and to invest in merchandise and now her business has grown. Now she gives credit to her neighbors that need certain products from her store. Eh will invest her loan in merchandise and with the earnings she will make repairs to her home. Her dream is that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to prepare food, a table, 12 pots and firewood.
loans.name: Gricelda Consuelo

texts.es:
Gricelda tiene 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo, es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Luchadores de Yungay y vive en Barrios Altos Calle 4 s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.
Empezó vendiendo quinua en la esquina del mercado y con el apoyo que le brindó Manuela Ramos cuenta con un puesto de venta de comida en el mercado campo ferial de la provincia de Yungay. Su esposo es técnico enfermero y además la apoya en este negocio. 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos, una mesa para la venta de comida, 12 ollas y un camión de leña.
Su mayor sueño es tener un restaurante propio.
texts.en:
Gricelda is 29, has a son and is a member of the community bank “fighting women” from Yungay, she lives on Barrios Altos, district and province of Yungay, Ancash. She started selling quinoa in a corner of the market and with the support of Manuela Ramos she now has a food stand in a market of Yungay. Her husband is a medical technician and also helps with the business. With this $400 loan, to be repaid in six months, she will buy products, a table to set up the food for sale, 12 pots and a truck of firewood. Her biggest dream is to own a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in harvesting the potatoes and buying manure fertilizer.
loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y dos hijos. Se dedica de manera independiente a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, siembra papa, cebada  y habas; también vende animales, todos los días lunes los lleva a una localidad cercana a su zona, de esta manera  Vilma asegura el ingreso familiar. El trabajo que realiza es siempre junto con su esposo, a pesar de los días muy calurosos ella no se desalienta, porque está habituada a esta forma de trabajo y además  ahora se está impulsando más porque tiene en mente mejorar cada vez más. Esta es la primera vez que solicita el préstamo y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad. Con este dinero podrá invertir en la campaña de siembra para la papa, también para el forraje de su ganado. Comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Vilma is 26 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. She is dedicated in an independent manner to agriculture and has been for ten years. She sows potatoes, barley, and beans. She also sells animals, which she brings every Monday to a nearby town in her zone to sell, and in this way she ensures the family income. The work that she does is always done together with her husband in spite of the very hot days when she is not discouraged because she is used to this form of work. Furthermore, she is very driven because she has it in her mind to improve more every day. This is the first time that she has requested a loan and so far she has shown a lot of responsibility. With this money she will be able to invest in sowing potatoes and forraging for her livestock. She will also buy sacks of manure fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to process into cereal products
loans.name: Sope Khadim Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Sope Khadim  faisant parti de l'écovillage Thiaroye compte lutter contre l'oisiveté et prendre en charge leur propre destinée. C’est pourquoi les femmes se sont organisées en groupement et préfèrent s’activer pour la promotion socio-économique de ses membres tout en participent au développement de leur communauté. Ce prêt a pour objectif de renforcer l’activité de transformation de céréale locale dont elles maitrisent déjà. L'activité tourne autour de l’achat de céréales locales (mil, maïs, sorgho) et après procéder à leur transformation. La vente de ces produits transformés d’où le « thiacri, araw » (noms sénégalais des produits)  permettra de rembourser le prêt sans grande difficulté. L’écoulement des produits ne posant aucun problème car l’offre étant inférieure à la demande, ce prêt permettra donc d’améliorer l’offre au plan qualitatif et quantitatif.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sope Khadim, being part of the eco-village Thiaroye, intend to fight against idleness and to take charge of their own destiny. This is why the women got organized into a group. They prefer to be active in the socio-economic advancement of all its members by participating in the development of their community.

The objective of this loan is to bolster their business of processing local grain. This is work they've already mastered, and it is centered on purchasing local grain (millet, corn, sorghum) and then proceeding to process it. The sale of the resulting products "thiacri" and "araw" (the Senegalese names) will allow the loan to be repaid without much difficulty. The turnover of these products pose no problem because the quantity to be sold is less than the level of demand. This loan will allow them to improve the quality and quantity of the goods to be sold.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital
loans.name: Carolina Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "CAROLINA" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA CINTHIA PAOLA Y CONFORMAN 13 SOCIAS DE LAS CUALES 11 SON MUJERES Y 2 HOMBRES, TODAS ELLAS SE CONOCEN ENTRE SI YA QUE RESIDEN EN EL MISMO BARRIO, EN SU MAYORÍA SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES COMERCIALES COMO LA VENTA DE ROPA, ABARROTES EN TIENDAS DE BARRIO, VENTA DE COMIDA AMBULANTE, A LA ELABORACIÓN DE PAN, AL SERVICIO DE LIMPIEZA Y A LA VENTA DE LICORES. DENTRO DEL RUBRO COMERCIAL EXISTE MUCHA COMPETENCIA POR LO QUE LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENE QUE BUSCAR MODOS DIFERENTES PARA PODER VENDER SU MERCADERÍA Y LOGRA UN MEJOR INGRESO PARA EL SUSTENTO DE SUS FAMILIAS. EL CRÉDITO OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL ESTA DESTINADO AL INCREMENTO DE MERCARÍA E INSUMOS PARA PODER COMPETIR EN EL MERCADO COMERCIAL. LOS SOCIOS (AS) TRABAJARON ANTES CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE CONOCEN DEL TRABAJO Y LA RESPONSABILIDAD QUE SE REQUIERE EN CADA FINANCIAMIENTO.
texts.en:
The Carolina Group is represented by Cinthia Paola and consists of 13 members, 11 women and 2 men. They all know each other because they live in the same neighborhood. Most of them make their income from commercial activities such as clothing sales, a neighborhood grocery store, food sold by a street vendor, bread making, a cleaning service, and liquor sales. There are a lot of competent people in these fields, so the members have to find different ways to sell merchandise and earn a better income to support their families. This loan from Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital will be used to buy merchandise and ingredients to compete in the commercial market. The members have worked with supportive groups before, so they know about the work and responsibilities necessary for each loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To procure bananas and cassavas.
loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena M., 49, is the divorced mother of five children, two girls and three boys, two of whom are in school, one in senior high school and the other in the basic level. The rest have completed school and are working. Abena lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small town close to Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Abena works very hard to provide for her children as a trader in bananas and cassavas. In business for ten years, she buys them from farmers in the area and sells them to local retailers. It is Abena’s desire to save enough money to support the rest of her children in their academics, so she is requesting a loan to procure bananas and cassavas in bulk to maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: Raising chickens
loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Mạnh năm nay 48 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 người con  đã trưởng thành. Năm 2008 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt, cá. Hiện tại gia đình chị  đang chăn nuôi 700 con vịt  và 5 sào ao nuôi cá cho thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 100 con gà và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Mạnh, 48 years old, has three grown children. In 2008 she used a loan from the TYM Fund to invest in raising ducks and fish. She and her family now have 700 ducks and 5 sào (1 sào = 360 square meters) of fish ponds, from which they earn an income of 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy 100 chickens and animal feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land, fertilizer, and manioc
loans.name: Têko

texts.fr: Né en 1954 à Anfoin, Mr Têko A. est marié et est père de huit (08) enfants. C'est un agriculteur très réputé dans sa localité, il a toujours fait preuve de bravoure et courage. Très déterminé, il sollicite un financement pour agrandir sa surface cultivable, acheter des fertilisants et assister sa femme dans son commerce de vente de farine de manioc (gari). Les revenus permettront à cette famille de mieux faire face aux charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Born in 1954 in Anfoin, Mr Têko A. is married and the father of eight (8) children. He is a farmer with a high reputation in his area, and has always shown courage and determination. Very determined, he is asking for a loan to increase his arable land, buy fertilizer, and assist his wife in her business of sale of manioc (gari). The revenues will enable this family to better meet the needs of the household.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted ingredients for puto (rice cake)
loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina  M. is a 41-year-old widowed mother of seven.  Her sons: Joey, Rocky and Jeppy, are helping her support the family. Her eldest son, Joey, is driving their tricycle (rickshaw) for hire.  Gina is making puto (a cake made of rice) as their daily source of income. She is financing the education of four kids: two in secondary school and two in elementary school. 

She applied for this loan to buy assorted ingredients for her rice cakes such as rice, sugar, baking powder, oil, and cheese. She wants to purchase these items in bulk in order to get a better price at the market. She hopes to save enough money to sustain her business and keep her orders up. She dreams of having a separate work area from her house in the future.

loans.use: Wool and fabric
loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
La señora Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 47 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 03 hijos.  Estudio hasta cuarto de secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, inicio su negocio de artesanías (bordados); tuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que le sirvió  como capital adicional, compro lana de distintos colores y bayetas, crochet y otros.

Con este crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles comprará más material (lana, accesorios, etc.) con el fin de continuar elaborando sus bordados, los mismos que los comercializa en las ferias de Juli y ella desea llevar su producto a otras zonas de la región; finalmente ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus 04 cuotas según lo acordado.

La señora Genoveva desea comprar su casa y poner una tienda de artesanía.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” community bank in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 47, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. She attended school until her fourth year of high school. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She started her handicrafts (embroidery) business, and she had an initial loan of 300 PEN as additional capital. She bought different colors of wool, fabric, crochet, and other items. With this loan for 300 PEN, she will buy material (wool, accessories, etc.) to make embroideries that she will sell at the fairs in Juli. She would like to take her products to other zones in the region. She promises to repay the loan in 4 payments on time, as agreed upon. Genoveva would like to buy a house and open a handicrafts store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale and flour to make bread
loans.name: Mwamvua

texts.en:
Mwamvua has been a clothes and bread seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 16 years. She belongs to the Vijana imara loan group (group code 2038). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale and wheat flour to cook bread. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mwamvua is 39 years old, married, and has two children, ages 20 and 15.

loans.use: Working capital
loans.name: Gloria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Gloria de los Ángeles M. L. tiene 43 años, ella es una mujer casada y tiene un hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que Gloria se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace mas de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer los servicios de planchado y lavado, pero se enfermo ya que cuando recurría a la casa de sus clientes, y se trasladaba a su vivienda tenia que caminar muchas cuadras, por lo que mas tarde decide incursionar en el negocio de la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, ropa para niños y ropa para damas.
texts.en:
Gloria de los Angeles M. L. is 43 years old; she is married and has a dependent child. She is engaged is the sale of general merchandise and has been in this business for more than 8 years. She was previously dedicated to providing ironing and washing services, but she got sick because of the long walks to get to her clients homes. So she decided to break into the business of selling general merchandise.

She is asking for a loan for working capital to buy cosmetics, perfumes, creams and clothes for kids and ladies that she will sell.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical items to sell to her customers
loans.name: Mene

texts.en: Mene K. is 38 years old, divorced and has a son who is in junior high school. She and her son live in a rented apartment in a town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital, and is a commercial and farming center. Mene is a trader who sells electrical goods such as rice cookers, stoves, blenders and other items. She sells in her community and in nearby towns. Mene has been in business for 12 years and is applying for this loan to buy items in bulk to sell to her custoemrs.

loans.use: To purchase more commodities
loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
With her desire to help her husband earn money for their family, Charito M. decided to operate a general store in their village. Through that, she earns PHP4,500 a week, most of which is being used to sustain the store. Though all of their children have already finished schooling, she and her husband, Alfredo, still want to improve their lifestyle.

In connection to this, Charito wants to avail of a PHP7,000 loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more commodities for her store. She knows that through that, her income will increase to soon uplift her family’s life. “I have a strong faith in our God, thus I know that he will grant my wish,” Charito shares.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers to grow corn
loans.name: Jose Donald

texts.es: El señor José O., tiene 29 años de edad, habitante del municipio de Villa del Carmen del departamento de Managua, casado, su esposa trabaja como comerciante, no tiene hijos, en el negocio tiene variedad de productos como: ropas, bisutería, productos de plástico y de grano básico. Los planes a corto plazo es generar mayores utilidades con la producción como: maíz y trigo, pero en el camino del desarrollo de este plan ha encontrado como principal dificulta la falta de financiamiento económico. Gracias  a la Institución lograra comprar semillas de maíz, trigo y productos  de abarrote. Permitiendo ofrecer a su familia mayores beneficios.
texts.en:
José O. is 29 years old and lives in the municipality of Villa del Carmen in the region of Managua. He is married- his wife works as a vendor- and he does not have any children.
His business offers a variety of products like clothing, jewellery, plastic products and staple grains. The short term plan is to generate greater profits through the production of corn and wheat. His main difficulty in developing this plan has been the lack of financing.
Thanks to AFODENIC he will be able to purchase corn and wheat seeds, and groceries, allowing him to better provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & farming supplies
loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan Pablo A. O. , tiene la edad de 44 años , habita en el barrio los ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen 9 hijos , cinco de ellos ya son independiente y cuatro tienen a su cargo y le apoyan en las actividades agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Juan desde hace 20 años trabaja como agricultor , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo , el inicio está actividad con el apoyo de la reforma agraria y  con los préstamo se ha ayudado para salir a delante con la producción son nueve ciclo los que va trabajando con Afodenic y con este  préstamo va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Pablo A. O. is 44 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los Ríos, which is located in the town of Ticuantepe. Together with his wife, he works as a trader in order to earn money to pay for their household expenses. They have 9 children, 5 of whom are independent while the other 4 remain under their care. He plans to improve his family’s living conditions.

Don Juan has been farming for 20 years. His greatest challenge is getting rid of pests that plague his crops. He started his farm as a result of land reform and he feels that his loans have helped him move his production forward. He is on his 9th loan cycle with AFODENIC and will use the funds to buy fertilizers and supplies to improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale
loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina D. is from the town of Jimenez. She is 60 years old. Regina is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Regina owns and operates a snack-vending business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.

Regina has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2002, Regina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Regina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Regina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar
loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Beatriz es soltera, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, Beatriz tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, también Beatriz tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir.
Beatriz necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Beatriz son implementar su negocio con mas productos, mejorar su casa y construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Communal Bank “Alianza” (Alliance). She is 47 years old, single, and has 4 children. Beatriz manages a store from her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruit. She also has a small dressmaking shop.

Beatriz needs a loan of 1500 soles in order to buy rice and sugar. She dreams of stocking her business with more products, making improvements to her home, and adding a second floor to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital
loans.name: Ana Judith

texts.es: Ana Judith M. D. tiene 29 años, esta joven se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por la necesidad de generar ingresos a su familia, ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo que cursa el 5 grado de primaria. Ana tiene toda la fortaleza para salir adelante por lo que cada día fue ganando clientes  y con la confianza que les brinda todo se hace mucho más fácil para ofertarles lo que desean. En la actualidad continua con este negocio. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, joyas, cosméticos, cremas, colonias y calzado. Como toda persona tiene sus sueños, Ana sueña con mejorar los ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Judith M. D. is a 29-year-old woman who sells general merchandise for a living. She started this business more than 7 years ago because she has always liked retail. She decided to launch this business out of the need to earn an income for her family. She has one son who is currently in the fifth grade. Ana possesses the strength she needs to get ahead in life, which is why she started gaining customers every day. Because she trusts her customers, it is easier for her to offer them whatever they need. She is currently running this same business. She needs this loan to use as working capital to purchase clothing, jewelry, cosmetics, moisturizers, fragrances and footwear. Ana has dreams just like everyone else; she dreams of improving her family income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs and vitamins and feed for the livestock.
loans.name: Martha Magdalena

texts.es:
El banco comunal Conchan de Milagro se encuentra a unos 30 minutos fuera de la Ciudad de Cuenca vía al Valle en el sur del país, es una comunidad de gente muy unida y solidaria entre ellos y con el turista nacional y extranjero, su clima frío favorece para la agricultura y ganadería además podemos disfrutar de un paisaje sin igual y la belleza de la fauna en su estado natural

La señora Martha Magdalena C. es socia activa del  banco comunal Conchan de Milagro, vive en la  comunidad del mismo nombre, tiene 22 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja, fruto de su unión concibió una niña de un año, su esposo trabaja como mecánico por ahora  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada por su papá.

Martha  se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y a la cría de pollos, lleva seis meses desarrollando esta actividad  y nos comenta que le va muy bien porque no se ha muerto ni uno y todos los vendió en su comunidad a buen precio.

Este es su segundo ciclo trabajando con la fundación y esta muy contenta porque con el primer crédito montó su criadero de pollos,  con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de otros animales como  cuyes y chanchos así como en comida y vitaminas para su crianza, de ésta manera ir incrementando su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Conchan Miracle Community Bank is located about 30 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca in the valley in the south of the country. It is a community of very united people working together and with the national and foreign tourists. The cold climate is favorable for agriculture and livestock. We also are able to enjoy a landscape without equal and the beauty of the fauna in its natural state Mrs. Martha Magdalena C. is an active member of the Conchan Miracle Community Bank. She lives in the community of the same name, is 22 years old, and lives in common law marriage with her partner. Their fruitful union has resulted in a daughter who is one year old. Martha's husband works as a mechanic at present. They do not have their own house so they live in a house lent to them by her father. Martha works at domestic tasks and raising chickens. She has been developing this activity for six months and comments that it is going very well since not even one chicken has died and she sold all of them in the community at a good price. This is her second time working with the foundation and she is very content because with the first loan she started her poultry farm. With the new loan from the Foundation ESPOIR she will invest in the purchase of more animals like guinea pigs and pigs as well as food and vitamins for raising the animals and in this way continue increasing her business. Her biggest dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of onions to sell
loans.name: Koligo

texts.en: Koligo J. is currently in the business of selling both fresh and dried fish and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of onions to sell. Koligo is 35 years old and is married to a fisherman. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil and bags of rice and beans
loans.name: Quick Help Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Luma Traders. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 SLL for each of them from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses by buying more goods for their stalls. This will attract many customers into their businesses; sales and profit will improve for these entrepreneurs. Consequently, the living standard of these entrepreneurs will also improve. 

Adama Kargbo (in the middle) is the leader of this group. Adama was born in the village of Makalili, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately forty-five years old, married to a businessman, and the two of them have three children. Two of her children are in primary school and the other is in junior secondary school. Adama has been a businesswoman for over twenty years. She specializes in selling rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), beans and groundnuts. Adama will use this loan to buy bags of rice, beans, groundnuts and gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies
loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean farms for a living. She is 36 years old, married and has two children. Her oldest child is only 11 years old, going to school. She cultivates her farm for rice crops. She works hard to cover her family’s needs and her kids’ education. She is now preparing her farm for planting. She applied for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs to be used on her farm. This loan will help Mary Jean sustain her farm and her family.

loans.use: Purchase parts for his motorcycle taxi
loans.name: Roger Patricio

texts.es:
El señor Roger es socio del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 4 meses atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 33 años de edad, es viudo y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a dar servicios de mototaxi.
Roger nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar su moto.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar los repuestos de su moto.
Su sueño para el futuro es salir adelante con sus hijas.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es que esta bien organizado.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger has been a member of the Gran Poder (Great Power) Community Bank for 4 months, in the District of Llave, Province of Collao, Department of Puno. He is 33 years old, a widower, and has two children. He completed secondary school and works providing motorcycle taxi services. Roger tells us that with the first loan of 1,000 PEN he requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement he was able to buy his motorcycle. Now he is requesting a credit of 500 PEN with which he will be able to buy parts for his motorcycle. His dream for the future is to move ahead with his daughters. What he likes most about his Community Bank is that is is well organized.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy silk fabric for resale and to buy raw materials (raw silk) for her daughters' business
loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at K., 51, and her husband, Mr. Sophai Orn, 52, have been married since 1975 and have five daughters. Two of their daughters are married and live outside the family home. Two other daughters weave silk at home, while the youngest studies in the local school. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband is fisherman.

In the village, Sam-at sells the fish that her husband catches. She has asked for a Kiva loan from Maxima once already. She now is asking for another loan as capital for her daughters to buy silk fabric for resale and to buy raw materials (raw silk) to continue their business.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to commute to work
loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan K. S. is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. S. is a skillful chef. She provides her cooking services to rich people at rental apartments and is able to earn an income of USD 7 per day. Her husband is a soldier in Siem Reap Province, earning an income of USD 4.60 per day. S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to cope with their daily necessary expenses. Therefore, S. is requesting a loan of US $1200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to buy a motorbike to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: Increase her working capital
loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou N. est mariée, elle est âgée de 53 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est depuis 2 ans membre du Banc Villageois de A.NDIABOT et y a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a régulièrement remboursés. Elle fait du commerce de poissons frais. Avec ses bénéfices elle parvient à assurer la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
texts.en:
Codou N. is married, 53-years-old and the mother of five children. For the past two years she has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” loan group of A. NDIABOT where she was granted four loans, all repaid on time. She sells fresh fish, and with her earnings is able to manage family daily expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair dye and hair for hair extensions
loans.name: Ramona Ayala

texts.en:
Ramona is 25 years old and lives in the Sportivo neighborhood in Itá with her parents and brothers. She is single and does not have any children. Ramona rents a retail space where she has operated a hair salon for the past five years. In the salon she cuts, brushes and dyes hair, gives hair extensions, hair layering and conditioning treatments, and offers manicures and pedicures to her clients, who are mainly teachers.
Ramona is seeking a loan to purchase dyes and hair for hair extensions (a very popular request) as she has been offered a good price and does not want to miss the opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and to purchase necessary farm inputs for her rice farming business.
loans.name: Yolen

texts.en:
Yolen A. is one of the very good members of ASHI and is a very good leader of the ASHI center. Happiness can always be seen through her face and in the way she perceives every trial she encountered on her way towards achieving her dreams for her family and even when listening to the problems of her co-members at ASHI. From her previous loan she has able to have a backyard poultry and rice farming business. Yolen now is requesting a Kiva loan through ASHI to use to support her desired business growth. Since her children have their own families now, the profits her business will make will go toward supporting her grandchildren until they graduate from college.

Being a wife, mother, and a friend to her co-members in ASHI, Yolen feels happy every time she can extend a helping hand. Through the success of her business, she hopes to help more people, especially her own family members.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic and perfume inventory
loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana owns a retail business that sells cosmetics and perfumes at the central market in Belaya Tserkov. She has been operating this business for 14 years. 

Svetlana started this business when her husband left. Due to her business Svetlana was able to raise her three children. Now as they have grown up and left home, she continues to help them. Svetlana’s business also grew. Today Svetlana has one employee and many loyal clients.

Svetlana would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase her business's sales and receive additional income. Svetlana’s goal is to complete building a small house outside the town. She is doing the finishing work now.

loans.use: To purchase noodles in bulk
loans.name: Anonymous

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle and fertilizer
loans.name: Islomdjon

texts.en:
For the past 8 years, Islomdjon has put much effort into his agricultural activities in the town of Shahristan in Northern Tajikistan. Despite the difficult economic situation, he has managed to support his family and provide them with necessary food and clothing. Islomdjon seeks loan support from IMON International to invest in his crops, later raise his harvest, and survive along with his family. With the part of the loan he will also purchase young cattle. With your help, Islomdjon will be able to get ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Additional working capital
loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita P. is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in pig fattening, selling ready-to-wear clothes and being a beauty product dealer. She lives in Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their three children who are between 17 and 21 years old and are currently going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her pig fattening, ready-to-wear clothes and beauty products business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000.

Conchita is now borrowing Php 25,000 so that she can use it as an additional working capital for her pig fattening and ready-to-wear business. This will be her 18th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Conchita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a house
loans.name: Attila

texts.en:
Attila is a businessman from Beregovo who runs a souvenir sales business. He is a skilled craftsman who carves unique souvenirs out of wood for retail sale among tourists. Attila has been in this business for three years and currently makes about 1,500 UAH net profit each month.
Attila is seeking a loan of 6,500 UAH to purchase a house for his family. He has made some savings but needs additional lending assistance to achieve his goal. He doesn’t have a workshop and is therefore hoping to use one of the rooms in his new private house for that purpose. Attila is very diligent and focused. He strives to see his business flourish so that it will bring him a consistent income in the future.

loans.use: Working Capital
loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: Luis Manuel tiene una pulpería hace más de 3 años. Pues sus inicios se dan cuando termina de graduarse de secundaria y no tiene trabajo por lo que decide comenzar una nueva fuente de ingresos con el poco capital de trabajo que posee, además tiene una familia a la cual debe proporcionarle alimento diario, anteriormente el ofrecía jabón, detergentes, golosinas y refrescos naturales con este crédito quiere mejorar  su negocio él se encuentra muy emocionado con esta oportunidad que le está brindando con los financiamientos. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, jugos, detergentes, pan y galletas.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel has had a small grocery store for more than 3 years. Its founding came about when he had just graduated from high school and didn't have a job. He decided to find a new way of earning money using the little capital he had, so he could feed his family. He already offers soap, detergents, candy and natural beverages and hopes to improve his business with this loan. He is very excited at the opportunity that he is getting with this loan. The loan is to buy inventory like candy, juice, detergents, bread and cookies.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, hose, and fertilizer to support her farm crop
loans.name: Rann

texts.en:
Mrs. Rann L. is 41 years old and lives in Roluos village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Rin, are farmers who own 2 hectares (5 acres) of land they use to cultivate rice.

For this farm, Mrs. Rann L. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water pump, hose, and fertilizer to support her farm crop.

Aside from farming, Mr. Saroeun Rin is also a maker  of big pots from which he is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt and cooking oil
loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is divorced with seven children, and three of her children go to school.  She also takes care of her grandchildren and mother. She owns a retail shop on Lubaga road selling all types of merchandise, such as sugar, cooking oil, soap and loaves of bread.

She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and cooking oil. She buys her merchandise in Kikuubo in Kampala city and incurs transport costs to and from shopping. 

Edith has been in this shop business for eight years.  Besides this retail shop, she also roasts maize and sweet potatoes near her shop to get additional income. She sells to all kinds of people and works seven days a week.     

She decided to work with MCDT because of the low interest charged. She aspires to see her business grow big and to own a wholesale shop.   Edith resides in and owns a three-room hous; the family has access to electricity but no piped water.   Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome
loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia T. is 28 and married with no children. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Telesia is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 160 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
In 2010, Telesia joined Kiva partner, SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Telesia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. Visit http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy three piglets and pig food to start a pig breeding business
loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. Vorn D. lives in Trapeang Khchau village, Takeo province, and she is 38 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Sam Ou, are farmers who own a four-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She is also a chicken breeder. This couple tries to work a lot but they can earn only a little money to support their family. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Vorn D. is asking for a loan to buy three piglets and pig food for starting a pig breeding business, and with the rest of the loan she will buy more chicken food. She is the mother of five children, one whom is employed at a private company, while another two are enrolled in school, and the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy a pre-fabricated kiosk
loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE
Este grupo está formado por 07 integrantes con la capacidad de trabajar y ofrecer al mercado el mejor servicio posible. Gracias a la señora Briceño fue quien las alentó y las animó a formar este grupo. Tal es el caso de la señora Eutemia Z. Sánchez.
  
Señora de 56 años de edad, con cinco hijos, 02 dependientes y los demás son mayores independientes, quedó viuda a los 28 años, y hace 24 años que tiene un nuevo compromiso,
