Delia is 24 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her parents and 3 year old son in her parents' house. Before the circumstances that left her alone with her son, she received the support of her parents, who gave her the opportunity to install a grocery sales business so that she could clear her expenses and those of her son. She has had this small grocery store for 3 years and it is developing little by little. She attends it all day and it is going well for her. What she likes about her job is the activity, as well she is very grateful to her parents for having taught her to be responsible. She considers the profitability of her business is owing to its location in a good zone, and also because she is the only person who sells this type of product in her neighbourhood. This is her fifth loan with MFP and what she likes about her communal bank is that they have given her the opportunity to move forward, learning a lot about responsibility and solidarity. With the money she is seeking she will buy wood to extend and improve her business space, and will also acquire grocery items and drinks to provide in her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer merchandise
loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Мавлуда Холикова  1956 года рождения, замужем имеет 5 детей.  Имеет среднее образование. Торгует на рынке калошами, женской и детской одеждой. Товар привозит с Уратюбе каждые 2 -3 недели.  ежедневная продажа приносит неплохой доход от каждой прибыли она оставляет небольшую часть на погашение а остальное что бы поехать еще раз за товаром. За домашним хозяйством отвечает ее муж и старший сын.  Кредит получает на покупку летнего сезона .
texts.en:
Born in 1956, Mavluda K. is married and has 5 children. She has a secondary education. She sells shoes and women’s and children’s clothing. Mavluda brings her merchandise from Uratube every 2-3 weeks. Her everyday sales bring in a good income, and she uses part of each profit for repayment and the rest to obtain new merchandise. Her husband and oldest son look after the household. Mavluda is obtaining this loan to purchase summer merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise
loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 22 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres y lo que más desea es salir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de muebles, los cuales adquiere de la carpintería de su madre y son muy solicitados por los clientes, ya que son de muy buen material. Ya lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarlos sobre el mueble que más le servirá, pero considera que lo más difícil es transportar los muebles desde la carpintería. Nelly sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para alcanzar sus metas y está dispuesta a hacerlo con tal de mejorar su vida. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus muebles con mucha más comodidad, ya que actualmente lo hace de forma ambulatoria. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Nelly con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy querida y admirada. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más muebles para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Nelly is 22 years old and a hardworking young woman. She lives in the house she inherited from her parents and what she wants most is to get ahead. Nelly sells furniture she acquires from her mother’s carpentry workshop. These pieces are in high demand because they are made of very good material. She has been selling furniture for 15 years. What she likes most about her job is talking with clients and advising them on which pieces of furniture are most suitable for them. Her biggest challenge is transporting the furniture from the workshop. Nelly knows she has to work hard to achieve her goals and is willing to do so in order to improve her life. In the future, she hopes to have a shop where she can sell her furniture more comfortably because she currently travels to meet her clients.

This is Nelly’s fourth loan with MFP. She knows she has to pay on time because she does not want to create problems for her communal bank. Nelly is one of the most beloved and admired members of her group. With her loan of 2000 soles, she plans to buy more furniture to offer her customers a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sugar, coffee, bread, beans, rice, milk, meat, soda, juice, corn flour, toilet paper, flour, soaps, margarine, butter, and oil.
loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
el sr. Elias S. tiene 69 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ninguno esta con el ya que formaron su propio hogar. el se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta basica en su pulperia desde hace 23 años; Elias a luchado por mantener este negocio a traves de su buena administracion y su buena manera de tratar los clientes.
uno de sus mayores anhelos es tener un supermercado y vender toda clase de productos para que las personas del municipio de Langue no tengan que trasladarse a Nacaome a comprar algunos productos que no se encuentran en dicha comunidad.
necesita el credito para abastecerse mas de porductos y comprar productos nuevos para las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elias S. is 69 years old, married, and the father of two children, neither of whom are with him since they have made their own homes. He has been selling basic foods in his local store for 23 years; Elias has succeeded in maintaining this business through his good management and way of dealing with customers. One of his greatest longings is to have a supermarket and sell all types of products, so the people in the Langue are do not have to travel to Nacaome to buy products that they cannot find in their community. He needs the loan to stock up on more products and buy new products to meet his customers needs.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise
loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is a 46-year-old widowed woman. After the death of her husband, she decided to open a clothes shop to provide for her needs. Souad is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase additionA. merchandise to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: Purchase fertlizers & pesticides to maintain his corn crop
loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos; vive junto a su esposa en Batangrande, distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Llevan 8 años viviendo en la zona y sus hijos viven en la ciudad de Chiclayo debido a que estudian allá, el se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, y en esta temporada ha sembrado maíz blanco y maíz amarillo duro en un terreno ubicado en la parte posterior de su hogar.

El también cría algunas vacas que le proveen de leche para venderla a una empresa acopiadora de la zona que a la vez distribuye el producto a una empresa procesadora de leche.

Adriano desea mantener su cultivo con riegos y fertilizantes, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles para seguir sacando adelante a su negocio.

El planea seguir sembrando y comercializar él mismo los productos que cosecha, para así sacar adelante a su  familia, sus vecinos lo estiman mucho ya que lo consideran un padre responsable y muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Adriano is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives with his wife in Batangrande, Pitipo District, Ferreñafe Province, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has lived in this area for 8 years, while his children live in the city of Chiclayo where they study. Adriano is engaged in agriculture, and this season he has planted white corn and yellow corn in the field located behind his house.

He also breeds some cows that provide milk that he sells to a collection company in the area which in turn distributes the product to a milk processing company.

Adriano wants to maintain his crop with irrigation and fertilizers. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2500 soles so that he can move his business forward.

He plans to continue planting and selling his crops in order to support his family. His neighbors feel he is a responsible father and a very hard worker.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy farm supplies for growing rice.
loans.name: Mrs. Dy Soer Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty six people who are all living in Anhchanh village in Kandal province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Dy S. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan in different purposes. She is a farmer who owns 2-field of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money for growing rice on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Horl Sarorn, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Dy S. is 37 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To strengthen her small business activities
loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama S. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est marée et mère de 6 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de OUNCK depuis 6 ans et demi, elle a été à 7 reprises bénéficiaire de prêt et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle développe une activité de vente de sucre et les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses familiales
texts.en:
Mariama S. is a 44 year old woman, She is married and a mother, responsible for 6 children. Mariama has been a member of the Village Bank of Ounck for six and a half years. She has made seven business loans and has never had a problem with repayment. She started a business selling sugar and the profits earned have enabled her to contribute to the family expenses

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell
loans.name: Neria

texts.en: Neria P. is from the town of Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Neria owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store. She has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Neria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase goods at better prices in greater quantities
loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is 37 years old, married with one child, and she takes care of two orphans from one of her relatives. She lives in Musanze district, which is approximately two hours drive from the capital city of Rwanda. This is her fourth successful year of selling a variety of goods in her small general store. Her shop is open from 7 a.m. until late in the evening hours every day. Floride is a hard worker for sure.

Floride is now requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of adding to her working capital and purchasing needed goods at better prices in greater quantities. This will enable her to earn more profit and attract new customers with the added inventory items.

Through accessing this loan, if her expansion plans are successful, Floride will be able to continue her life as a self-employed woman with a successful enterprise. The savings from additional profits that are not reinvested in her business will allow her to take even better care of her child plus the two orphans she takes care of now.

loans.use: To buy a cow to sell more milk
loans.name: Ainake's Group

texts.ru:
Токтошбаева Айнаке – лидер данной группы. Айнаке живёт в г. Карабалта. Это в шестидесяти километрах от столицы. Пятидесяти восьми летняя Айнаке по праву может считать себя сильной и мужественной женщиной. Ведь Айнаке вырастила ни многим, ни малым аж семерых детей. У Айнаке шесть дочерей и один сын. Старшей дочери сорок восемь лет, а младшей – двадцать два года. Даже после того, как умер муж, Айнаке мужественно продолжила в одиночку воспитание детей. Сейчас, к счастью всего дочери замужем, и единственный сын женат. Сын после смерти отца, женившись, решил жить с матерью и помогать ей. От мужа Айнаке по наследству досталась кое – какая живность. Посоветовавшись с родственниками и детьми, Айнаке решила оставить скот и не продавать его. Айнаке пришлось учиться ухаживанию за скотом. Благо, что сын был рядом и помогал. Время само показало, насколько мудрым оказалось её решение. Айнаке увеличила поголовье и при выдаче замуж дочерей, и при женитьбе сына, этот же самый скот очень пригодился. Айнаке сэкономила значительные средства, так как ей не пришлось покупать мяса. Сейчас, Айнаке продаёт молоко и этим самым покрывает свои повседневные расходы. Когда ей нужна большая сумма, сын может отвести живность на базар и продать. Айнаке надеется приобрести ещё одну корову, чтобы увеличить прибыль от молока. В её планы также входит сделать капитальный ремонт дома и поставить новые ворота. 

У Айнаке три партнёра по группе:

Тукуеву Элдияру тридцать семь лет. У Элдияра двое детей. Жена – домохозяйка. Чтобы прокормить семью Элдияр занимается разведением овец и продажей молока. Эльдияр нуждается в кредите. Он хочет купить ещё одну корову. У Эльдияра есть заветная мечта – построить дом на фазенде. 

Дуйшенкуловой Гульзат тридцать четыре года. Муж Гульзат работает контролёром – электриком. У них трое детей. Младшей дочери всего четыре годика. Все дети ходят в младшую школу. Гульзат дома ухаживает за скотом. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить корову. 

Орозалиевой Айнуре сорок девять лет. Айнура, вместе с мужем вырастили четверых детей: три дочери и одного сына. Все дочери замужем. Сыну всего одиннадцать. Он ходит в школу. Муж Айнуры работает управляющим частной фермы. Сама Айнура держит скот, а также дома занимается вышиванием и продажей национальных изделий. Айнура надеется получить кредит и приобрести корову.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Ainake T. is the leader of this group. Ainake lives in the city of Karbalta, sixty kilometers from the capital. A fifty-eight-year-old widow Ainake has earned the right to consider herself a strong and courageous woman, because she has raised seven children: six daughters and one son. The eldest daughter is now thirty-eight, the youngest is twenty-two. After her husband passed away Ainake courageously continued raising her children by herself. Fortunately today all the daughters and the only son are married. After the death of his father Ainake's son decided to stay and help her run the household. From her husband Ainake inherited a few animals. After discussing it with her children and relatives Ainake decided to keep the livestock rather than sell it. She had to learn how to tend for the animals. She was very fortunate that her son was right there, helping her along the way. Time itself has shown just how wise her decision was. She was able to increase the headcount of her livestock and when the time came for her children to be married this livestock came very handy. Ainake saved a lot of money since she didn't have to purchase meat. Currently Ainake sells milk and that's how she earns income for her living expenses. Whenever she needs a larger amount her son sells some of the livestock on the local market. Ainake is hoping to purchase an additional cow to increase the profits from the sale of milk. She is planning to do renovations in her house and also replace the gates.

Ainake has three partners in her group: Eldiar T. is thirty-seven. He has two children. His wife stays at home with the children. To feed his family Eldiar raises sheep and sells milk. He needs the loan in order to buy one more cow. He has a dream to build a house on his farm. Gulzat D. is thirty-four. Her husband is an electrician. They have three children. The youngest daughter is only four. All children go to primary school. Gulzat stays at home tending the livestock. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase a cow. Ainura O. is forty-nine. With her husband Ainura raised four children: three daughters and one son. All the daughters are married. The son attends school, he is only eleven. Ainura's husband works as a manager of a farm. At home Ainura tends her livestock as well as knits and sells local souvenirs. Ainura is hoping to get a loan in order to buy a cow.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spark plugs and pistons
loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
La señora Casilda es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Juan”, en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Estudió secundaria incompleta y se dedica a la venta de repuestos de artefactos.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años atrás y su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para comprar transistores y bujías.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.2500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà repuestos de carro.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su casa propia en la ciudad de Yunguyo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Casilda is a member of the San Juan communal bank in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the state of Puno. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She did not complete her secondary education. She sells spare parts. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years and her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to purchase transistors and spark plugs. She is requesting a loan for 2,500 soles which she will used to buy spare parts for cars. Her hope for the future is to have her own home in the city of Yunguyo and that her children become professionals. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pig food.
loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey T. lives in Tuol Svay Prey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ky Korn, is a duck breeder. Mrs. Srey T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pig food. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children. Three of her children attend the local school and one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more plumbing fittings
loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella M. is married to Charles Omili and they have four children: one boy and two girls who are all in primary school. They live in the Malakisi area near Kakamega town.

Stella is a plumber and very hardworking. Due to the fact that she is a woman doing this kind of job it has given her a lot of publicity which has made her get very many clients.

Stella has applied for a loan which she will use to buy more fittings for her plumbing work. She plans to use the profits made from this business to pay school fees for her children and also to cater for their daily needs.

Stella’s desire is to buy a personal plot in the future and build a kindergarten school because she has seen the need to have a local school since the one available is miles away.

loans.use: To buy welding rods and other materials for metalworking
loans.name: Jesus Es Prosperidad 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Berenice, 29, is a borrower who lives in Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Jesus es Prosperidad (Jesus is Prosperity), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Berenice and her husband have two children and live in a simple home in Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. Urban areas of the Dominican Republic are very overcrowded and can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Berenice runs a small blacksmith’s business. With this loan, she plans on purchasing more materials for her business, specifically welding rods and other metalworking supplies.

This is Berenice’s fifth loan from Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve the home life of her family. With the profits, she hopes to purchase a computer for herself and her children. Computers are one of the best investments for a low-income household, especially the children, as they teach desperately needed technological knowledge.

Berenice hopes that continued business will help her reach her dreams for her business and provide a good education for her children.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Berenice and the Jesus es Prosperidad group!

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the agricultural veterinary store
loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Francisca, pertenecen al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestra socia está ubicado en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años ella es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia tiene una agro veterinaria propia, nuestra socia es una mujer muy emprendedora siempre trabajo en todo tipo de negocios y ahora aprovechó que su pareja ha estudiado agronomía técnica y ella ha solicitado un préstamo hace años de este mismo banco y junto a su esposo pusieron su propio negocio, la socia ahora administra y sabe todo sobre este negocio y solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería de veterinaría en Lima. 

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our partner Francisca belongs to the "NEW VISION OF URUBAMBA" communal bank. Urubamba is one hour and 10 minutes away from Cuzco, in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas. Francisca is 32 years old and lives with her partner. She has 2 sons, one is 5 years old and the other is 1 years old. She alternates her home activities with retail; she has her own agricultural veterinary store. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who has worked in different types of businesses; and now she has taken advantage of the fact that her partner has studied technical agriculture. She had already requested a loan from the communal bank some years ago, and she set up her own business with her live-in partner. Francisca manages her business and knows all about it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more veterinary merchandise in Lima. Our partner is thankful for the opportunity you give her and is committed to fulfill the loan payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and sodabi liqueur
loans.name: Anonymous

loans.use: To buy items for food-selling business
loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran wants a loan to buy leather to resell. Reeta Hadayat wants a loan to buy repairing tools for her motor workshop. Fazilat wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit to resell. Zubaida wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to resell. Zahida is the group leader of the afore-mentioned ladies. They all live in a city named Lahore, famous in Pakistan for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Zahida has given birth to three girls and one boy. Her eldest daughter is 20 years old and she completed her education till 10th standard. The other two are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Her son has a food stand in the market where he sells specifically “Dahi Bhalay” which is in high demand.  

Zahida herself runs a beauty salon. She reserves one room of her house for it. Her eldest daughter also helps her to take care of the customers. She saves her income for her daughters’ marriage. 

Zahida is applying for a loan to buy items (yogurt, potatoes, and cooking oil) to expand her son's food business.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell
loans.name: Anonymous

loans.use: To buy charcoal, maize and sweet potatoes
loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married  with  six children and her husband owns a restaurantin Wandegeya one of Kampala city suburbs. All her children to school. She resides in and owns a house where she stays with additional family members. Margaret owns a wooden store at her home where she sells charcoal.  She works seven days week. Margaret incurs transport costs to and from buying bags of charcoal from the villages of Luwero district and goes to the villages twice a month. Besides this charcoal business, she also roasts maize and sweet potatoes. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal and a basket of maize. She joined MCDT because they were working with poor women in groups. Margaret aspires to see her business grow big so that she could get enough profits to build commercial houses in the available space near her home.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering
loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita L. is from the village of Barangay Villaros, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, she sells charcoal in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $100 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Elenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elenita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve her house and for personal use
loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
“Por 15 años fuí presidenta del banco Comunal Mateo Pumacahua”

Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Mateo Pumacahua” de la Asociación Arariwa, es natural de la ciudad Chinchero, tiene 46 años y es soltera.  Actualmente, Victoria cuenta con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en elaborar y vender artesanía de tipo tejido plano. El proceso que toma en consideración son tres elementos principales: la fibra, hilado y el teñido.  Para el hilado utiliza como elemento principal la lana de camélidos (alpaca) para tejidos finos y lana de llama para los más burdos. Para el teñido de lana se utiliza tintes naturales como la cochinilla, etc. La socia es una tejedora artesanal que utiliza el telar vertical para elaborar sus llikllas (mantas), costales, rebozos, anakus (falda envolvente), ponchos, frazadas, ceñidores (fajas masculinas) y fajas pata (faja para niñas).  Su actividad económica complementaria es vender maíz seco.   

Victoria es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario sacar adelante a sus familiares, ella requiere el préstamo para mejorar la casa y para uso personal. El anhelo de la socia es mejorar su artesanía y desea salir al extranjero para hacer conocer sus productos y dar entender el proceso de la elaboración de la textilería.      

Victoria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
“For 15 years I was president of the Manteo Pumachua Communal Bank.” Victoria belongs to the Mateo Pumachua Communal Bank with the Arariwa Asociación. She is a native of the city of Chinchero. She is 46 years old and single. Victoria currently has a small business. It consists of making and selling plain weave handicrafts. This process has three principle elements to consider; the fiber, the yarn, and the dyeing. For the yarn she uses alpaca wool as the basic element for soft weavings. She uses llama wool for the more coarse weavings. She uses natural dyes like “cochinilla” (insect used to make red dye), etc. to dye the wool. Her weavings are handmade, and she uses the vertical loom to make her “llikllas” (blankets), bags, shawls, “anakus” (wrap around skirt), ponchos, men’s belts, and children’s belts. Her complimentary economic activity is selling dried corn. Victoria is a hard-working and enterprising person who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead. She does this so that, through her daily effort, she can get her family members ahead. She needs the loan to improve her house and for personal use. Her goal is to improve her handicrafts. She wants to go to other countries to have them know her products and have them understand the process of making the textiles. Victoria is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new ice-cream making machine
loans.name: Najma Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Najma bibi lives in Multan, a city of shrines and sweetmeat in Pakistan, with her husband and seven children. Her husband has a scrap business and sells ice cream in the evening. Najma bibi helps her husband by selling clothes through her boutique. She also stitches the clothes. Two of her sons couldn’t complete their education; they started working after completing middle school to support the family.  

Najma bibi has applied for a loan for her husband who wants a new ice cream machine for his ice cream selling business. With a new ice cream machine, her husband will be able to make ice cream of better quality that will help in growing his income.

Note: "Najma bibi is making bread in this picture".

loans.use: Buy perfume, thermos products, cotton goods, etc.
loans.name: Maïzarath

texts.fr: S. Maïzarath est née en Juillet 1989 et vit depuis treize ans au quartier Dandji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Maïzarath n'est pas encore mariée et n'a pas d'enfant. Maïzarath vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Maïzarath n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Maïzarath mène comme activité la vente de parfums, cotons, thermos, etc. à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est aussi dans le même marché que Maïzarath achète ses produits. C'est la deuxième fois que Maïzarath sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un concours financier, en vue de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Maïzarath a bien remboursé le premier crédit qu'elle a obtenu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Maïzarath S. was born in July, 1989, and has lived for 13 years in the Dandji neighborhood of of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is still single and has no children. She lives alone and supports herself. She did not go to school. To take care of her needs, she sells perfumes, cotton goods, thermos products, etc., at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center, where she also buys her stock. She is asking for her second loan from ALIDé so as to grow her business and to better respond to customer demand. She repaid her first loan from ALIDé in full and on time.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gas cylinders for welding
loans.name: Comlan Gratien

texts.fr: K. Comlan Gratien est né le 18 Décembre 1965 à Comé, dans le département du Mono au Bénin. Gratien est marié à ALIHOTE Jeanne et est père de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Il y a environs seize ans que Gratien  habite Djèrègbé, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec sa famille. Le couple se partage les diverses charges familiales. Depuis sept ans, Gratien exerce l'activité de soudure, et de façon secondaire, fait de l'élevage à Djèrègbé. Ces activités aident Gratien à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Afin d'acquérir des outils de travail et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Gratien sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Plus tard, Gratien désire mieux équiper son atelier.
texts.en:
Comlan Gratien K. was born December 18, 1965, in Benin's Mono department. Gratien is married to Jeanne Alihote. He has two children, both of whom have been to school. The couple cares for two other children. Gratien has lived about 16 years with his family in Djèrègbé in the commune of Sèmè-Podji. For seven years Gratien has been a welder, and has also worked in construction. These occupations enable him to provide for his family. He wants to own the tools of his trade and be able to meet customer demand better, and so he is seeking a first loan from ALIDé. In the future, he wants to have a better-equipped workshop.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell
loans.name: Rarotonga

texts.en: Rarotoga F. is 23 and married with one child. She owns a business venture selling both food and daily-use products in the local community and has one year of experience in this business. Rarotoga needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US$98 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Rarotoga joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer
loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon I. is living in Chi Chrab village, Takeo province. She was born in 1959. She is a mother of six children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the others are attending in school; They all help in their parents’ businesses.

She and her husband, Mr. Sorn Bel, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land where they cultivate rice to sell in order to support their family. Mr. Sorn Bel is also a fisherman. 

Mrs. Mon I.'s  problem is that her field is infertile. To improve rice production, Mrs. Mon I. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.
loans.name: Mariella

texts.es:
Mariella tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su madre en el anexo Huaca Blanca del distrito de Chongoyape, un distrito agrícola situado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de salir adelante y mantener a su menor hijo hizo que instalara en su vivienda una bodega – bazar en donde ofrece a sus clientes artículos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y prendas de vestir. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad se ha hecho conocida y ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su negocio a adquirir los productos que ofrece.

Ella se esfuerza diariamente para mantenerse en el negocio y sacarlo adelante ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos. Actualmente desea ampliar su bodega adquiriendo una mayor cantidad de abarrotes. Esta inversión le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y por ende, sus ganancias, para lograr este objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Mariella es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a su hijo la oportunidad de disfrutar de un futuro estable y próspero. Las persona que le conocen la consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Mariella, 33, is a single mother of one son. She lives with her mother in Huaca Blanca Annex, Chongoyape district, an agricultural district located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. The need to get ahead and support her minor son motivated her to set up a general store in her home where she stocks groceries, basic needs items and clothes. Thanks to the length of time she’s been working she has become quite well known and she has a group of regular customers that come by her store to get what they need. She struggles daily to stay in business and have it succeed because it’s her only source of income. She wants to expand her store acquiring a larger amount of groceries. This will allow for higher sales and thus profits. To reach this goal she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan. Mariella is an enterprising, tenacious woman. Her greatest wish is to offer her son the opportunity to enjoy a stable and prosperous future. People who know her consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchadise for resale.
loans.name: Ma. Lazara

texts.es: L. señora Ma. Lazara y su esposo el señor Pedro. Son una pareja muy unida y muy trabajadora, por su parte L. señora Ma. Lazara venD. ropa usada los fines D. semana y el señor pedro tiene un taller electrónico. Ellos viven solos ya que todos sus hijos ya son grandes y ya cada quien tiene su propia familia. Ellos necesitan este crédito para invertir más en el negocio D. venta D. ropa, L. señora Ma. Lazara quiere comprar mas variedad D. ropa, pero que en esta ocasión pueda comprar ropa nueva y venderL. para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Ma. Lazara and her husband Pedro are a very united and hard-working couple. Ma. Lazara sells used clothing on the weekends and Pedro owns an electronics shop. They live alone as all of their children are now grown and have families of their own. They need this loan to further invest in the clothing business. Ma. Lazara wishes to buy a wider variety of clothing but this time she will be able to buy new clothing and sell it to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure
loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania M. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 42 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Epifania a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Like any other mother, Epifania wants her children to finish college and have a bright future.

Epifania joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: Increase working capital
loans.name: Ndeye Binta

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Bineta N. est une femme de 44 ans qui habite à Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 6 et 18 ans. Elle évolue depuis 2003 dans le commerce de  boubous, de tissus et de chaussures. Elle a choisi l’activité de commerce par passion mais aussi dans le but de  s’impliquer dans la vie active afin de participer a la satisfaction des besoins de la famille grâce  a l’aspect lucratif de cette activité. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2010 et n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destiné  à l’achat de boubous pour enfants, de tissus et de chaussures  pour renforcer son stock de marchandises. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses revenus périodiques et d’améliorer les conditions sociales de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndeye Bineta N. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Yoff. She is married and the mother of five children whose ages range from 6 to 18. Since 2003 she has been in business selling « boubous » (dresses), fabrics, and shoes. She chose the business because of her passion for it, but also with the goal of staying active and participating in meeting her family's needs thanks to her profits from the business.

She has been a member of the Yoff branch of UIMCEC since July 2010 and has never received a loan through the institution. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs to purchase children's boubous, fabrics, and shoes to build up her stock. Her goal is to increase her seasonal income and to better her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Repairs and maintenance for a motorboat.
loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos E. O. es un pescador de la zona de Jiquilillo  que tiene 15 años de experiencia, el habita en el municipio del Viejo, vive con su esposa que también es comerciante y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar tiene 3 hijos menores que están en clase.
A la fecha lleva 4 créditos con la  Institución de los cuales todos los ha cancelado bien en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Carlos E. O. is a fisherman in the Jiquilillo zone. He has 15 years of experience; he lives in the Viejo municipality. He lives with his wife who is also a merchant, and she helps him with the household expenses. He has three young children who are in school.

To date, he has had four loans through the Institution, all of which were paid off on time.

loans.use: Purchasing second-hand clothes to sell during the Christmas season.
loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 54-year-old widow who lives in a rented house in Kasese,Uganda and has five dependents. She has been in the business of selling second-hand clothing for thirty years. Her biggest challenge is competitors but despite the challenges, Beatrice says she plans to become a wholesaler in the future. Beatrice wants a loan to purchase second-hand clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy flour at wholesale prices
loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas al Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 09 hijos (4 independientes), la señora estudió hasta 2do año de educación primaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 01 año, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la elaboración de pan y picarones (dulce).

Juliana solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar harina para la elaboración de pan.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener un negocio de venta de ropas. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y las capacitaciones que recibe por parte de su promotora.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Azangarinas al Progreso Community Bank located in the district of Azángaro, in the province of Azángaro, which is in Puno department. She is 53 years old, married, and has nine children (four of whom have left home). She completed grade 2 of primary school. 

Juliana has been working with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan of S/.300 soles was invested in her business--she makes bread and picarones (a Peruvian fritter-like dessert, served with syrup). She will use this new loan of S/.1000 soles to buy flour to make bread.

Her dream is to start a business selling clothing. She really enjoys the meetings organized by her Community Bank as well as the training sessions put on by her loan officer.

loans.use: To buy beverages, corn and products to prepare pupusas.
loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
Marina, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, pupusas y posee además una tienda, su edad es de 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la venta, aprendió a hacer pupusas y tortillas porque su madre le enseño.
Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de bebida, maíz y productos para preparar pupusas, este préstamo le dará la oportunidad de adquirir todo lo necesario para producir su venta y continuar generando ingresos para su hogar.
Su Objetivo es seguir en el comercio y atender de una mejor manera a los clientes, aumentar poco a poco su producción y velar por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Marina sells tortillas, pupusas (a typical Salvadoran dish made with corn or rice and mixed with pork rind, cheese and beans in a tortilla) and has a small store. She is 31 years old and lives with her husband and children; they live in Jiquilisco department of Usulután. Marina has sold her items for some 5 years; she learned to make pupusas and tortillas from her mother.

Marina needs the loan to buy beverages, corn and products to prepare pupusas, the loan will give her the opportunity to get everything necessary to make the products in her home and to keep earning income for her home.

Marina’s goal is to keep selling food products and to serve her customers in better ways, to increase little by little her production and to watch over the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: To acquire animal feed to improve her animal raising business
loans.name: Natalina

texts.es:
Natalina tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical caracterizada por producir principalmente frutas como el mango,la maracuyá y el limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización D. ganado ovino y vacuno. Ella cría sus animales en la parte posterior D. su domicilio. Los alimenta en base a granos y pastos naturales y cuando están gordos los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donD. resiD.. Adicionalmente comercializa la leche que producen sus vacas con un acopiador D. la zona. Esta actividad le sirve para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar.

Natalina desea adquirir alimento para mejorar la crianza D. sus animales y hacer que estos se desarrollen D. mejor manera para que pueda obtener una buena producción y obtener mejores ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Natalina is 51 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children in the agricultural district of TambogranD., an area with a semi-tropical climate which is noted for producing fruit such as mango, passion fruit and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Natalina raises and sells sheep and cows.  She raises her animals in an area behind her home.  She feeds them grains and natural fodder and, when they are fattened, she sells them to the general public and to the traders who always visit the area where she lives.  Natalina also sells the milk that her cows produce to a middleman in the area.  This business allows her to help her husband, who is a farmer, to financially support their family.

Natalina would like to acquire animal feed.  This will enable her to better raise her animals so that they can develop in the best way possible and she can make more profits from them.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of palm fruits for producing oil.
loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa P. sells palm oil and fish at Abrafo near Abura. Adjoa has received junior high school education and is married with four children. Her husband is a forester. Adjoa has been selling palm oil and fish for three years. She is responsible for paying part of her children's school fees as well as books and other learning materials. She also contributes to her husband's housekeeping money. Her loan will be used to buy more baskets of palm fruits as required for producing the oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy greater amounts of fish so she can sell more. She will also reinvest some of the money into her palm oil business. Her greatest hope is to be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: Inventory
loans.name: María Sara

texts.es: María Sara M. D. G. D. 51 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Chalatenango, junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. frutas y verduras la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. DesD. hace varios años que ella cuenta con este negocio, el cual les ha permitido tener una vida llena D. todo lo básico necesario para sobrevivir, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo, ya que María desea poder comprar más frutas y verduras al por mayor con el fin D. poder comprar a menor precio y D. esta forma ofrecer su productos a menores precios que su competencia. Tanto María como su esposo son un matrimonio muy trabajador, los cuales se esfuerzan por una vida mejor para sus hijos quienes son lo primordial en sus vidas.
texts.en: María Sara M. D. G. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and three young children in the Chalatenango department.  She sells fruits and vegetables out of her home.  She has had this business for several years, and it allows her to proviD. a life with all the basic needs for survival.  She is asking for this loan so that she can buy more fruits and vegetables in quantity.  Buying in quantity will allow her to buy at lower prices and be able to sell at prices below the competition.  Like María, her husband is also a very hard worker.  They work together to be able to proviD. a better life for their children, who are their top priority.

loans.use: Purchase tissue paper, reeds, wire, adhesive, etc.
loans.name: Dora Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Dora es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive por el sector de  Don Bosco en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999, fue nombrada así por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su gente es muy amable, cordial y mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Dora tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 15, 14, 13, 11 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es chofer profesional y labora conduciendo un bus, viven en un departamento que es propio.
 
Doña Dora se dedica a la elaboración de globos de papel de china, esta actividad lo aprendió de sus padres quienes trabajaban en esta labor. Sus hijos le ayudan todos los días de domingo a domingo y sin un horario fijo, Son 20 años que se dedica a esto ya que comenzó desde muy pequeña.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y tiene muy buenas amigas, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales como: papel de china, carrizos, alambre, pegamento, etc. para la elaboración de los globos. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y llegar a tener un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of Yanuncay communal bank, and lives in the Don Bosco neighborhood in Cuenca. This city was named a World Heritage Site in 1999, for the beautiful architecture of its historic center. The people are very friendly and polite and maintain their culture and traditions.

Dora is 28 years old and married, with 4 children, ages 15, 14, 13 and 11. Her 3 older children are in high school, and her youngest son attends primary school in the city. Her husband is a professional driver, and works driving a bus. They live in their own apartment.

Dora works making tissue paper balloons, which she learned from her parents, who also did this work. Her children help her every day, from Sunday to Sunday, with no fixed schedule. She has been doing this work for 20 years, because she started very young.

This is her second loan through the communal bank, where she has many good friends. The money from this loan will be used to purchase materials such as tissue paper, wire, reeds, adhesive, etc., to make her balloons. Her goal is to expand her business, and one day have a tailor shop.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks
loans.name: Anonymous

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise
loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is a 44-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a hog-raising business. She lives in Narra, Palawan. Gemma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gemma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000 to buy additional piglets to raise so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Gemma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs such as Irish potatoes.
loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 31 years-old and she has four children who are between the ages 1.6 months to 12 years. She sells several items including food stuffs such as Irish potatoes and she also sells goats. She is requesting a loan to buy food stuffs for her business and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zips, buttons and scissors
loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen forma parte del banco comunal “Lontué I”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Molina. Ella se dedica al corte y confección de ropa, desde hace 10 años. Carmen trabaja desde su casa, confeccionando sábanas, cortinas y pantalones para niños y adultos de polar. Es una tela muy abrigadora, especial para la temporada de invierno. Además está realizando como novedad, faldas de polar. Innovación que ha tenido bastante llegada de clientela. Lo que le generará mayores ganancias. Su mercadería la compra principalmente en distribuidoras de telas, sin embargo en la actualidad está encargando las telas y otros insumos a la ciudad de Santiago, ya que es más económico. 
Con el préstamo comprará telas, cierres, botones y tijeras.
Carmen vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 25, 17 y 5 años de edad. Los dos hijos mayores la ayudan en su negocio a promocionar sus confecciones. 
La meta de Carmen es construir un taller y su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales. Además quiere comprar otra máquina de coser, ya que quiere asociarse con su madre, en el negocio de la confección. 
Carmen está muy agradecida y contenta del crédito recibido por Fondo esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones con las demás socias, éstas le sirven como distracción. Con las capacitaciones ella ha aprendido a registrar sus ingresos, gastos y clientes, quienes le hacen pedidos y Carmen va anotando. 

Molina es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, ubicada en la región del Maule. Se caracteriza principalmente por ser uno de los grandes polos de la industria vitivinícola chilena. Además de las vides, está la industria frutícola, destacando la producción de manzanas, peras y kiwis.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Lontué I Community Bank in the town of Molina. She has earned her living sewing for the last ten years. She works out of her house making bedding, drapes, and fleece pants for children and adults. Fleece is a warm fabric especially in the winter. She’s also experimenting with making skirts out of fleece, and they have been welcomed by her customers and will bring in some extra income. Carmen generally buys her merchandise from fabric distributors, but currently she’s been buying the fabric and other supplies from Santiago at cheaper prices. With the loan she plans to buy more fabric, buttons, and scissors.

Carmen lives with her husband and their three children aged 26, 17, and 5. The two oldest help her promote the business. Her goal is to build a workshop, and her dream is for her children to get good jobs. She also wants to buy another sewing machine so that her mother can be part of the business.

Carmen is very grateful and happy with the money she has received from Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza as it has enabled her to invest in her business. As for the meetings with the other members, she has found them to be a good way of meeting people. The training sessions have taught her how to record her income and expenses, and how to keep track of customers’ orders.

Molina is a community in the centre of Chile, located in Maule region. It is known mainly as one of the chief centres of the Chilean winemaking industry. As well as grapes, other fruits are grown there especiallly apples, pears, and kiwis.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and seeds
loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 60 years old and is a married woman with 6 children. Her oldest child is 38 years old and no longer lives with them.

Pacita started her farming business 5 years ago. She grows rice crops to sell. She earns 5000 PHP from this farming. Pacita is planning to use this loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She hopes for her harvest to increase.

loans.use: to pay to prepare their corn plantation
loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa A. is now 44 years old and married with two school-aged children. Luisa is a farmer who works in the Philippines and earns approximately PHP 10,000 per month. 

Luisa is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to pay to prepare their corn plantation. Luisa has been growing corn for 10 years.  In the future, Luisa hopes to strengthen their corn production business as one source of their income. She believes that with her strong faith and determination, she can improve their status of living and give their children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.
loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a widow with five children who works very hard to support her family by running a general store and raising livestock. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She will be her fifth loan from our organization, and she is determined to continue working hard so that she can achieve her dream of expanding her business and securing her family's future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of chips and vegetables.
loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en:
Wilfrida is 43 years old and married with six children. The family lives in Huruma Estate (suburb) in Nairobi, Kenya. 

Wilfrida sells chips and vegetables in the family’s estate where most of her customers come from. She is very dedicated to her work.

Wilfrida is a hardworking lady who intends to take care of her children through a loan which will help her increase her stock. Her plan is to become a supplier of farm products in the estate.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bakso and buy soft drinks to sell.
loans.name: Rusun Cawang Group

texts.en:
Sofiah works in two businesses. In the morning, she sells nasi uduk for breakfast in a rented mobile store, and in the afternoon, she sells t-shirts. She started her food business in 2002. She became a VisionFund client in 2008 and has used the loans to grow her food business. With the income, she is able to send her children to school. 

Sofiah wants to expand her food business further and buy her own store near her house. She will use the new loan to buy ingredients to make bakso and buy soft drinks to sell during the season of Ramadan next month. With higher earnings, she hopes to send her daughter to university.

Sofiah’s group has a strategy to approach the market in which they sell complementary products. For example, different women in the group sell rice, snacks, drinks, etc. This helps them grow together.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine
loans.name: Napisa

texts.en: Napisa is 17 years old. She is married and her husband is a business man. Napisa sells clothing to earn a living. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides for growing maize.
loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magdalena, tiene tres hijos, vive con ellos y poseen casa propia, ella tiene un negocio D. verduras y también realiza cultivos agrícolas, aunque debe emplear a jornaleros para que realicen las labores pues es trabajo pesado.
Actualmente está realizando la siembra D. maíz, y se ve en la necesidad D. solicitar un préstamo para la compra D. abono e insecticidas, también pago D. jornaleros, este préstamo le ayudara para realizar el cultivo consumiendo parte D. la producción y comercializar otra parte D. esta.
Magdalena aspira con el cultivo, tener una buena plantación, que su cosecha sea abundante para la alimentación D. su familia y también le genere mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Magdalena lives with her three children in their own house. She has a business selling vegetables and also grows crops, although she does employ casual labourers to undertake the heavy work. At present she is sowing maize, and sees it necessary to seek a loan for the purchase of fertilizer and insecticides, as well as to pay the labourers. This loan will help her to produce the crop, part of which will be consumed and the rest sold. Magdalena hopes for a productive plantation, and that the harvest will be plenty to feed her family and also to generate a good income.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.
loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbons de bois, au marché de HEDZRANAWOE, Abra a 57ans. Mariée à un employé à l’Université de Lomé, elle sollicite ce  deuxième montant pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois à KANTE et ANIE.   Elle est maman de 03 enfants et  a commencé en 1990.
texts.en: A retailer of charcoal at the Hédzranawoé market, Abra is 57 years old. Married to an employee of the University of Lomé, she is seeking her second loan to buy bags of charcoal in Kanté and Anie. She is the mother of three children and started this business in 1990.

loans.use: To purchase a new covering or other parts for his ger in order to repair it.
loans.name: Khurelchuluun

texts.en:
Khurelchuluun is 27 years old.  Since last year, he has been working as a plumber in a company. When he has days off, he runs a taxi business. 

Khurelchuluun lives with his father and younger brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger--a Mongolian nomadic tent--which is broken and became stale during the last July heavy rains. Khurelchuluun needs to change the covering, and possibly other parts, of his ger.  He is taking a loan to purchase a new covering for the ger or other parts needed to make repairs to it. 

Khurelchuluun plans to marry his girlfriend within the year, if he can.

loans.use: to construct an irrigation dam for her farm alongside her salon business.
loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en: Mwikali has been operating her salon and farming for the last twenty years in Makueni town. She is 49 years old and married to Julius. They have five children. She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. She has been loaned 30,000 Kenyan shillings. She intends to use the loan to construct a dam for irrigating her farm alongside her salon business. In the future, Mwikali hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy building materials to start her garage-renting business.
loans.name: Dagvadulam

texts.en:
Dagvadulam, 47, has been working as a doctor for 19 years, and during this time, she could save not enough for her family. She lives with her husband and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia, and owns a small piece of land in the slum district. Her husband is a driver in a private transportation company.
 
Dagvadulam and her husband want to start another business that can increase their family income, and they decided to build a rental garage on her land. It will be a very beneficial business in Mongolia, because Mongolian winter is freezing cold and every car needs a garage with heating. She plans to build a garage to hold four or five cars, and she will gain benefits from this in November. 

Now she needs some money to build her garage. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy the building materials to start her garage-renting business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline and maintenance
loans.name: Stephen Vincent

texts.en: Stephen Vincent is 24 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. For the past 2 years he has been running a transportation business, providing motorela and habal-habal services. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline and maintenance.  He is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a second hand motorcycle for his use.
loans.name: On

texts.en:
Mr. On is a 43-year-old married man who has been living in Kompong Thom province with his wife and five single children. He owns a business of selling firewood, which helps him balance his household expenses. His wife doesn’t go out to sell the firewood with him, but instead she raises some pigs at home to help support their living. One of On's sons normally helps him to haul his firewood products to sell in a local market. 

On wants to have a motorcycle for using in the family because he spends a lot of money to hire a motor-taxi service to go anywhere he wants. However, he doesn’t have enough capital to buy one. Now he is seeking a loan from Kiva to buy a second hand motorcycle for his use. In the future, he hopes he’ll be able to build a food store for his wife, selling a variety of products for more income.

loans.use: to pay for his brother-in-law's medical treatment.
loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es empleado; trabaja en un taller de costura y su esposa trabaja con ayudante de cocina. El crédito lo requiere para cubrir un tratamiento medico para su cuñado quien sufrió un accidente automovilístico y no tiene ninguna clase de seguro laboral. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de  Pasankeri en la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solícita un crédito en IMPRO, y por el carácter social se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is employed. He works at a sewing workshop while his wife works as a kitchen assistant. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for the medical treatment for his brother-in-law, who suffered an automobile accident and does not have any type of work insurance. Juan lives at home with his parents in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO. Because of his social character, his loan is being referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons.
loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela tiene 67 años de edad y vive en una aldea de Choloma. Ella ha estado felizmente casada con su esposo José por los últimos 42 años. La pareja tiene 6 hijos mayores. Actualmente vive un hijo y la madre de Graciela con la pareja. Graciela y su hijo sostienen económicamente al hogar. 

Graciela ha ganado la vida como diseñadora. Ella ha dedicado 30 años a este oficio. Antes trabajaba en una casa de modas pero decidió empezar algo propio para poder apoyar su familia. Ella quería dar una buena educación a sus hijos. Lo logré, dado sus esfuerzos en el negocio y a través de financiamiento que ella consiguió para ampliarlo. Ya está en el cuarto ciclo solicitando un préstamo de L5000 para la compra de tela, hilos, zippers y botones para poder continuar elaborando prendas como pantalones, faldas y vestidos. 

Además de educar a sus hijos, Graciela logré tener una casa propia. Ahora los desafíos que enfrenta ella son el cuidado de su madre y su esposo. José ya es minusválido y no puede trabajar como antes y la madre de Graciela está muy viejita. Espera que su negocio continúe siendo un éxito para poder cubrir  sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Graciela, age 67, lives in the village of Cholomo.  She has been happily married to her husband, José, for the last 42 years. The couple has six grown children.  One of her children and Graciela’s mother currently live with the couple.  Graciela and her son financially support the household.

Graciela has made a living as a designer.  She has devoted herself to this profession for 30 years.  She used to work in a fashion house, but she decided to start something of her own in order to be able to support her family.  She wanted to give her children a good education.  She achieved this through her efforts in the business and the loans that she got in order to expand her business.

She is now in her fourth cycle, and she is requesting a loan for 5,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons in order to be able to continue making garments like pants, skirts, and dresses.

In addition to educating her children, Graciela managed to have her own house.  The challenges that she now faces are taking care of her mother and her husband.  José is now disabled, and he is not able to work as he previously did.  Graciela’s mother is very old.

She hopes that her business continues being successful in order to be able to cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business
loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Fedila works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vulcanizing. Fedila is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Fedila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale
loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Christine is 23 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Christine has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale and will help Christine to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Christine's future prospects by helping her to learn how to become a better entrepreneur.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics
loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 38 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Château de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente des coques d’arachide grillés, tubercules (racines de  sebenikou), grains (riz et niébé), produits cosmétiques (savons, crèmes à lèvres et à peau) et pagnes wax. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire.
 Madame Bayta (femme au teint clair assise en 2ème position sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de produits de beauté de toutes sortes au marché Château de Ségou. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter cinq cartons de tubes de crème à peau, une centaine de crème à lèvre et deux cartons de savon. Elle se ravitaille en produits cosmétiques au grand marché de Ségou et parfois à Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente au comptant, à détail et à crédit, à domicile et au marché Château, à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Bayta compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer. 
Elle a pour objectif à l’instar des autres membres du groupe de pérenniser son petit commerce dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi group are mostly married women living in monogamous families, who are on average 38 years old with six children. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and became acquainted through kinship, marriage and their income-generating activities at Ségou's Castle market.

Group members retail grilled peanuts, tubers (sebenikou roots ), grains (rice and cowpeas), cosmetics (soaps, body milk and lip balm) and pagne wax (colorful West-African fabric).

In order to increase their business assets, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second joint credit loan.

Mrs. Bayt (the light-skinned woman sitting in the second position on the photo from left to right) is a major retailer of all kinds of beauty products at the Castle Ségou market.

She plans to use her loan to buy five boxes of skin cream tubes, a hundred lip balm tubes and two cartons of soap. She gets her cosmetic supplies from Ségou's great market and sometimes from Bamako. She retails for cash and credit, from her home and at the Castle market, to a predominantly female clientèle.

Mrs. Bayt expects this loan will enable her to attain average monthly profits of 22,000 FCFA she will use to reinvest in the business and take care of household needs.

Her purpose is the same as that of the other group members: to sustain her business in partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to use as capital to buy recycled materials for her business.
loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok, 34, has been living together with her husband and three young kinds in a small cottage in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. Sok has spent most her lifetime working in crop husbandry. She grows rice crops twice a year as she gets enough water from a stream that flows through the village. Besides farming, she spends some time walking through the commune to  collect and buy recycled materials from the villagers, and then she sells them to her frequent customers for a profit.

 Presently, she has run out of capital to invest in her business. For this reason, she is asking for some funds from Kiva, through HKL, to keep as capital for her recycled materials business. This loan will make it possible for her to improve her living conditions. She is very happy and thanks all lenders.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the grinding mill and clothes for resale.
loans.name: Golden Group
