texts.en:
Memory is a 35-year-old lady who is married and has three children, ages 4 months, 5 years, and 15 years. Only one goes to school. She also has two other dependents who are her sister's children and who live with her. Her husband helps out in her business. 

Memory has two grinding mills in Masvingo Town, as well as a business of buying and selling clothes. She buys her products from South Africa. Memory has been in business for two years and has three employees who work for her. The main challenge she faces in her business is fluctuation in exchange rates, which affects pricing of her products. She has a vision of expanding her business to have more grinding mills around Masvingo Town, as well as owning a boutique in the central business district. With the the profits from her business, she will be able to take better care of her growing family.

loans.use: to invest in buying small animals and seeds to plant onions.
loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de agricultura y de la crianza, compra y venta animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia desea comprar en esta ocasión 20 cuyes y 4 pares de gallinas, la socia también invierte su credito en la compra de semillas de  verduras como cebollas china, también comprara 20 cuyes y 4 pares de gallina que hace un total de 8 gallinas, la socia es una mujer muy trabjadora y desea a futuro terminar de construir su vivienda y tambien que le vaya muy bien con la venta de sus productos especialmente de la cebolla china. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para sembrar cebolla china.
texts.en: This borrower is continuing with her business of farming as well as raising and selling small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. On this occasion, she would like to buy 20 guinea pigs and 4 pairs of chickens. She will also invest her loan in buying seeds for vegetables such as green onions. She will also buy 20 guinea pigs and 4 pairs of chickens, making a total of 8 chickens. The borrower is a very hard-working woman, and in the future she would like to finish constructing her house. She also hopes the sales of her products will go very well, especially the green onions. The borrower is requesting the loan to invest in buying seeds to plant green onions.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fish and seafood.
loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
El socio Hipolito se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pescados y mariscos,el socio vende en un mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los pescados y mariscos.El socio colicita el creditoa para comprar pescados y mariscos al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Hipolito continues selling fish and seafood, which he sells at a market from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  This work helps him to get his family ahead.  His dream is to have a local where he can sell his fish and seafood.  He is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale fish and seafood.  He is happy to receive the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed
loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 35 years old and has 3 children. She lives in Lintugop, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She owns and operates a business venture breeding and selling chickens to earn a living. She's been in this business for 11 years and earns 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from the business. She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase chicken feed.

Helen joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She simply hopes for business improvements and to repay all her debts.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplement
loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is a 52 year old married woman with two children; ages fifteen and thirteen. She hails from Cortes, Bohol.She had been in the hog raising business for three years.She plans to use the loan to purchase additional piglets, feed and pig supplement. In the future, Avelina would like to expand her business to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 10 nos of Goats
loans.name: Moriyam Group

texts.en:
Moriyam Group which was perverse in the year 2015 in Balbeda village, in Kalahandi district, Odisha, India with 10 active village self-dependent women, with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of concerned group have their own professional and business. Sabita one of them who taken a great role for her development and their group members livelihood improvement. The concerned lady is standing in the first row of third person from right hand side with raised hand in the photo is Sabita. She is about 34 years old and living with her small family as she has husband only two children. 
Sabita has been engaged with Goatery Business at her own home of Balbeda village since 8 years also her husband helping to promote. Through concerned business she earns a monthly income of 7,200 INR. Her opinion is that, through concerned income is not sufficient to maintain her family, with sufficient surplus which total investment in the business and materialize her dreams. So to get more and more income by expansion of her business, she planned to improve her business in the course of loan, which resulting taken the loan & will purchase 10 Nos of goats from local market. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of a house and to provide better education to her children.

The other 09 members of her group are also smart at their professional like vegetable vending, milk business, popped rice business, paddy, general store and transport business and with this loan, hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: Turn their small store into a bakery
loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has been running this store out of her home for about 2 years. Prior to running this business she worked as a seamstress but she did not generate enough income to support her family. She and her husband decided to open it when he was fired from his job. With their savings they invested in products and they have been slowly growing these past years.

Seeing as this is their main source of income they have decided to expand their business. Her husband just finished a baking course and is very optimistic about starting a bakery. They have been making bread for a short time period and they have just invested in a display case. They need the loan for the raw materials necessary to start producing large amounts of baked goods.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and sewing materials
loans.name: Pe'a

texts.en:
Pe'a, 59, is a talented seamstress who is the sole provider for her family.  Her children are grown, but because her children were unable to complete their education due to lack of family funds, they are still living at home with no jobs or stable future.

Pe'a is applying for a loan of $1,000 to enable her to purchase materials and supplies in order to enable her to open a small business selling clothing and performing seamstress services.

She wants to build some savings so that when she passes on her kids will have something to fall back on.

loans.use: To buy new machines
loans.name: Parwana

texts.en: Parwana lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all the members of her family and she Is married. She is a tailor and she wants to help support her family. She took her 4th cycle group loan and bought all the materials that she needs for her business. Now she wants to take anther loan to buy new equipment like sew machines and a desk for herself to make her work easier. She is very happy with this loan because she can help her husband support the family. She would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: increase her capital for her fruit-selling business
loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung and her husband live with their four children: 22, 19,12, and 9 years old. The two youngest children are in school (6th and 3rd class). The others work as day laborers. Dung's husband has a liver complaint and their oldest daughter has nephritis.

They have 2000 square meters of land for cultivating rice, and Dung sells fruit at the market. All told, their average income is $11 per month per person. Dung wants to borrow $50 to increase her capital for her fruit-selling business. They will pay back $10 per month over 5 months.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine and materials
loans.name: Owokhan

texts.en: "There is a positive difference in my business and my life," explained Miss Owokhan F.. She has a fashion shop, is 29 years old, single, and lives in Benin City, Edo State. She wants to buy an additional sewing machine and materials for her shop. With this loan, she will be able to serve her customers better. She has 6 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy two calves and finance medical treatment.
loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is a selfless and dedicated mother of four. Everything was going well for her and her loving husband Fermin. They raised dairy cattle and worked together to provided for their children. Five years ago Fermin began to suffer from heart problems and since then he has been laid up in bed unable to work. Cecilia took up the reins and through much hard work they now own seven cows. The sale of their milk supports the family. Cecilia would like to buy two calves and increase the family income so they can buy Fermin the medicine he needs and get him medical treatment. She is counting on your generous support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Cecilia es una abnegada y dedicada madre D. cuatro hijos menores.DesD. que formó su familia junto a Fermín su inseparable y amado esposo todo iba bien, ambos se dedicaron a la ganadería y siempre lucharon por brindarles lo mejor a sus queridos hijos; sin embargo desgraciadamente hace cinco años él enfermó del corazón y tiene que permanecer postrado en caM. sin poder hacer ningún esfuerzo físico, entonces Cecilia decidió tomar las riendas D. su hogar y se hizo cargo sola D. su familia y puso mayor empeño en su actividad D. crianza D. animales en respuesta a tan dedicada labor ahora ya cuenta con siete vacas, D. las que obtiene leche y venD. para incrementar el ingreso económico en su hogar.Su deseo es adquirir dos vaquitas más y con la comercialización D. la leche busca ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar los medicamentos necesarios e iniciar un tratamiento con el objetivos D. mejorar la situación D. salud que padece su querido compañero que tanta falta le hace.Para lograr sus objetivos esta madre trabajadora recurre a tu generoso aporte y solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. iniciar pronto sus planes.

loans.use: Increase stock
loans.name: Angélica Adriano

texts.pt:
Angélica Adiano C. is a 45-year-old married mother of 5. She lives in the Magoanine neighborhood and runs her business at the local market. She entered the program in May of 2007 with a loan amount of 5,000 MT. She sells vegetables and some essential retail products such as rice, sugar, seasonings, etc. She is seeking a loan of 5,000 MT to increase her stock.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Angélica Adiano C. tem 45 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 5 filhos. Vive no bairro Magoanine e tem o seu negócio no mercado do mesmo bairro. Entrou para o programa em maio de 2007 com um empréstimo de 5.000MT. Vende Legumes e alguns produtos de primeira necessidade a retalho como arroz, açúcar, tempereos, etc. Vai tomar um empréstimo de 5.000Mt para aumentar o stock do negócio.

loans.use: Honorata requires capital to undergo some repairs in the boarding house in addition to stocking ingredients necessary for the preparation of her dishes.  Only in this way will she be able to receive a greater number of diners and generate what is necessary to satisfy her family's needs.
loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata Q. de Poroma is married and has two children. She is considered an expert cook and is the owner of a family boarding house on 16th of July Avenue in the city of El Alto. She has been in business for 4 years, which all started the moment she was able to acquire a restaurant thanks to some contacts. Currently, Honorata has a boarding house with a restaurant that is well equipped, and in fact has opened a some telephone booths within her restaurant for the convenience of her diners. Despite all of this, Honorata requires capital to undergo some repairs in the boarding house in addition to stocking ingredients necessary for the preparation of her dishes. Only in this way will she be able to receive a greater number of diners and generate what is necessary to satisfy her family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Honorata Q. de Poroma, casada, y madre de dos hijos, es considerada una experta cocinera, y dueña de una pensión familiar que atiende en la Av. 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto, ya son 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, y todo comenzó el momento que gracias a unos contactos, se adjudicaron la atención de un restaurante. Actualmente Honorata tiene una pensión restaurante muy bien equipado, e incluso a dispuesto la apertura de unas cabinas de llamadas dentro de su propio restaurante, para mayor comodidad de sus comensales. Pese a todo eso, Honorata precisa de capital para realizar algunas refacciones dentro de la pensión, como también la provisión de insumos para la preparación de sus platos, solo de esta manera podrá acoger a un mayor número de comensales y generará lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

loans.use: To build a poultry house
loans.name: Dorothy's Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Dorothy S..  She is currently in the business of Poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to  build a poultry house.  Dorothy is 49 years old and is a widow.    She has 5 children ranging from age 14 to 31 and her children go to school.  Each week, Dorothy makes approximately UGX 170,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to to pay school fees for her daughter.  She has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda previously in the amount of UGX 350,000 in order to invest in the poultry business and the loan was paid back on time.  She is joined in her small group by Jane N., Joyce N., Jane N., and Joweria K..  Jane N. is currently in the business of fried edibles and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to  buy a charcoal stove.  Joyce N. is currently runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to  buy more stock.  Jane N. is currently in the business of selling juice and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to  buy a fridge.  Joweria K. is currently in the business of cloth selling and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to  buy more clothes.

loans.use: To add more machinery to stationery shop
loans.name: Ocheng Iii B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah M.. She is currently in the stationery and secretarial services business and is requesting a loan to buy more stationery. Sarah is 47 years old and is a widow. She has 3 children ranging from age 19 to 26 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 65000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy reams of papers and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Grace T., Hajara N., Cathy N., and Maria K.. Grace T. has a business in tailoring and wants to purchase a sewing machine. Hajajra N. is currently operating a business in poultry keeping and wants a loan to renovate her chicken house. Cathy N. operates a business of poultry farming and wants to buy broiler chicks. Maria K. is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to purchase chicken mash (feed).

loans.use: Purchase a taco cart.
loans.name: Rosa Martha

texts.es:
Rosa Martha sells steamed tacos and also sells cleaning products. She’s had the taco business for seven years and conducts it from her house’s porch. She started selling cleaning products two years ago. She has three children. Currently, they are married and no longer live with her. When she began selling tacos, she did so in order to help her husband, a builder, pay for her children’s education expenses. Thanks to her effort and hard work, she has been able to progress.

Currently, she is requesting a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to purchase a cart from which she will sell tacos since now she does it from a table on her porch. With your help, Rosa will be able to give her customers better service and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Martha se dedica a vender tacos a vapor y también venta de artículos de limpieza, el negocio de los tacos lo tiene hace 7 años lo hace en el porche de su casa, y la venta de artículos de limpieza lo inicio hace 2 años, ella tiene 3 hijos actualmente ellos ya están casados y no viven con ella. Cuando inicio la venta de tacos lo hizo para poder ayudar con los gastos escolares de sus hijos a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil en una constructora. Gracias a su empeño y arduo trabajo ha podido progresar.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un carrito donde instalarse y vender los tacos, ya que ahora lo hace en una mesa que coloca en el porche de su casa. Con tu ayuda rosa podrá darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business
loans.name: Jamila's Ushindi Group

texts.en:
Jamila is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, aged 10, 7 and 4 years old. Jamila is a clothes seller, which she started doing in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Jamila has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mariam, who has a business dealing in food sales.

loans.use: Stocking her new sales space
loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth has a great vocation to serve people: from when she was very young she wanted to study medicine but for financial reasons she was unable to do this. However, this didn’t deter Ruth and instead she completed Pharmaceutical studies and she decided to open a site, hiring a small pharmacy after many years of selling medicines door-to-door. Now she has grand projects in mind and is planning to open another branch. Her request for a loan is because she wants to stock this new space with the best-quality medicines in her country.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Ruth, tiene la gran vocación de servir a las personas, tuvo desde muy joven el deseo de estudiar la carrera de medicina que no pudo cumplir por motivos económicos pero su situación no la detuvo a Rut y estudió la carrera técnica de farmacia y se decidió a abrir en un local alquilado una pequeña botica después de muchos años de vender medicinas de manera ambulante. Ahora tiene grandes proyectos en mente y está planeando abrir una sucursal. Su solicitud es porque desea implementar este nuevo espacio con las mejores medicinas de su país y las de mejor calidad.

loans.use: To buy a cart, which would allow Mr. Ming Pun to transport the coal and thus provide a convenient door-to-door service to his customers.
loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal C. is a villager in Ang Tunloap Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and grocer. Her husband, Mr. Ming Pun, is a farmer and coal seller. Mr. Ming Pun would like to improve his business by buying a cart, which would allow him to transport the coal and, thus, provide a convenient door-to-door service to his customers. In order to be able to afford this expense, Mrs. Sophal C. asked for a loan.

Mrs. Sophal C. is 51 and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another assists Mrs. Sophal C. in the grocery business. The youngest one is enrolled in school. Previously, Mrs. Sophal C. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers and a pig for breeding. Mrs. Sophal C. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: Purchase of well-balanced, nutritional feed for her livestock.
loans.name: Saida

texts.es:
Saida is a woman with a great desire to advance for the benefit of her family. She has a livestock stable that provides her with income and, most of all, the ability to improve her family’s financial situation. She is the mother to a three-year old son, who is her reason for being. Ten years ago she decided to use a small amount of capital to buy two bulls which she raised and fattened. She was then able to sell them at a higher price which allowed her, over time, to increase her working capital. She enjoys her daily tasks of caring for her cows and bulls, and her goal is to one day have a stable of some renown within her valley. Even though she experienced a decrease in business due to high meat prices, she is not to be dissuaded. She has the strength to carry on which is why she is seeking a loan to invest in purchasing well-balanced feed for her livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Saida es una mujer con muchos deseos de progresar por el bienestar de su familia, tiene un establo ganadero que le permite tener ingresos considerables y sobre todo mejorar la situación económica de su familia, es madre de un pequeño de 3 años que es su razón de vivir.Hace 10 años decidió comprar, con un pequeño capital, dos toretes a los cuales hizo crecer y engordar, pudo vender a un más alto precio, esto le permitió, con el tiempo, acrecentar su capital de trabajo.Ella disfruta diariamente el cuidado de sus vacas y toros, su meta es tener un establo ganadero reconocido en su valle y aunque atravesó una baja en su negocio por el bajo costo de carne de res, esto no la detuvo, tiene fuerzas para seguir adelante, por ello, solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus vacas.

loans.use: To purchase more guinea pigs and fertilizers to grow alfalfa
loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 children. She's a hard worker.

She raises guinea pigs and has been doing so for over the past 5 years. Her house has become a farm but it's good because her house is big enough to accomodate all her guinea pigs. She also grows alfalfa in her land to feed her animals. She takes good care and feeds them very well so that they are ready to be sold every weekend. The hardest part about her job is the transportation part because she has to be able to transport many at once. In the past, she has had to overcome many difficulties like the time when she lost all of her guinea pigs due to illness. She's currently getting ready to start the alfalfa season.

Fanny works because she wants to and needs to help her family. She needs to take care of the well-being of her children and her husband. She's requesting this loan because she would like to buy guinea pigs in pairs so that they can multiply and to buy fertilizer to grow alfalfa

Translated by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, a Kiva Volunteer.

Fanny tiene 36 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Es un persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a la crianza de cuyes en su granja desde hace 5 años, aprovecha los amplios espacios que tiene en su casa, además siembra alfalfa en sus propias tierras para la alimentación de sus animales, lleva un control minucioso del alimento que les da a sus cuyes, de esa manera están listos para su comercialización generalmente los fines de semana. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es transportar los cuyes en grande cantidades, pero eso lo va superando poco a poco, en el pasado tuvo que enfrentar una gran perdida cuando sus cuyes fueron atacados por una enfermedad, ahora se está levantando y preparando nuevamente sus campos de cultivo para la alfalfa. Fanny trabaja porque está motivada por su familia, ella quiere ver superarse a sus hijos y el bienestar de su esposo. Solicita este préstamo porque invertirá en la compra de parejas de cuyes, para repoblar su granja y también comprar fertilizantes que utilizará en sus campos de alfalfa.

loans.use: Build a kiosk to improve sales.
loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: Amalia vende refrescos en un puesto del mercado Bellavista, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo, y gracias a este negocio compró su motocarro, el mismo que es manejado y cuidado por su esposo Hugo, quien es técnico en mecánica de motores pesados. Ambos tienen como responsabilidad a sus dos hijos, los cuales estudian y esperan que algún día sean profesionales. Para lo que Amalia requiere el préstamo es para mandar a construir un kiosco, y así mejorar la atención y tener una mayor comodidad de venta.
texts.en:
Amalia sells soft drinks at a stall on the Bellavista market. She has been doing this for a long time and thanks to this business she has been able to buy a motorcar which is driven and taken care of by her husband, Hugo, who is a mechanic of heavy engines. They are both responsible for their two children who are students and hope to become professionals in the future. The loan requested will be spend on building a kiosk and thus improve service and obtain more comfort for the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to her work area.
loans.name: Darling Scarleth

texts.es:
La señora Darling G. se dedica al negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos en el mercado central de Chinandega donde atiende desde hace 8 años. Es importante destacar que hoy en día el tramo de la señora G. requiere de inversión por lo que debe prestar mejores condiciones para brindar el servicio al cliente.

Es esta la razon por loa cual la señora Darling ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obeteenr el credito qeu le permita mejorar las condiciones de su negocio para lograr salir adelante en esta labor.
texts.en:
Darling G. is in the business of making and selling food in the central market of Chinandega, where she has been working for the past 8 years. It is important to note that today the area in which Mrs. G. works needs an investment so that she can provide better conditions for serving her customers. This is the reason why Darling has looked for help from Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will allow her to make improvements to her business so she can move forward with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crop seeds for growing to support her field.
loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally P., the group leader, is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables on a plot of land.  Her husband, Mr. Nhoek Sok, is a construction worker. Mrs. Phally P. is 35-year-old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young.  She does not earn enough to support her household. Thus, Mrs. Phally P. requests a loan to buy crop seeds to support her field.
 
The village group consists of sixteen members living in Toul Tbaeng village in KaK. Province.  The members plan to use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans (the rest of have monthly payment loans). These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy materials for a resort reconstruction project
loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav is married with two children. Their family lives in Uzhgorod, Western Ukraine. Yaroslav worked in construction and developed a passion for that work. Today he owns a manufacturing and processing workshop where he makes wooden windows and doors for local resorts. His processing machines make his business more efficient. He also uses his shop to repair cars, another source of income. His business provides jobs for ten employees, which is very important during these times of financial crisis and unemployment in the Ukraine.

Yaroslav has been running this business for 20 years. Yaroslav is seeking a 5000 Grivna (about $875) loan to purchase all necessary raw materials for a reconstruction project in the mountain resort town of Tyachiv. One of Yaroslav’s biggest dreams is to generate enough income to afford to take his whole family for a vacation. He is hoping this additional assistance will help him earn extra income and make his dream come true.

loans.use: Assortment of clothing articles and new seasonal wares
loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak S. has been a client of our program since 2006, and she describes herself as a very serious borrower.  She has never delayed repayments and makes them regularly and accurately.  Muborak works in the commercial service and trade industry; she specifically trades underwear and children wear.  She works together with her son who sells in Kyrgyzstan and Istaravshan.  

Muborak is married with three children; the oldest son helps her in business.  Mrs. S. Muborak asks Kiva lenders for the financial support of her business, and she asks for a business development loan of 2000 STJ for eight months.  The loan will increase her assortment of clothing articles, especially new seasonal wares.  She thanks Kiva for its support.

loans.use: To buy plastic bottles, cardboard, used clothing and so on to resell by the kilogram.
loans.name: Maria A.

texts.es:
La señora María vive en alquiler con su mama y su hijita en la calle D de la zona las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que ella realiza es la venta de material reciclable, ella compra botellas desechables, cartón, ropa usada, alambres y otros los cuales los separa y los vende por Kilo. Con esta actividad ella trabaja casi 10 años y es su única fuente generadora de ingresos.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más materiales, seleccionarlos y venderlos  y así poder mantener este negocio.

Es cliente  de Impro desde el año 2006 y su historial de pagos es muy bueno por lo que consideramos que  puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
María rents her home and lives with her mother and her young daughter on "D" street in the "Las Lomas" neighbourhood of La Paz. She sells recyclables: she buys disposable bottles, cardboard, used clothing, wire and other materials which she separates and sells by the kilogram. She has been doing this for 10 years; this is her only source of income. She will use this loan to increase her working capital, to buy more materials, sort them and sell them and thus stay in business. María has been a client of Impro since 2006 and her repayment history is very good which is why we have decided that she qualifies for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of $925 so that she can buy huge sacks of chile peppers.
loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina  es socia del Bancomunal Jesús de Praga.
Paulina es conviviente, tiene 29 años, un hijo de 9 años, que esta en el colegio estatal.    
No pudo estudiar por que a los 14 años  se enfermo de ataques de epilepsia, comenzó trabajando en casas haciendo de todo, hasta que consiguió un trabajo pelando ají 30 kilos diarios. Se dedica a comprar ají y los pela, y reparte en el mercado.   
Desde que esta en Finca pudo empezar su negocio, y le esta yendo bien 
Necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, para  la compra de sacos de ají, en la parada. 
El sueño de Paulina es cambiar de negocio, poner un taller de  mecánica, pintado de carro.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the communal bank Jesús de Praga. She lives with her husband and she is 29 years old. She has a son that is 9 years old and he goes to a public school. She was not able to complete her education because when she was 14 she became ill with Epilepsy. She started to work in private homes doing all kind of work. Then she got a job peeling 30 kilograms of chile peppers a day. She makes a living buying chile peppers, peeling them and taking them to the marketplaces to be sold. Since she has been in the group Finca, she has been able to start her own business and she is doing very well. She needs a loan of $925 so that she can buy huge sacks of chile peppers. Paulina's dream is to be able to change businesses one day and to start a shop that specializes in painting cars.

(Translated by Nathan of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off the loan on his house
loans.name: Jorge Sergio

texts.es: El sr. Jorge es un cliente muy puntual, trabaja con su movilidad, vive en una habitación muy sencilla, tiene dos hijos que viven en el Brasil con su mamá, lo visitan muy poco, ya que ellos estudian allá. Se le presentó la oportunidad de comprar la casita donde actualmente vive, y la está comprando, el crédito será para cancelar el saldo pendiente. Es una persona muy responsable. Por la zona donde vive, Pampahasi, es muy conocido; por ello siempre tiene contratos de transporte de personas.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge is a very punctual client, working with his automobile. He lives in a very simple room, has two children who live in Brazil with their mother, and who visit him very infrequently because they are now studying there. The opportunity to buy the house he is living in has presented itself to him, and he is buying it. The loan he is asking for is to pay off the remaining balance on the house. He is a very responsible man. He is very well known in his neighborhood of Pampahasi, and for this reason his taxi service always has business.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow
loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok N., 57, has been planting a variety of crops on her farmland located in Pursat Province for years. She grows rice, cabbages, morning glory, and cucumbers, and she will sell these to the buyers when they are matured. Besides her farm work, she is also a good homemaker who cooks tasty food and cares for the children. She is married to Horn, 60, who works with her in the business operation. She has 10 children and seven of them are married and live independently.

In the past, the family always hired a cow for their farming business and they now hope to own a cow, but they lack the money to make that possible. Therefore, Sok N. is looking for a loan to be able to buy a cow. (Mrs. N.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, meat, vegetables and others
loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal MANUELA RAMOS, en el Distrito D. MAZO-CRUZ, Provincia  del Collao, Departamento D. puno. Ella tien 56 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 7 hijos y ella cuenta con estudios primarios (2do. grado).
Tambièn nos comenta que trabaja hace 12 años con Manuela Ramos y es una D. las socias fundadoras D. su Banco Comunal, asi mismo nos refiere que pudo preparar mas productos (alimento) con el apoyo que obtubo D. Manuela Ramos. Inició sus préstamos con un monto D. 300.00 soles.  Está muy agradecida por la oprtunidad que brinda a las mujeres.
Por el momento ella requiere D. un prestamo D. 3000.oo soles , el cual le permitira anpliar su restaurante para poder atender en mejores condiciones a sus clientes.  Tambien refiere que conprara los productos necesarios por mayor ya que  D. esta manera tendrá mejores gananccias.
Su deseo es continuar trabajando para su vejez, también nos refiere que lo que mas le gusta D. su grupo son los encuentros deportivos y sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the community bank Manuela Ramos in the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao province, department of Puno. She is 56 years old, married, has seven kids and completed a second-graD. education. She tells us that she has worked with Manuela Ramos for 12 years and is one of the founding members of her community bank. Consequently, she was able to prepare more products (food) with the help that she received from Manuela Ramos. She began her loans with a total of 300.00 soles ($100 USD). She is very thankful for the opportunity it brings women. For the moment, she needs a loan of 3000.00 soles ($975 USD), which will allow her to expand her restaurant to be able to serve her customers in better conditions. Also she will buy necessary products in bulk, and in this way will have better profits. Her wish is to continue working for her old age. Also, she tells us that what she likes best about her group are the sporting matches and her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to help four small businesses expand
loans.name: Murtaza Loan Group

texts.en:
Muniran baji is 30 years old, married and widely known as a very hard-working woman. She runs a business in her house that makes clothing, and has a large number  of customers, including many of her neighbors. Muniran baji’s husband runs a grocery store. People in their community know the couple very well and speak highly of them. Muniran baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s shop.

She leads a loan group that has three other members. Saima baji wants a loan to buy supplies -- such as wires, switchboards and switches -- for her electric shop. Kishwar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Gulzaran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her store.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Additional capital for fruits and vegetables vending
loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Forty-five years old, married and blessed with six children who are studying in primary and secondary school, hardworking and determined Mrs. Helen A. is from Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where her husband is a farmer.

Because of the family's abject poverty, Helen started selling fruits and vegetables to their neighbors, relatives and friends. Not having enough capital to start a sari-sari store, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last August 2008 to access a loan for additional capital. Her heart’s desire is to send their children to college and see them become successful in life.

loans.use: purchase of silver
loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Mrs. Clementina Insfran V.D. P. is 60 years old and has been a widow for ten years.  She has three older children; Rossana is a teacher, Marlene is a lawyer, and Jimmy is in his third year of law school.  

They used to have a small grocery store in their house that she could not maintain very well.  As time passed, and with the help of the loans given to her by the Fundación Paraguaya, Clementina began selling jewelry and also working as a cook in a local hospital in the city Areguá.  She has various clients for her food sales in the hospital.  

In the future she would like to open a general store in her home as she will retire soon from working at the hospital.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 7 hectares
loans.name: Sabougnouma 6 Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma  6 est un regroupement de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles polygames à Djambougou  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé,  sous préfecture  de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leurs troisièmes collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir 7 hectares.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma 6 group is composed of married women who average 32 years of age and 3 children. They live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. They mainly grow peanuts and millet. They are seeking their third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans ended without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 7 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 85) per campaign.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To accrue a larger quantity of pork to sell
loans.name: Tieng

texts.en: Tieng R. currently retails pork that she buys in bulk, on credit, from her suppliers, who have their own pig farm and slaughtering operation. Tieng R. typically generates an income of $6 per day to meet her family’s daily living expenses. Tieng R. is 41 years old and a single mother. She was married but divorced her husband years ago and has no child. She lives with her older mother, who stays at home to be responsible for the daily housework. Since a national festival is coming, Tieng R. has many regular customers who need to order her pork for their cooking. To satisfy her customer's requirements, Tieng R. has decided to seek a loan for capital to accrue a larger quantity of pork to sell to those people.

loans.use: personal use
loans.name: Indira

texts.es:
La socia se llama Indira, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco, vive en el barrio de los andenes, en el distrito de huanchaq.

Nuestra socia es soltera y alterna sus diferentes actividades con su empleo, ella es ayudante de cocina en un restaurante, ella manifiesta que esta práctica le permite aprender mucho del trabajo en la cocina, ella aspira a ser cocinara de algún restaurante, por el momento ella solicita el préstamo para poder adquirir algunos electrodomésticos y así poder ir pagando poco a poco al banco comunal de su sueldo mensual.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is named Indira. She is a native of the city of Cusco and lives in the Los Andenes neighborhood in the Huanchaq district. Indira is single and balances various activities with her job. She is a kitchen assistant and aspires to being a chef of a restaurant. For the moment, she is resquesting a loan to be able to acquire some appliances and will be able to pay the communal bank little by little with her monthly salary. Indira appreciates and values the loan being granted her in the established term.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business
loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes R. vive en el municipio de Armenia departamento Sonsonate.  A sus 69 años de edad continua trabajando y alberga en su casa a su hija ya mayor y sus nietos.
Desde ya hace varios años atrás, Mercedes administra una tienda y panadería ubicada en su propia casa, esta tienda se ha convertido en un espacio de recreación para sus nietos, a quienes cuida durante el día, mientras la madre de los niños trabaja. Mercedes solicita un préstamo para comprar cereales y bebidas para ampliar la mercadería de su panadería y aportar más a su extensa familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes R. lives in the town of Armenia, which is in the district of Sonsonate. At 69 years of age, she continues to work. She lives with her oldest daughter and her grandchildren.

Several years ago, Mercedes managed a grocery store and bakery from her own home. Since then the store has been converted into a recreational space for her grandchildren, whom she takes care of during the day while their mother is at work. Mercedes is requesting a loan to buy grains and beverages to increase the merchandise offered in her bakery so that she can provide additional support to her extended family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment for her unemployed son
loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok I., age 42, sells fresh fish in the busy market. As another source of income, she buys and sells used goods out of her home. In both businesses she can generate $4 per day to support her family's food requirements.

Sok I. has been married for years wI. four children who are single. One of her sons is a vehicle repairer. Her husband works as a supervisor of military policemen.

The fishing season is coming since the river is full of fish. Sok I. hopes to accumulate more profits for her family. That is why she requests a loan for her unemployed son's use, to buy equipment for fishing.

loans.use: Additional capital
loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita G. did not pursue her studies in college. She once worked as a maid in one of the rich family in Manila to help her parents earn a living. After many years of serving as a housemaid, she married Romeo G. and they are blessed with four children. They help each other to earn a living and support the studies of their children because they wanted them to become successful in the future. Her family lives peacefully in the village of Lactawan Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. 

Romeo, her husband, earns a daily income by operating a tricycle transport business. Because his business income was not sufficient, Merlita manages a tailoring business using her own knowledge and skills in sewing. She also raises hogs to provide her family with a better living. Her tailoring business is working well, but because she wants to improve and develop it, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 from KIVA lenders to use as additional business capital. She knows that the amount she is borrowing will be very beneficial in making her business productive some day.

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of goods and in the purchase of knives to cut meat
loans.name: Martina Martha

texts.es: Es cliente antigua, se encuentra atravesando la sexta secuencia trabajando junto a nuestra institucion, durante sus creditos nunca presento problema alguno demostrando en todo momento sera una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de seguir adelante.  Doña Martha tiene estabilidad domiciliaria ya que la misma vive en casa familiar con sus dos hijas.  El crédito será destinado en la compra de carne y en el cambio de cuchillos que son utilizados diariamente en su puesto de carniceria del cual es dueña y se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Yungas en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
She is an old client, and is now working for the sixth time with our institution. Over the course of her loans, she has never presented any problems, and she has proved herself to be a hard working woman with a desire to succeed. Sra. Martha has a stable home, as she lives with her two daughters. This loan will be used for the purchase of meat and knives that will be used daily in her butcher shop that she owns in the Yungas Market in the city center.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase piglets and feed and cattle for fattening
loans.name: Nemenia

texts.en:
Nemenia D. is an active 50-year-old business woman who dreams of making her hog-fattening (pig-raising) and cattle-fattening (cow-raising) businesses grow and become sustainable to be able to support the needs of her five children whose ages range from 14 to 26 years old. Her husband Manolito is as hard-working as she. Aside from being a government employee, he does fishing for additional income during free time and on the weekend.

Nemenia had also been supporting her husband’s fishing business through loans she received from ASHI. Out of the proceeds she will be getting from her businesses, she would like to purchase a motorized fishing boat for her husband in the future.

Nemenia understands life though she finds it tough to fight against poverty sometimes. Her loving and supportive children and husband give her reason to think creatively of ways to overcome adversities in life so that her children will experience a different kind of lifestyle after they graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell
loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 48 years old and married with nine children. Her husband is a drink distributor and he also supports the home. 

Esther sells for long hours to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her family. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She sells dried fish at retail prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more dried fish to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase 15 sheep and fodder
loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala H. is a 55-year-old married woman who lives with her four children and owns a small farm. She lives and works in a small village in the Southern part of Azerbaijan. Lala, together with her husband, have been running a business raising and selling sheep. She has 14 years of experience in this field.

Sheep raising and selling is a profitable business, and Lala has become a very successful businesswoman in a very short period. The income is enough to cover her family's needs, but as her children grow, covering family needs has become harder. So Lala is requesting a loan to expand her activities and purchase more sheep. With your help, Lala can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome
loans.name: Fuata

texts.en:
Fuata is 32 and single with no children.  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.    Fuata needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 35 talas or US $15 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Fuata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fuata's 1st loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

Overall Social Metric Score:               1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

 About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase more inventory
loans.name: Kateryna

texts.en:
Kateryna is married with three adult children. She sells children's clothing at the central market in Ivano-Frankovsk city. Kateryna started this business twelve years ago when she was dismissed from a radio factory that downsized. Today she has three locations where she and two of her employees sell the clothes. Their large assortment and low prices have attracted many repeat customers.

Kateryna would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and receive additional income.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business
loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en: Rodelia S. is married and is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Rodelia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Rodelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rodelia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell
loans.name: 02.08.1.8 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Thuy C. T. is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh hoa. Thuy is the leader of a seven-member group with a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.08.1.8 Nam Ngan. 

Thuy is married and has two grown children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock. WhiL. not the only means of generating revenue, raising cattL. for saL. is the main source of income for the business. Thuy has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Thuy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.963.500 VND from the Fund. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional baby livestock. The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  P. T. Gai is a 55 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

2.  N. T. Phuong is a 41 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3.  N. T. Thao is a 31 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

4.  D. T. Trinh (43) is a 33 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

5.  T. T. Bay (44) is a 34 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her general store.

6.  L. T. H. Thanh (45) is a 21 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business running a general store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional planks
loans.name: God Provision Group

texts.en:
God Provision' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Matthew R.. He is 27 years old and is married with 2 children, aged 9 months and 3 years old. The oldest child is in nursery school.  Matthew did not continue his education past the 7th  grade due to poverty.

He and his family live in the Old Road Gaye Town community, and he works nearby, opposite the John F. Kennedy Medical Center in Sinkor.
Matthew’s business is wood planks. He buys planks wholesale and sells retail to residents of Sinkor, not far from downtown Monrovia.
 
He has been running this business from a stall on the street for more than 13 years.  He hopes to own a shop in the near future.  Matthew started selling with 1,500 Liberian dollars, but now operates with 2,500 Liberian dollars in working capital.

He sells good planks to customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from him.  Matthew needs this loan to purchase additional planks.
He dreams of his family living in better conditions.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Matthew is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell
loans.name: Rono

texts.en:
Rono sells and supplies female and male clothing. She goes from office to office to sell clothes to her customers. She is very happy with the nature of her business because it gives her the opportunity to meet different people from different backgrounds. She started the business two years ago and has been successful. 

Rono wants her business to grow continuously, so she is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. With it she can sell more clothes, make more profit and save more for the future. Rono is 29 years old, married and her husband is a civil servant in Lagos State. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell
loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old; she is single and resides in Lagos State, Nigeria. She owns a salon at the front of her house where she styles people’s hair and sells hair accessories like hair extensions, cream and more to make a living. She loves doing this business as it gives her the opportunity to interact with other people from different backgrounds. Customers patronize her because of the good service she renders to them. The person appearing in the picture is one of her customers.

Elizabeth has been in the salon business for five years and she wants a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell and make more profit. With this business, she assists her siblings in meeting some of their financial needs. She promises to repay her loan by the due date. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for the financial assistance.

loans.use: Panties, bras, briefs, creams and make-up
loans.name: Unidos Para El Futuro Group

texts.en:
Yrene is the coordinator of the "Unidos Para el Futuro" (United for the Future) group and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti . Her group is located in the urban slums north of the capital where crime is rampant, running water is not potable, and electricity is unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Yrene is excited to be taking her third loan from Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. Yrene sells underwear and cosmetics. She will use her loan to buy bras, panties and briefs as well as creams and makeup to sell. She will use the profits to finish building her home and to save to buy a vehicle. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for sale
loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba E. is married. She has received junior high education.  Aba sells slippers and shoes, moving from one house to another at Abura. She was on her way to sell her goods when she was photographed. Her husband is a driver. 

 Aba uses the income she is able to acquire from her sales to help her husband pay for their accommodations and utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more slippers for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Aba plans to save to buy a shop to trade in.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers
loans.name: Anonymous
